text: My 5 stars are specifically for the quality of the food, the meal was phenomenal. Amazing flavor and a very large portion. A tad bit expensive but what can you expect from a great quality restaurant. Hands down one of the top 5 Mexican food spots I've ever had, I'll be back whenever I find myself on the west side of the strip.

Great place. Stopped by for a drink at the bar end up having a blast. There was a band playing and the singer started singing songs for me and mom. The service is great! The bartender Karla was very nice and recommended new cocktails for us to try. Havent tried the food yet but next trip over its going down.
It took more than 45 minutes to get our food. When it finally arrived, 3 of our 4 meals were cold. No dishes were amazing - disappointing considering the higher than average price.

I'm from California and will travel to Las Vegas just to have breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks... This restaurant is worth the drive!  The old saying in Vegas "Save water, drink Margaritas!"   Love the cheesy bean dip, fresh avocado dip, and fresh tortillas... OMG soo good! I must go back ASAP!

Went here a couple of weeks ago on a weekend at about 3:30-4'ish.  There were a few people in there but it wasn't packed.  I had the Sopes,  (Sopes -Three  handmade tortillas gorditas, lightly deep fried. Topped with chorizo, carne asada or pollo asado.) with carne asada a taco, basically, but with a  thicker, fried corn tortilla, complete with onions, cilantro, etc.  No sissy lettuce and tomato on these tacos.  It also came with beans and rice (some of the better rice I've had, I find it always to be dry and bland, but I like flavor) I finished 2 of them (out of the 3 I had), but couldn't handle eating anymore.  My boyfriend had a dish that was even better than mine.  I can't remember the name of it, but I'm waiting for him to answer me so I know what it is. - Now I know! It was the Steak Picado- (New York steak in small chunks, sautéed with onions, cilantro, jalapeños, tomatoes and mixed with Spanish & verde sauce.) I remember, it was nice chunks of meat in a red sauce (not mole, not chile colorado), I took a bite of it, and the meat was incredibly tender, not the dry, in the crockpot for 6 hours, shredded tender, the tender that only comes from a good piece of meat.  It yields slightly, but as soon as you bit in, it's pure, soft, moist bliss.  And no gristle!  Their handmade tortillas are also very, very good.  I watched the nice lady make tortillas the whole time I was there, she was a busy lady!   We finished it off with the fried ice cream.  To me, it left more to be desired.  The coating seemed...almost stale, it was hard to chew and the ice cream was just plain vanilla ice cream.  I heard the table next to us order the fried banana after the waiter's suggestion, they seemed satisfied with it and finished the whole thing.  All in all, I will definitely go here again, just on the Steak Picado alone.

We are from LA where thiers an abundance of Mexican restaurants,, but when we leave it's seams hard to find a decent restaurant that's authentica Mexicana. This hidden gem of the strip tailors to the local clientele.  What a treat it is. They would of gotten a 5 star from me but. Customer service is a bit busy. This restaurant can probably hold 200 plus. And frequently they do. So food is great! But service is slow. Try the homemade gugamole, just like mom made at home right in front of you ( table side.) Thanks Vegas coming back soon again.

Their ceviche was good, but their margaritas were even better. What I loved most about this place wasn't the food, it was the service. The waiters are incredibly friendly and helpful. They make sure you enjoy your visit there.

As I was searching for another authentic Mexican food spot to try out, I decided to give this spot a try since the reviews were great.   The service was great from entering the restaurant by being greeting by the hostess and didn't have to wait for a table. Our server was very friendly and always checked up on us and right away we were served with chips, salsa, and beans. The salsa was okay I just wish it was more fresh than watery. I ordered the guacamole since everyone recommended it and it was delicious. You get to pick what you don't want in it because they make it in front of you. I went with the steak ranchero for dinner since I felt like some steak. I have to say it was made to my liking' not too salty and not too dry.   Can't wait to come back here and try another dish!

Great staff, food and experience! This is a place for sure we will come back to when in Vegas!!!!! Found our new favorite spot. No complaints! Homemade fresh flour tortillas, too! Had to order some to go.

We're out-of-towners and came here on a recommendation from friends that frequently come here. They also recommended we try the Playa La Llorona (seafood platter). This dish is full of flavor, very tasty. There were various shrimp prepared differently. The crab legs were also tasty. The rice served in the platter was my favorite with a flavorful sauce that included fish and squid -- yummy!! Violeta, our server, was very gracious and friendly. Would definitely recommend this place and come back next time we're in town.
Food is fabulous as always but the day I decide to bring my family the service was real slow. While others were getting served right away.
Great place.  Big menu which means something for everyone.  The service was super fast.  Will be going back.

Okay Yelp, you did me wrong on this one.  This is the absolute worst Mexican food that I have ever tasted.  First of all the food is not flavorful, I had to put salt on everything from the salsa to the beans and every item on my plate.  I ordered a combo plate with a chile relleno, chicken enchilada and chicken taco.  The chicken did not have any flavor and was very dry.  The chile relleno was full of water and the sauce on it tastes like pure tomato sauce.  Overall, it was a horrible meal.  The best part about my dinner was the tableside guacamole which of course needed salt and the wait staff who were very attentive.

I love this place.  Food is good...i often fill up on chips/dip before gets there, though.  Wait staff is good...busboys really take good care of you. They often have  live musician (i guess busier times?) which is fun and creates a great ambiance.
Love this place! The Service and food are always great!! I would definitely recommend the ceviche or the shrimp cocktail with a margarita with the corona inside!

This was me and my husbands favorite Mexican restaurant, until one day...I ordered a steak with cognac, I always order this every time we eat here, but that time they over cooked my steak...or should I say they burn my steak. I didn't noticed it because it was covered with sauce. When I sliced it that's how I noticed my steak was burn and the sauce taste burned! I called my server and told them what happened. They took my plate and When they returned it they gave me the same steak! It seems like they just washed it!!! How do I know? Because I know how it looks like and where I cut my steak! Grosssss....!!! I paid in full didn't eat the food that they gave me. Since then never go back to that place again!

We loved this place!!  The service was spectacular!  The food was unique and delicious. They still had traditional items but some very creative dishes as well including beef tongue.   Maybe it's because we have been mostly eating on the strip where service is wakeful and the food is way over priced and bland. But this place with its festive decor and very very friendly and attentive staff really made our night!  We come to Vegas often and plan on making it a regular stop'

Wonderfully authentic Mexican food! The best server is Richard, go in and ask for him. He is very knowledgeable, funny, enthusiastic and makes your dining experience even better. Nice live music, great family feel. The food is delicious, you will be coming back!

This place is loud & noisy! The food is served warm on hot plate. Ordered guacamole & it was gross!! Don't spend your money on big chunks of avocados  & green chili! It was soo bland! The chili rellanos was not worth it. Chili was hard & sauce was sooo bland with no taste! Beef taco shell fell apart & hard to eat with no bottom!! This place was terrible!

Great authentic Mexican food!! Hands down! Each dish that was ordered was full of flavor! Margaritas were huge and with just the right amount of kick to it! Will definitely be going mask there love the atmosphere  decor & lighting

My wife and I went here last night.  We had a shrimp dish and the carne asada.  The steak tasted salty which was weird.  The shrimp was a little too chewy.  Not great overall.  The service was good, lots of helpful guys.  The reason for only two stars was the after-affect the next morning of Montezumas revenge for both of us.  That was an experience we could have had at a roadside taco shop.  No amount of free alcohol would make me 'Vote Benito'  Thanks.

Excellent dining experience. The ceviche was awesome, carne asada dinner was one of the best I've ever had! Very nice service staff, everyone had a smile and kept our drinks and chips full. The gentleman providing the music on the keyboard was very talented. We gave him a $20 tip! It really set the mood for a authentic Mexican dining atmosphere. Whenever I come back to LV, this is a must stop for us!

With a gluten free intolerance, I usually avoid Mexican restaurants, but our group of 6 heard fantastic recommendations for this place, so I went along with a positive mindset and was pleasantly surprised. Our server was not only knowledgeable of gluten, but told me with confidence exactly what menu items were safe. It seems the make all tortillas, chips, etc fresh in their restaurant and possibly the dressings as well.   With a gf peace of mind, I enjoyed a beautiful spinach mango artichoke salad with sliced jicama and raspberry vinaigrette. The best, the BEST salad Ive ever had. That say a lot for a salad!!!  All of the five gentlemen in my group greatly enjoyed their meals as well, from the guacamole made table-side to the fajitas and other authentic dishes. Delicious, delicious food with knowledgeable servers in an authentic and clean environment. Check it out!!!
Third or fourth time having dinner here. Fantastic, authentic Mexican food. Richard has been our server each time. He is friendly, efficient and amusing. I highly recommend this place.

This is THE place for Mexican food in Las Vegas....and there are plenty of good places here. Started coming here in 2006 or so, love everything I get and it won't break the bank.  The soup!!!! Great Drinks! Amazing food Best seafood dishes (as my partner claims, I hate seafood) Home made tortillas Chips and Salsa!!!!!  At least 50% of the customers are Mexican and come in groups. They do it right here.....It's worth getting off the strip for if your visiting, and the money you save eating away from the strip pays for your cab ride.  What are you waiting for?
This is a must stop every visit to Las Vegas, the bacon wrapped is the bomb. Great food all around and great Margaritas.

Went here for a company birthday party and I must say that the waitress we got, was on her game. She was working our table, 12 people and a few others that were 2-4 people and she didnt miss a beat.  The food was good. The albondigas soup was awesome. Im kinda plain when it comes to ordering, so I had myself a couple shredded beef tacos with some rice.  The beef was seasoned nicely and was a lil too tender for my liking, but good for the most part.  The atmosphere is great. They do karaoke(or at least i hope it was karaoke, not a band) when it gets a lil later into the evening.

I was visiting my sister and family in whittier ca and decided to go to Las Vegas for the weekend. We were looking for a good mexican restaurant and asked when stopped for gas. Thank God they gave directions to this place. Being from San Antonio tx I like tex mex food. Was this a pleasant surprise as soon as we walked in. I really liked the sopa de fideo to start with. Then the chips with salsa and very good re fried beans in a small bowl. Settled on chicken enchiladas with white sauce . Must not have liked it because I don't remember it being very good. Service was great. Ordered guacamole and they fixed it at the table for you. Very good. Was not crowded since it was Sunday before noon. Did not like being in a cramp place. There were five of us. Also used the womens bathroom they ran out of paper towels. Told waitress and a very nice lady and gentleman talking to her offered me their napkins. Waitress didn't know what to do.we were there in April. But overall the food was very good. I will go back next time in Vegas.we had been looking for a good place every time we are there.
Had lunch here yesterday before heading back to LA. Ordered camarones a la diabla. Service was great.
I used to love coming here! It was my family's place to always go out to eat but recently, the last couple of times I've gone have not been to great.

I was having a bad day and was in a horrible mood. Came here to eat and relax with my girlfriend. Juan totally turned my day around, he was the best server I've had in a long time. He Turned my night around and I left in a better mood. Food was good, price was affordable. I will be back again!

Great place for vegetarians. Started off with their complementary nachos, hot salsa and crushed beans. It was perfect! Veggie enchiladas and veggie fajitas for dinner. Went well with a glass of their house Merlot. Great and friendly staff. We will be recommending to friends and family.
Alright. I'm not a fan of the buying more salsa deal. But I get why they do it. Nothing extraordinary.

I just moved here 21 days ago from California, I had ask the movers where is a good place to eat Mexican food he told me to try Bonito Michoacan, so after a long day of unpacking and cleaning we went  to have dinner I ordered the Chile Verde was not impressed with this dish, but the beans they serve with the chips and salsa got me coming back 4 times already.  can't wait to take my family and friend there when they come to visit.

What 4 stars overall really? This place is way better then Lindo There service is amazing I never had a to call the waiter our food was delicious. Venue is great. Overall it was AMAZING!!!!! Ever since Viva closed this has been the new to go restaurant.

This is a great place for lunch.  You can have a ten minute or sixty minute lunch, up to you - the staff will meet you half way on whatever YOU WANT.  Be sure to ask for Violetta, she gives the best service and is so pleasant, you'll want to come every day.  Ask for a bowl of the special picante sauce that they make daily and be sure to get the guacamole made table side.  Other than that, get what  you are hankering for because all of the food is good.  Don't miss this place - can't beat the price/quality mix!  ENJOY!

This place is amazing, the steak ranchero, steak cilantro and the lingua are all fantastic. I moved to vegas from Texas and when I first got to vegas I was extremely disappointed with the Mexican food. Thats until I found this place, it does get crowded during peak hours but it's soooo good.

Excellent food and value.  Get there early for dinner!  I've had the taco salad with beef and another time with chicken.  Put salsa on top and yum.  I've had their pork, tostada and enchilada combo.  Excellent!  Chips, salsa and bean dip appeared quickly upon being seated.  Service very good.   I only gave 4* because the checkin margarita was not 12oz as advertised!  I ordered another at regular price and both tasted good!  Minor point......
Excellent food and service. Reasonably priced. Not touristy - local favorite and off the strip. One of my favorites in Vegas.

GREAT SERVICE!!!! GREAT FOOD!!! GREAT PEOPLE!!!  It's a must stop for us when we visit to Vegas. We usually take a taxi to and from our hotel/casino...this time when our server called on a taxi, they said it would be an hour wait for pick up...the lady at the counter offered to give us a ride back to our hotel/casino.  FYI we offered $$ to kind lady for the ride and she refused to take our money....THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE RIDE!!!
Tasty guac, chips, margaritas and chicken mole!!  Service is always quick and friendly!  Great place to dine with friends!

Went to dinner here last night for my birthday. We had previously eaten here in May, 2013. That time we enjoyed the meal very much and planned on going back again for a special occasion. This time in no way resembled the previous experience. I had the # 1 combination of chile rellenos, chicken enchilada, and a beef taco. The rellenos was covered in some generic tomato sauce and was bland tasting. The cheese was very stringy and tasteless. The enchilada was so-so and the beef taco was almost Inedible. Beef was dry and the taco shell was hard as a rock. My date had a green chile burrito that had big chunks of pork instead of shredded, the chicken taco also had big chunks of chicken instead of shredded, and her cheese enchilada was basically a tortilla rolled up with sauce and cheese on top. She didn't care for any of it. She also ordered sopapillas to be served with our meal, and they showed up 15 minutes after the entree. When we asked where they were the waitress said they were "cooking them fresh".The bean dip was also bland and the chips were stale. Being a Specialty Room Chef in Las Vegas for over 20 years, I know good food. My hunch is that management has sourced cheaper product to cut cost and the quality dropped immensely, or the kitchen staff totally changed and doesn't produce the same quality as the staff from last year's visit. Lastly the table in our booth wobbled and we felt like we were sitting way to low, with the table height up to chest level because of the worn out seating. Also the music could drop a few decibels. It's not a nightclub. Needless to say I would never go back. Chipotle or even Taco Bell would be a preferred dining choice.
This is by far my favorite Mexican place in Vegas. Perhaps the entire west coast. Authentic feel from the ambience to the servers. Dishes are large and full of maximum flavor.

I took my parents here when they came for a visit. We celebrated my birthday with fajitas and margaritas! I had the chicken fajitas and they were cooked to perfection! The noodle soup that comes before the meal is one of my favorite appetizers! My mother and I had traditional margaritas and we both agreed they were definitely made with love and great skill. All margaritas are not created equal, some leave you feeling weighed down with all the sweetness, not these! They were made perfectly! The service was great and my birthday tequila shot was awesome (not much of a shot person, but it was sweetened with some lemon juice and it went down smooth). The cinnamon churros with whipped cream were a nice end to a wonderful birthday dinner!

The happy hour here is awesome!  Great preparadas and margaritas.  The street tacos and the ceviche tostadas are bomb!!  The bartenders are all pretty hot too!  Very welcoming and give great customer service.

The food is consistently good, service good. My biggest complaint is when someone is celebrating their Birthday, the wait staff engages in this" Happy Birthday To you" song. Not only is it WAY TOO LOUD, it's obnoxious sounding because of the tambourine, guitar,and noise making devices they use. It's OVERKILL!!! My ears are usually bleeding from this stupid tradition they have. They need to get rid of this ritual. The greatest waiter they have is Julio, professional, attentive, excellent personality. There is another waiter to avoid, he usually works nights, he is loud and obnoxious and should be selling used cars somewhere, I don't know his name but would give it if I did! He is so loud that you can hear everything he says from across the room, again, classless!

Chips, salsa, and bean dip right on the house off the rip to start?! What! Snuck in a little after 6pm and still got the happy hour price on the margarita's?! Damn who still does that. Had a regular and mango margarita. Margarita craving fixed.   Got the guac as an app. A must. They mash it up table side, so you pick the ingredients. No onions for me. I had the chicken taco, tosdada,and enchilada combo joint. Wow! My girl had the bean burrito and beef taco combo. Said she liked it (Was her pick to eat here since she said it was the best). Tons of stuff on the menu. All this for $55 and my girl had 2 margarita's too. Definitely good.    The only complaint is that the decor is a little old, but I like the mom and pop hole in the wall type places. I also ate wayyyy too much and it felt like a rock was in my stomach all night.

Love this place the servers are always attentive. And make the dinning a welcome adventure, always great. Hoodie for authentic Mexican flavor! Margaritas spot on.. steak salad has been the best I've had in a long time. Thumbs up!!

OMG the best, freshest truly truly authentic Mexican food this side of the border.  The pina coladas were to die for; to die for.  The ceviche was HUGE and out of this world fresh.  Real fresh fish!  I had to leave a little to make room for the Mole Poblano which was amazing.  My husband had fish tacos and I never heard him surface for air the entire meal.  The staff is super cool, too.  Beautiful atmosphere, super authentic.  The bathrooms are so cute!!  Super clean, too.  Will most definitely go to again and again!!!

Just all around delicious authentic Mexican food with authentic atmosphere. Manager came out and let us utilize the free margarita from Yelp. Hostess was beautiful and helpful. Waiter was fast and always on top of everything. Salsa was good. Shrimp tacos were bomb. Cheesecake burrito was a new dessert worth trying. Just go, no way to be disappointed.

Not sure what experience former reviewers have with Mexican food but don't believe the positive reviews. This place was awful. Carnitas are stiff and smell like old feet, bland chicken tacos, bland enchiladas. Only positives were the shrimp which were decent at best and the homemade tortillas but what good is a tortilla if there's nothing tasty to put in it.   If you're from la or sf skip and save your Mexican for cali. If you're from Vegas go anywhere else. There's no way it can be worse than this.

This definitely is one of Las Vegas best Mexican restaurants. From the decor to the service and the food, it all deserves 5+ stars. We found this place on Yelp and with all the great reviews everyone left we had to try it. The restaurant was as good or even better then everyone said it would be. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and seated right away. Our server came right out with chips salsa and beans to dip. After looking at the menu for a few minutes our server took our order and the food came right out. Everything everyone ordered looked and tasted great! We told our server it was one of our friends BDay and the whole restaurant came out and sang 2 songs to her! One in English and one in Spanish lol its was soo cool! They even gave her chooros topped with whipped cream lol we had a great time here and id recommend everyone who is looking for good food and great service to come here. You wont regret it!
Real authentic Mexican food. If your looking for something off the strip and want a family style restaurant, this is the place to be!

I went to Vegas on a family trip, we stumbled upon this restaurant since we wanted authentic Mexican food and it really did not disappoint. We were greeted right away by the host and seated maybe about 5min after. They accommodated our group of 8 right away. The décor is so cute and fun. Our waiter was very helpful and friendly. They bring you a fresh fideo soup for the whole table and it is warm and delicious. The Micheladas are so good and big! They have all these different types of drinks with fun names! The food is very delicious and flavorful, I ordered the carne asada, so juicy and full of flavor. I asked for the Carne Asada medium done and it was exactly how I wanted it. Everyone at the table was very satisfied and happy we came across this restaurant the service was great, food was definitely authentic, I will be coming back whenever I'm in town.   Also they take these cute pictures of your whole table that you can purchase afterwards!
Tortillas hechas a mano! Excelente service and the food is is delicious. .. great find. We came for breakfast and will be coming back for dinner.

I really loved this place!  Visting LV a local friend of ours took us here.  were were immediately served chips with excellent salsa that actually had some kick to it!  not only that, refried beans were served along with them too..very nice touch!  I had the tacos al pastor...the were ok and not served with the traditional pineapple, onions and cilantro.  Bf got the seafood mariscos..he liked it.  Friend had chicken tacos in hard shell..they looked good and he finished them so thats a sign.  all in all it was a nice experience and very nice to be off the strip.  Oh if anything go there to check ou the shrine of creepy clown figurines, dolls and puppets...very odd
Always good food, and the service is always spot on. Great guacamole made at the table. We have become regulars at this restaurant.
My favorite mexican restaurant in town! Always delishious, I come here when I want hearty comfort food.

Went here for the first time and I have to say I was completely amazed with the service, food, and drinks!   We enjoyed everything we ordered, and loved the Fideo soup that comes with the dishes.   I'd recommend this place to friends and family.

Food was amazing! Authentic Michoacan cuisine, from the sauces to the steak, it was all delicious. I had the Enchiladas Michoacanas and a Chile relleno ala carte, my husband had the Huevos Rancheros and a pollo azado enchilada ala carte. We enjoyed the food. The staff was very friendly and attentive. This is definitely the place to go if you want authentic Mexican food away from the hassle of the strip.

Our friends took us to Bonito Michoacán for lunch, and they did not disappoint! Large parking lot, but since it was a Sunday they were pretty crowded. Festive colors adorn the outside of the building, and inside there were a lot of Mexican decorations and murals. Very loud and very crowded with lots of Spanish speaking folks, so I was hoping that meant the food is good--and si, it was! Traditional Mexican dishes and drinks abound, and our server Jonathan was most friendly and patient with our numerous questions about the definition of some words on the menu and the food. I decided on the Carnitas Michoacán, which is pork marinated in oranges and spices and listed as "the best carnitas in all of Mexico", and I gotta agree! I really enjoyed the flavor and tenderness of the meat and all of the accompaniments--awesome! The portions were quite large, so most of our party did not finish their meals, but I totally wolfed mine down--lol! I also had a jalapeno cilantro margarita to go with my meal--woohoo, spicy and refreshing! We will be sure to visit again when we're in Vegas!
Great service and friendly staff; food is good and prices not bad $$. I will defenilly comeback again.
Best Mexican food! Authentic, and great customer service. I've made it a tradition to stop by before leaving Vegas!

Pretty good place... just not into the clown decor there.   One remarkable thing is that their hand made tortillas are AMAZING!!! Especially, the flour ones... mmm mmm mmm... make sure you work out before you eat there because you will gain a good amount there.
Definitley an authentic Mexican restaurant.  The organic margherita was excellent.  The tampequnia was amazing.  Fajitas were very good as well.  Servers very friendly and accommodating.

This was my first visit and I will definitely return and recommend it to friends and family. The food was delicious, the prices were great, and the service was EXCELLENT!   I had the beef enchiladas, my wife ordered the chile rellenos, and my sons had the shrimp fajitas and steak fajitas. Plus, we had 2 margaritas and deep fried ice cream for dessert. A fantastic meal.

This place is the bomb! I've searched and searched for the best mexican food in vegas and I've finally found it!  The food is super authentic, the margaritas are so yummy and the service is amazing! Thanks Saul :) I don't live anywhere close to here but would crawl over broken glass to come back :) So yummy!!!
Food was great. Had steak and shrimp combo. Servcie was outstanding (Richard).  Highly recommend.
Seriously good food, and great service!  Very authentic,  and they made stuff for our group that wasn't even on the menu!

I was in the mood for some Mexican food Saturday night, so i drug my man out and we ended up here.  A friend comes here frequently and had recommended it to me. We started off with the Queso Fundido which was pretty good. For dinner I had the Camarones Al Cognac which was amazingly delicious. I ate every last bite! My man had the Chile verde, I didn't taste it (no room left!) but he assured me it was to die for. Service was great, only complaint was the ambiance is so-so. Will definitely be returning here!!

I got sick after eating here!!!!!! Horrible stomach pains!! Do not waste your time or money on this place. Worst enchilada I've had in my life and their "steak" was low grade beef I wouldn't feed my dog. The place was packed and had great reviews so I was shocked when my food arrived. So disappointed and will never step foot in that place again.
Quesadillas and ceviche here are yummy!  Our server was really friendly and seemed to love working here.
Great service. Good food. And a free margarita to boot if you check in through yelp.  Would go back in a heartbeat!!
Este restaurant no tiene el servicio excelente como dice la gente como es posible que una soda de maquina la vendan en $ 2.50 cuando es casi solo agua y ni si quiera  rellenan

Was visiting Las Vegas and decided to go here because of the name and since my boyfriend is from Michoacán, we were attracted even more.  Service took so long to even refill drinks. Salsa for chips was like frozen salsa they just microwave. Michelada was a joke.  He had some enchiladas with side of steak which he requested to be medium rare. I had some sort of fried fish.  The enchiladas were dry and nothing like what the pictures showed. He was so disappointed.  The fish was just like any other fish... left some weird feeling after eating but overall I didn't enjoy it. You would think this place is in some way representing Michoacán and the food would taste good in a authentic way. WRONG!!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!!
Food was delicious  Margaritas are very good!!! Love the beans and salsa with chips.  Shrimp chili rellenos were awesome.  Camarones al coñac were fantastic  Will return next time I'm in town.

I understand it was Saturday night but we should not have to wait nearly an hour AFTER we ordered to get our food. Now... the food was ok at best. Ordered the chicken fajitas for two. They brought us 3 corn tortillas... for 2 people. Had to ask for more. The rice SUCKED. The beans were flavorless. I am giving this place a very generous 2 stars. This is the second michoacan restaurant we have tried here in the Vegas valley and the last one we will be trying.
Great authentic mexican food and environment. I have never been let down by the food and you can't beat their chips with bean dip and free Margarita with each check in.
I love Mexican food. Food was ok... not what I expected. Food like warm when it came... ordered a drink but never got it.  Service poor.

I gave up on Mexican places to eat here in Vegas. Even this place at first. But then was reintroduced to this place and it soon became the only place i'd go for Mexican food. Food is always on point here. Fun atmosphere and the best margaritas!!! Love the staff they are awesome and so is their table side guac making skills!

Very delicious restaurant with great service.  Our drinks were always full, the food came out fast,  and for the price it was a good place. I'm giving it 4 stats because the chips and salsa were so - so and my chicken was dry but the carne asada steak was amazing!!

Driving back home to California, we stumbled onto this Mexican restaurant. So glad we did because the food and staff were great.   Thank u to our server Matin, for making our experience so enjoyable..we will definitely be back when we come back to Las Vegas.. .
Came here yesterday with my husband. Ordered a molcajete mixta, it was amazing! Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Will definitely come back when I'm In town again.

El mejor comienzo para una cena en familia son unos totopos con frijoles y salsa picante... Después una media docena de para abrir el apetito y para terminar la cena perfecta una parrillada mixtanexcelente para compartir... Todo en un ambiente familiar connmusica en vivo... Apesar de que el mesero estaba un poco ocupado el bus person siempre estuvo al pendiente.

I've been to many different locations from Viva Zapatas to the Michoacana the food here has always been good for me and I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants to have that authentic Mexican food taste service is amazing and the atmosphere is extremely relaxing they have live music and they give free soup tortilla chips salsa and beans I give this place 5 stars because I've been coming here for years and every time they live up to them stars so if you're out looking for a good authentic Mexican place to eat choose this place
I'm from the Bay Area and omg this spot is so nice and good !! The waiter and busboy were there to help each other because we were a big group !! I love and enjoyed the spot here ! Will come agian !!
When it comes to authentic, this place is it. Friendly service. Great atmosphere. Delicious food and more.
Very authentic and well prepared meals. The staff was friendly and even had singing and dancing in the back. Good food and good energy...

had my 36th birthday here with a party of about 10. They were very accomodating and the food was excellent.  It is not cheap but the everything was very well cooked and about half our party were natives of Michoacan so they are very very fussy about their Mexican food.  Everyone loved it. My 3 old loved the clown motif although that may not be for everyone.  The margaritas were sassy!  Great job :)

real chips, real bean dip, real mexican food!  I love this place.  The waitor is hilarious and the live entertainment is so fun!  I love coming here and I love the food!  They have great coupons and always honor them!  The lunch special is a great deal as well!

1) long wait to order 2) long wait for food after ordering 3) 3 out of 4 meals were cold 4) salsa and bean dip were pretty good.   We ate- Carnitas- (pile of meat. Not much else) Sopes- looked ok. But was cold Chile Rellano de camarone- cold chile rellanos aren't very good Chicken burrito- cold. Not much flavor.   Yes, we could have sent cold food back. But after the wait, we were pretty much ready to eat and leave.

This is my favorite Mexican spot in Las Vegas. The menu is extensive, with items you don't see at every Mexican restaurant, many of which are specific to the Michoacan region.  Right away, you'll notice the salsa and bean dip are great. Next, you'll notice the appetizer soup is flavorful. Then, you will certainly enjoy your entree, almost all of which are memorable and tasty. What's more, if you get the tableside guacamole, you won't be disappointed.  As a vegan, I'll say you can't beat the veggie fajitas. Probably the best veggie fajitas I've ever had or heard of anywhere, which are an interesting and delicious assortment of vegetables, served up with homemade tortilas, flour or corn (you can't go wrong either way).  For out of towners, this place is located conveniently about 5-10 minutes west of the Strip and, seeing how it is miles ahead of any Mexican restaurant at any casino, it is worth the short trip.

Great food. Not great atmosphere. But when you are with good company, that part matters less.   Pros:  chips, salsa, bean dip, yum  tasty tomato base soup for free, yum  good margaritas and they made my specialty margarita correctly!  friendly and attentive staff   Cons:  odd decor - clowns....creepy  odd floor plan  right when you walk in you can see the nasty kitchen lights because the wall around the kitchen is low   I had a poblano cream chicken dish with rice and beans. OMG. TDF! I couldn't stop eating.   We will be back! I just recommend a little redesign/redecorating. Hire someone to help with that. Don't just let the wife/daughter of the owner handle it. A professional who can help make it more appealing and attractive and updated.

We live in SoCal and this is hands down the best Mexican food we've ever had. That's really saying something BCZ we have SO MANY Mexican food options in California. We ordered the crispy chicken tacos and fish tacos and both were the best. I first ordered the chicken mole and it was a little strong for me and the waiter was so helpful to replace it with something I liked. They also served complimentary chips with beans and salsa. Complimentary soup as well. If you check in on Yelp you get a free margarita also! Everything tasted so fresh and very high quality. We will definitely be coming here every time we visit Las Vegas.

So glad we ate here and not at the over priced not real Mexican food at the strip. Super friendly staff, waiter started us out with a sopa de Fideo that was outstanding perfectly flavored broth. I couldn't make up my mind so I created my own combination plate of a carne asada sope and a chicken green enchilada. I also ordered a mangonada margarita the best margarita I have ever had.

Very very  Excellent food And dining experience... You are great at and waited on as you enter staff is immensely  Impressed. Waiters are knowledgeable and pair if you are gonna drink their drinks are wonderful and delightful a must come

Totally disappointed. Just had my wedding reception dinner here. Staff was rude, they were telling my party they were to busy! When we had our entrance not one staff member asked if we wanted anything to drink or eat. I was told our event would be private and so was charged per person peope we didn't know were seated with us. But last but not least my wedding cake was delivered a day before but was never brought out. so my 50 person cake went to my hotel with me. All i got was a sorry.. But they were never to busy to take $1,200 from us!! I can tell you food is great but having an event here I would say no. I had another place in mind and should have stuck with it totally my fault.

The service was incredibly slow, are drinks or not kept up with, the hostess who seated us was upset we didn't want to sit in the back where we couldn't hear the music and gave us attitude when we requested to be moved and the food was just so-so.
best customer service hands down ! the food was great and they had apple juice for my daughter back to back!
Food is great and service is fast!!Awesome guacamole made to order tableside!!!  Chips with salsa and beans are complimentary!!!
Slow service.....food was good, but waited 30 min to get check AFTER credit card slip was signed. Then found waitress having a lunch break when I went to ask what was taking so long.

Very good food.  Wanted to get off the Strip for a meal and this is definitely a go to place for authentic and fresh Mexican food.  Don't forget to check in and get your free house margarita. Will definitely come back when I am in town.

Best Mexican food off the strip. Authentic dishes and excellent atmosphere.  Over the 10 years I have been visiting this location the food and services has not changed. Person favorites are the carne asada tacos and the pollo a la parilla.
This place was great. Wouldn't have stopped in if my brother didn't recommend it. Get service and food. Not sure I like the picture taker thou.
Delicious margaritas and ceviche! Definitely will be coming back! Happy it's close to home

I am seriously torn.  When it come to Chinese and Mexican food, I think there is a fine line between value, and rip off.  I mean if I'm eating a perfectly delicious taco for $3, how much better will it get for 6-8x the price.  I understand that at a restaurant there are other amenities, advantages, and portions are bigger, but on flavor and experience alone, is the mark up really worth it?  This place serves delicious Mexican food.  I have no complaints, service was professional, and friendly.  There is nothing wrong with this establishment.  I just feel that I would hit up one of my favorite no frills taco joints before returning here.
Fantastic place!!! Mexican people is very positive, friendly and funny! Food is delicious and atmosphere is super romantic!!!Highly recommended!)

Found this place recently...not sure how I ever missed it.  Went back four times in two weeks.  That should tell you what I thought of it.  The atmosphere, service, and of course the food are are great.  Amazing selection of tequilas, and staff that actually knows about them!  Can highly recommend the carne asada tacos, and the cerviches.  Try not to fill up on chips and bean dip so you can enjoy the mains...
I do not want to even get into it. Meals are priced way too high, not even that good. "Manager" on duty is very unprofessional and irrational. Go to macayos.

Superb Mexican food.  Although we had to take a cab there and we wanted to stop at the market before returning to our condo, the drove us to the market.  They did say that the sometime pickup and return customers to the strip, but not sure of details.
This place has been here forever, and while the decor is a little campy the food is honest and delicious.  I'm not a big fan of mexican, this place really shines.

Free Margarita with check in.  I got the steak with cheese enchilada, rice, and beans.  It also came with your choice of tortillas.  The complementary soup of fideo was to delicious!!! I would come back here again.  There are TVs throughout the place for game action too.
The food is great!!! Too bad that's the only good thing about it. Customer service is BAD and with an ATTITUDE. They take too long to bring you the food but it comes with the check.

This place can get busy during weekends, so don't think they'll treat you any better when you come on a weekday. It's just as bad or even worse. My family and I came on a Thursday for my father's birthday. This place was not any where near busy. To start off we called ahead letting them know we had a party of six. Come to find out they had given away our table to someone else because they weren't sure which reservation was which. The ladies at the counter went back and forth about when they should seat us, and eventually did. We let them know we had a birthday there at the counter, and they said "let the waiter know". We sat down and discreetly let our waiter know about the birthday. We ordered our food and I for sure made it known that I didn't want any sort of pico de gallo on my dish (#6 on the menu). They still put it on there which made my dish worse than what it already tasted. Ordered two beers that took the waiter an extremely long time to get to the table. Had to ask another family member for a sip out of their own drink because of this. The food took a very long time to come out and no one enjoyed their food due to the plain taste it all had. The only thing that was enjoyable was the tiny fideo soup. We sat there twiddling our thumbs after everyone was finished eating waiting to see when they were going to come sing happy birthday (the only reason why we even chose to come here). We had to go let them know we were ready for it and no one came. Mind you there was nothing else to do besides sit there and wait awkwardly for them. We waited as long as we could. Noticed none of them were getting together for it.  Ended up getting up and walking to pay for our food and that's when they embarrassingly came up to us and said they were NOW ready. We let them, and it was extremely unpleasant and way more than just awkward. We were all already done with the whole experience. I will never bring one of my loved ones here for any sort of special occasion, or even for dinner alone and I will highly encourage anyone else to do the same!

It's an amazing restaurant! I don't really like Mexican food but this place is changing my mind. I have lived in Vegas for 9 months and it's the first Mexican food restaurant that I actually like. The food is to die for.

Absolutely The Best Mexican Restaurant In Town  My husband and I drive from Southeast Henderson almost weekly to enjoy Bonito. We have always had excellent service and the food is phenomenal. Anytime we have out of town guests we bring them here for a special treat. We have tried many different items on the menu and have never been disappointed. We love the decor and enjoy the piano player on weekends. We always leave happy and satisfied.
Awesome!  Had their steak cognac and it was killer.  Great service too.

My husband and I had the "Papa Chencho" appetizer and it was great! We had filete relleno and pollo con rajas as entrees and they were so yummy! Our server Lili and armando were very attentive and prompt. I will definitely be coming back soon!
The fajitas = literally a mountain of meat and peppers. The price was a little steep around $37 for "fajitas for two" but it will provide another meal or two for leftovers.
Great food and great service, parking is tight and come prepared to wait.

5 stars for authentic, delicious, traditional Mexican food!! The service was good, but the food was impressive!! The only hard part about coming here is deciding what the heck to order. I ordered the steak with cilantro and I am still dreaming about it 2 days later. It was tender and perfectly cooked. The drinks are great too, the mangoniada is a must try and the micheladas are amazing. This place is also really nice Inside and out, beautifully decorated!! This is a must in Vegas!!

House margarita is delicious. Warm chips with red salsa and refried beans. Fresh brewed ice tea. I ordered the timos salad, it was good. Boyfriend got the ny steaks that was as big as the plate with flour tortillas. Refried beans and tortillas are fresh no lard is used! Yay for my veggie people
Had a large party. 15 people. Very accommodating. Great food. Great service. Good prices.

I came here to eat with my family and it was very good. Everything about this place is great. The customer service was good as well. The prices are decent nothing to complain about. I was recommended by a friend and her experience went very well as she had told me. Im looking forward to come back soon and I also recommend this place.

Never been disappointed at this spot. When we are craving Mexican food these guys are on point.  Live music tonight and everyone is in a great mood.  Servers are fast and polite even singing along in some instances The food is good and portion size satisfies.  No problem with substitutions or extras.   Free margarita with Yelp check in is a nice touch as well.  Good place, good food, good times
Muy buen ser visio mi mesera Ivonne fue muy atenta me recomendó una mangoneada y estaba riquísima

Best Mexican restaurant hands down! The service is top notch and they're very welcoming, the food is the best everything my family has had has always been amazing! We live in Cali and everytime we come to Vegas we have to visit!

Great food, nice atmo...They always give you more than you can handle. Almost any entree is started w/ soup...Fideo.... I have fond memories with friends at this place...It almost takes me back to the time before I had kids & we could sit at the bar drinking Corona's till they close.   I have a bad habit of ordering the same thing... Fajita's...  I guess 'cause I know thier good & I am a definate creature of habit. highly recommended I would have given 5 stars but I guess i'm just picky that way.

Just had dinner here tonight. This place has good vibe, vibrant decorations, lovely music, amazing food and outstanding service. We had shrimp ceviche, steak tacos entree and steak fajita. Everything was delicious. Complimentary chips and salsa are served as soon as you sit down. Rice, beans and soup come with most entrees. I checked in on Yelp and got a free Margarita which was also good and refreshing. The waiters were very nice, friendly and attentive. We really had a great experience at Bonito Michoacan tonight and will definitely come back.

I thought the restaurant was really good. I had the chicken tacos, which came with (3), rice, beans, and guacamole. There was also a starter of a light tomato soup with noodles, which was also REALLY good. What made it even better was our server, Jonathan, who was very knowledgeable about the menu and was able to steer us in the right direction.   I also appreciated the free check in margarita that the restaurant offered, which made us come to the restaurant in the first place. I live close by so this will definitely be on my list of places for my fiancé and I to go and eat during the week/weekend.

From a Chef to a Chef. Great food. Awesome service. Excellent experience. Lilly the server , Mario the Bus Boy and all others were exceptional. Fresh made Guac was a great to my taste buds. Great choice in menu. Very reasonable. And just as expected was a packed place. Keep it up.

A hidden gem in Las Vegas.  Service excellent.  Food excellent.  Prices very good.  We were served (gratis) chips and salsa AND refried beans.  I can't remember the last time refried bean were given as a free dish.  AND IT WAS SOME OF THE BEST REFRIED BEANS I EVER HAD.  The salsa was good, but I would have preferred it hotter.  We were hungry from a day hiking so we also ordered a guacamole  appetizer.  The guac was prepared table side to our taste, also excellent.  I ordered a coca-cola steak ala Mama Cielo, surprisingly it wasn't sweet at all just incredible juicy.  My adventurous choice paid off.  The service was exceptional.  The server came by, without asking and refilled my drink whenever it was empty (which was often - did I mention 100 degree weather in Las Vegas and hiking).  They also had a musician singing and playing Mexican love songs, surprisingly at the correct volume.  If I lived in Las Vegas, this would be my number 1 Mexican restaurant.

Stumbled upon this restaurant after making attempts to eat at a few others. When we pulled into the parking lot it was full of cars which is always a good sign. We were very hungry and were hoping the food was good and service was fast. Thumbs up to both!! The food was delicious and fast and the service was great. This will be part of my restaurant rotation whenever I'm in Vegas

Found this place on accident while in Vegas! Great place! Great decor! Great food! Great service! Very authentic. Will be returning in my next visit to Vegas. I would have posted photos BUT we ate it all.

Came here for dinner unexpectedly on a Friday night. Not the first time i've came here but this was the first time i've brought my mother to something like this. Since we were only a party of two, we were sat at a booth in front of the bar to the left.   Lighting was pretty dim with live music being played. The kind of environment you'd expect on a Friday night ! Pretty nice.   As this was only the 2nd time i've been here, their overwhelming menu was pretty hard to make a decision with. We were given their fresh tortilla chips, bean dip and salsa pretty quickly. Besides that, it was an easy decision to order a Mangonada margarita. What a delicious drink this is ! Definitely not the first time i've had this either ! Quite yummy drink. I couldn't really taste the alcohol but my mom said she could. Definitely a dangerous drink with majority of the alcohol taste being masked by the mango.   It's been a long time since my mom's had anything mexican so she'd become a bit american and order fajitas (apparently fajitas aren't genuine mexican cuisine but a Tex-Mex ! gasp !   Fajitas de res (Strips of New York steak mixed with tomato, onions, peppers, cilantro, and spices. With guacamole and sour cream. Served sizzling) - Very simple dish served with a choice of flour or corn tortillas. Their tortillas are homemade and are completely different from anything i've ever had (.... even in mexico ! LOL). The flour tortilla is so fragrant and soft. Its so good ! The corn tortilla is actually... much finer and softer than i expected. You definitely can tell that its a corn tortilla but its like a flour and corn tortilla had a baby o.O?! The strips of NY steak with cooked veggies was simple and tasty. Though i expected the steak to be more tender, it was quite flavorful.   Aside from the fajita, i definitely had trouble deciding what else to order. Originally i was looking at something chicken or pork but mom suggested something shrimp. With 13 different dishes made with shrimp, i had asked our waitress on some recommendations. She had made 3 different recommendations, one creamy, one spicy, one with cognac.   Camarones Sarandeados "Tia Esther" - Large fresh Mexican gulf shrimp basted with sarandeado sauce with a rich selection of dried chiles and secret spices blended with a touch of mayonnaise  I do hope this is the dish we got. I actually forgot the name. As with all entrees, comes with rice and bean plate. The shrimp used was definitely LARGE, granted not many in quantity. The sauce used was a very delicious creamy sauce that was extremely tasty with the shrimp or mixed and eaten with the rice. Even my mom was like OMG THIS SAUCE IS SO GOOD ! I know for a fact we opt'ed for the "spicy" one. Spice wise, it was not spicy, very mildly. Granted we do love eating spicy but im sure its decent for even the not really spicy eater.   Service was mildly slow as it took a while to get our bill and pay, but it was near the end of the night so it wasn't that bad.  Overall, very yummy experience ! I just realized after looking at their menu online that they have lunch specials ! i wonder, size wise, how do they compare to the normal entrees?! I wanna try for lunch !

Excellent menu of traditional Mexican cuisine.  We had a group of 12, everybody ordered something different.  Everything was great.  The staff was friendly, the service prompt.  I had the carnitas, they were moist and flavorful.  This place is off the strip but not too far.  I would highly recommend it.  We come here every time we visit Vegas.

Delicious. 1st timers and was not disappointed. The wifey ordered the cheese enchiladas but wanted white sauce, not red. Our server Richard, suggested another sauce cooked with cognac. Needless to say, wifey killed the plate. I ordered the chicken fajitas. Can't go wrong and didn't. The grilled tortillas were a nice touch. Will be back for sure.   PS, don't forget to check in on Yelp and get your free margarita.

What can I say.. Excellent customer service.  The food was  delicious.  It was so worth the money.  Authentic Mexican food.  I haven't had any Mexican  food that tastes like this in years! I highly recommend visiting this place

Pros: -Service was excellent. The servers were very polite and our food came out fast. We had about 3 people constantly filling our drinks/chips/salsa/beans. Plus, they're really good at singing happy birthday :) -My fiance loves beans and was really excited to see they served complimentary beans with their chips and salsa. A nice touch and one I have never seen before in a Mexican restaurant  Cons: -The food was OK. I got #16 (two hard chicken tacos, all rice) and I enjoyed it, although the tacos were a little small. My fiance had a combo plate as well (hard beef taco and enchilada, all beans) and did not like the enchilada's red sauce.  All in all, the restaurant was alright and if I was in town again I might consider coming back.
came in to vegas for vacation, i ask a local were to go for good mariscos. he was dead on this place was great.  good food good service great beer

Met friends here for dinner. The food was good, though the waiter got one of the orders wrong. It was another friend's birthday and they sang while she wore a sombrero and they gave her a shot of tequila and churros. It was fun.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in all of vegas. Great customer service, awesome energy, easy parking, and hands down the tastiest Mexican food every time I go!

Love this place. The food and the staff are amazing. Only had one bad experience but it was late night and I think both me and my server were too exhausted to understand each other. My go to spot for Mexican and love the margaritas (on the rocks of course).
Food Good! service eh.many better places in town.... not much to see here, but the diehard mexican food fans wont be too disappointed, there are just alot of places in town that do it better!

This is a new favorite place! The bf and I came here last night with my little brother and sister at the coaxing of my little brother for some bomb a** Mexican food. And boy was he right.   Upon pulling up and seeing the parking lot was packed I got a little worried we would have to wait for a table but...NOPE. We were happily greeted by two pretty hostesses and taken to our table for 4. Our server arrived promptly, took our drink order, and even gave us a little free cup of their homemade guacamole (delicious!!!) after our chips and salsa arrived. It seemed we had multiple people waiting on us and making sure our drinks & chips were full. I appreciated that, a lot. Pretty cool that they were all having each others backs and truly their focus was on the guests dining experience.   We ordered different varieties of the usual Mexican flare so I won't go into details describing it all. Everything was delicious and we were all happy with our food.   One thing that I thought was pretty awesome and makes me want to go back for my birthday....they had a few people with birthdays while we were there. They make a HUGE spectacle with singing to you, complete with a sombrero and a free shot of tequila down the hatch!  Oh my gosh it was sooooo loud but ya know I didn't mind it, even though it wasn't for anyone at our table it was still fun to watch and even other guests joined in on singing the happy birthday. Pretty awesome!!!   Will definitely be back here :)

Service is always great and the food portions are very large! As an appetizer, I strongly recommend the live guacamole. It is made right at the table, with all your favorite ingredients! Can't go wrong with any items on the menu and their oysters, margaritas, and ensalada marinera are wonderful!

This is my first visit to Benito's, as we have just relocated into the area. My first impression was how well we were received and welcomed. From the hostess to the waitress to the busboy , they were all upbeat and friendly. Now the food. We travel a lot and generally try to test the Mexican fare wherever we go. Comparatively speaking, this is one of the best eateries I've encountered in a long time. The chili verde was like mom used to make. The complimentary appetizer "sopa" was excellent, and the margaritas were great as well. I look forward to frequenting this establishment and work my way through the menu.

I first became a fan of sister restaurant Lindo Michoacan on Desert Inn but Bonito is much closer to my home.    We are "regulars" there so it's nice to walk in and have the waiter or waitress know your order.    Try the table side guacamole.  It's the best guacamole I've EVER had. And if you can, try to sit in Violeta's section.  She makes it even better than the other waiters. However, Juan and Jose (I think that's his name) are good waiters too.    The veggies in the fajitas are so fresh and delicious but you can't really go wrong with anything you order here.

Delicious Mexican food with an authentic feeling environment.  If you are looking for some tasty Mexican food, it's tough to find a better place that Bonito Michoucan.  It's definitely one of the top places in town.

Margarita's were just "ok".. fajita's for 2 over cooked .. beef was so over cooked!  No flavor, asked for some additional hot sauce and they brought out verde salsa. Can't understand how it get's it stars?

Service was good, food was okay I'd give it 3. Stars for food and 4 for service. The guacamole was really good- got some fresh homemade tortillas to go with it. I got a veggie burrito and I heard the chicken enchiladas were okay.

My family and I went to this restaurant on Mother's Day so perhaps I am being biased as I know most restaurants are out of control on that particular date.  This was my experience: We had a group of 9 and got seated right away. That was initially impressive! Our waiter was a man named Lorenzo. We ordered drinks, got our chips and salsa/bean dip rather quickly. We ordered our food and from then on it was a 45+  minute wait to receive the food. I think I would have been okay with waiting on the food if I didn't notice that all other families that arrived after mine were brought their food right away. Small or larger groups everyone else's waiters were ON IT; however, ours was not. I finally could not stand it any longer and approached him to ask if he could bring our food as each plate was ready, versus waiting on all of them to be ready entirely. He seemed annoyed at my comment, but noticing how slow he was moving kept irritating me.  Once the food arrived, I was starved and shoved everything down. I had a combination plate with Huevos Rancheros. The hand made tortillas that came with the meal were a nice surprise. However, the rice was bland. My huevos rancheros had a weak red sauce with no flavor. I asked around the table, and the variety on our table had burritos and fish combo plates, yet they all agreed that each item was rather bland.   The alcoholic drink selection although not that large, was very good. I ordered something called "Que Viva la Borrachera" and I have to say that probably saved this entire rating. They packed on the alcohol!  I would consider this place for appetizers and drinks with a friend, but not for a meal.

Came here tonight for a friends birthday. Being Mexican, I'm hesitant trying other Mexican food places, but I have it a chance for her sake. We were seated with the rest of our group immediately, which is nice. We promptly got cups of water, and once we ordered, we got little cups of fideo soup. It was good, nothing special, tasted straight out of the packets you buy at the store. After, we proceeded to wait about half an hour for our drinks and then about another hour or so for our food. The food wasn't authentic. I understand it was towards the end of the night when we went, but my rice shouldn't have been crunchy. Old rice, beans from a can, flavorless chicken fajitas with more vegetables than anything. I also had a beef tamale that tasted very basic, run of mill, nothing special type, you know? The strawberry margarita was the best thing I had all night. I paid about $30, without the gratuity that they tacked on. The atmosphere is pretty alright, but the food is crap and definitely nowhere near authentic. Go if you want, I won't be returning.

Delicious authentic mexican food located near the Rio hotel. This was a spot I yelped and actually enjoyed the experience. They give you warm bean dip along with your chips and salsa. A large variety to choose from.

Fabulous and authentic food!! Free chips with salsa and beans PLUS a bowl fideo too!! All before you even order your food! Seriously the BEST MEXICAN FOOD I EVER HAD!!! Homemade tortillas! My husband is Mexican and he quickly agreed!!!
I had the veggie enchiladas and I loved them! The sopita de fideo was the bomb! My husband has a torta de asada! It was great but the meat was a little pink!

Everything about this place was amazing!  Food selection and quality, service, bustling vibe, etc. Experience here will be something you never expected from a Mexican restaurant.  Tacos de Camarones (deep fried shrimp tacos) was super tasty.  Parking lot is huge, but it's always packed. You'll see why, on your first visit.

Im a big fans o Chipotle Mexican Grill and Cafe Habana i know they are not the authentic mexican food but i think i will like Mexican food. My friend told me this restaurant was good so i went there with my boyfriend for dinner. The decoration in the restaurant are quite special (looks like a normal house) and the staff are very nice and friendly. My friend told me the Steak Cilantro was good so I ordered this one and my boyfriend had the Coca cola steak. When my dish came, i could smell something bitter and i just didnt want to touch my dish so I switched mine with my boyfriend. So I had the Coca cola steak now, the sauce was nothing special and the steak was overcooked. The yellow rice which came with it was not really good. And my boyfriend didnt like the Steak Cilantro neither. Maybe we just do not like the authentic Mexican food and think we will stick back to Chipotle and cafe habana. People who like authentic Mexican food might wanna go there and try and see.

This place never disappoints! Food is always fresh, customer service is always the same. Same friendly faces all the time. I come to Vegas for business every month and always look forward to breakfast and dinner here. Definitely a customer for life!

Cute decor and authentic setting. It seems like they are trying to be an upscale Mexican restaurant but the staff and setting don't agree. We ordered table side guacamole but never got it. Asked to have it removed from the bill and waiter made it out like he was doing us a huge favor to remove it. Food was pretty good, we had steak fajitas and tamales.
The enchiladas were great and the service was outstanding. Don't forget the jalapeño, cucumber margarita.

The service at this place was phenomenal. Despite being packed for a Friday night dinner rush, we had our food and drinks in under 10 minutes. Our server was kind and attentive, and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. The menu is packed full of great choices, and the food was fantastic. Easily one of our favorite dining experiences in Vegas.

Food is good generous portions.  The acoustics in the restaurant are punishing, bordering on painful. Impossible to hear your waiter or dining companions.  Same review as before, food is good ambience is still terrible, and the booth seats are old and punishing with no support.  My GF was sitting directly on a 2x4 throughout dinner.
Been here so many times while on vacay.  Best Mexican vibe for a non mexican city and superb food.  Always leave feeling like i am pregnant with a mexican child after eating too much as its so good!

We LOVE this place.  The food is always good, and the service is excellent!  We always roll up with at least 10 peeps and they have always been able to accommodate us.    They give you this yummy bean dip with the chips and salsa and fideo soup when you order an entree.  Both are so good.  Our favorite go to Mexican restaurant while in Vegas!

Best borito in town and there chiros are great not too sweet service here is good too soft drinks are bottomless our drinks never got half way before it was refilled we like coming here for lunch.  We are going to try there dinner next
Carnitas are 2nd to none!!!!!!!! I love this place! My family is from Michoacan and this place capitalized on it's origin! Love love love!
We pulled thus up on Yelp and with the reviews. We decided to try it. Everything was amazing from the service to the food.

This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in Town. It's our go to once a month spot. They serve fresh food thats consistent in taste and portion. They have a frendly staff and usually get seated right away. They serve chips, salsa and warm bean dip with every dinner. You have to ask to get the spicy green salsa. Soup is served with your meal as well. The margaritas are the best in town. We always leave with leftovers. Great the next day. Moderate to medium prices. Always worth it. Been going here regularly for four years.

Went here for the first time. Food was average for las vegas mexican food, no better. I will say the menu was huge, so there could be plenty of things that are great, just don't know after one visit. The facility itself is in need of repair. It is a little on the old side and looks it inside. As for the employees, our waiter was 'Lorenzo', and if you are looking for the one single employee who has no personality, as in zero, this is you man. Holy smoke. Drove out of our way to get there, not again.
Beautiful Mexican restaurant. They have the best caldo de res and caldo de pollo (Mexican beef stew and chicken stew). Just like grandma use to make.

Lively atmosphere maybe too much.  Above average food but not exquisite thus the barely four star rating.  Perhaps bigger menu than needed.  At your face but not rude service that won't over sweeten you.  That said the service was still good.  The booths felt odd to sit on.  They were spaced too far back from table and too low.  Will go back.

Great food. Great service. Our waiter Julio was excellent. Definitely coming back. I have to say that the seafood was very fresh. My wife love this place just as much as I did. We can't stop talking about the food.

Waited over an hour never got our food. Never coming back no attempt to make it right just kept telling us to wait.   Should have just walked out without paying for our drinks but at least we'll have our integrity.   Don't come here if you are on a schedule

If you like Mexican food even a little bit, go here! The food is excellent, the service is outstanding, and I can't say enough good things. Especially good: there's a dish with bacon-wrapped shrimp stuffed with peppers and smothered in cheese, and the mole is exceptional. I get something different every time and love everything. While I'm not fond of the complimentary salsa, the bean dip is tasty. This is a favorite for sure.

I cannot believe I have not yet Yelped that Bonito Michoacan es muy bueno! I've eaten here several times with friends when I visit Vegas, but this time brought family here! I know they thought I was crazy leaving the strip, but I told them it was well worth the short trip! Two family members are Mexican and took a long time to study the menu. They are both from California and have never seen some of these entrees on a menu except in Mexico!  The complimentary bean dip is good and the tableside, fresh-made guacamole is the best! My niece does not usually eat guacamole and she loved it here! I've had some of the lengua dishes before and they are the best I've had! This trip I had the Biria de Chivo (a type of goat soup). I have not had goat since I was in Greece in the 90's and this was so tasty and tender with excellent spice. My only issue is that I did not have room for more! Oh, and let's not forget the margaritas! They actually make them with tequila...good and strong...wink, wink. Fantastico!  If you want to enjoy REAL Mexican food at a fraction of the price of restaurants on the strip, then this is the place! Great food, great service, great prices and more money for Blackjack!

Absolutely delicious!  My husband and I love checking out Mexican restaurants where ever we go. This place is the real deal!  We tried several different things on the menu. The shrimp tacos were fantastic!  Service was great. We will make a point of going back next time we are in Vegas!

This restaurant is amazing! The guacamole is a must. Great ambiance, friendly staff, and incredible food. We found this place while searching on Yelp for a family friendly restaurant. The kids loved everything. Even the free margarita we received for checking in on Yelp was delicious. This will be a must go to place every time we come to Vegas!

Visitng on 4/20 weekend so we were looking for a place to sit down away from the strip with 10plus hungry guests where we could enjoy some Delicious Authentic Food and have Guacamole made fresh at our table. I really liked the Fideo soup we got as a complimentary appetizer. It was a good choice that we had found on Google.

This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas it's a tradition to go eat when we visit absolutely amazing. I love the sopa aguada that they give you as a starter you must have have their refried   beans.Customer service is absolutely great always cheerful and very pleasant I don't think I will ever stop coming to this place... it's a bit far from the strip but the drive is worth it never had a bad experience  nor bad food and for that I will continue  to return!!!!!

I'm not going to claim "I know REAL Mexican" - who's to decide what is?What I will say is this is my favorite Mexican restaurant. They have one of the best Moles I've had.  Recommend the Pollo sarandeado Tia Esther and the buckwheat noodle soup.

I love this place. Be sure to get the table side guacamole. I would say they have the best guacamole in town.  The food is consistently good. The service isn't really the best but the food makes it worth it. They have a happy hour, too, so that's when to start drinking the Cadillac margaritas.

Walked and was seated right away. Great atmosphere and very friendly staff. Was suprised to be in a place with refillable horchata. The complimentary chips, beans and salsa was on point. The horchata was made perfect. Will update once we get the main entrees.

We are visiting Las Vegas from near Memphis, TN and really wanted to try some authentic Mexican food. After reviewing the many positive reviews on Yelp, we knew Bonita Michoacan was a 'must try' place. We were not disappointed. Oh, my, what awesome food and absolutely wonderful service.  We were initially provided with chips and their home made red salsa and also a bowl of refried bean dip. The salsa was well seasoned and the beans were addictive. We ordered a hotter salsa (because that's how we roll) and were brought a green salsa--whew! Fabulous and very hot.  We ordered the Mexican Pizza appetizer with a side of roasted jalapeños and grilled onions. Both were so delicious -- we highly recommend!  I had a combo platter with the pork verde and guacamole burrito -- fabulous. This truly is a must - try restaurant!

This is a solid place for Mexican. The food is usually amazing. I did have to send something back once, but they graciously and quickly made me something else that was fabulous.  Great service!  Great prices! Great food!  I do recommend!
Good food and great margaritas. Only issue is small parking lot. And it's best to make reservations

Exactly what I was looking for and more.   A family friendly, sit-down establishment with a fun and welcoming atmosphere with live music, house made tortilla chips, fresh guacamole made at the table, attractive and tasty dishes, with an extensive beer and cocktail menu.   Perfect for parties and one-on-ones alike. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to have a meal here.
Top notch Mexican food, if you're in the area make sure to stop here if u like Mex food; aside from the great food it has an awesome atmosphere and great customer service.
This was an amazing meal... The Mole was killer. Service excellent. We're from out of town, always willing to try new places, this did not disappoint.
Gotta get the Guac!! Everything I've had here is great, but the Shrimp dishes are the business.

Came here for a friend's birthday party of 10. Sat immediately, wages no time getting our drinks ordered and brought to us, best michelada. Food was tasty and you can't go wrong the portions are huge. So the waiters had a great positive attitude and seemed more than happy to offer their services and do their job.  1st time eating here and won't be the last.  Delicious.

Great lunch fajitas. Awesome flour tortillas.  And hey, the free margarita for checking in at the place ain't so bad either.  The bartender at lunch is very talkative and easy going.  Food was excellent, I recommend it.
Birthday celebrations are festive and make you the center of attention. Great employees, really make you feel at home.

This is the best Mexican restaurant.  Everything is fresh and nothing we've tried tasted canned.  My daughter enjoys the steak nefia.  Get the tableside guacamole.  Red and green Chile are excellent choices!

Favorite Mexican place in Vegas. I have been here four times now and ordered something different every time. the chilaquiles are amazing as well as the fajitas and the albondigas taste homemade! Juan was our server tge most recent time. He was VERY attentive which i truly appreciate especially since it was the middle of the lunch rush. I never even had to ask for a drink refill because i had a fresh drink before i reached the bottom! The amuse buche is tortilla chips salsa and homemade refried beans. These beans are as good as my own mothers but dont tell her i said that! This is the only traditional authentic tasting mexican restaurant i have found since moving to LV. I reccommend the chicken mole. The sauce is rich and thick and frafrant with spices. You will not regret it!

Have driven past this place for years and finally decided to give it a try. They are advertised as being "authentic" mexican food - so when I asked if they had Horchata they said yes, and when I asked if it was homemade they said NO. So much for being authentic. Their salsa has a weird taste to it, and is the worst salsa I've ever had. The chips we received were broken into tiny pieces (as if we had the bottom of the barrel). We saw other tables get their chips piled high and in large pieces. The waiter, Saul, seemed nice at first but I then realized he gave ALL his attention to the hispanic diners, we are white. I felt discriminated against. I ordered the Sopes and they were flavorless. Saul NEVER came to the table to ask how everything was - isn't this one of the main responsibilities of a server? I saw some older mexican woman walking around with a scowl on her face (probably somebody's illegal mother) and I politely asked her if we can have more chips and bean dip....she stared at me for a minute without saying a word. I repeated my request and in very broken English she says "more??", as if that was unheard of. Chips are always complimentary and refills are always given. When we left I had to ask for a to go box. Saw the mean old lady again since Saul didn't care to check on us and I had to talk with my hand showing this woman the size of a box I needed. this place needs to give ALL their customers the same respect and attention, no matter what race the people are. Train your workers to speak English since you are in America!! Never going back. Horrible experience from start to finish! Roberto's Taco Shop is more authentic than this place!

Great food. Good drinks. Closest to my mother in laws home cooked meal that I have found. Love the live music on the weekend. Great place for large groups.my favorite is the menudo on the weekends. The shrimp cocktail is yummy to.

I wanted to like this place, I really did.  The decor is great, and the men that serve the drinks are all totally on top of it and very friendly.  That is why it gets two stars.  Our waitress unfortunately wasn't as nice.  But without even that, the food just isn't good. Maybe this is a different type of Mexican food that my mom and I are just unaware of.. But neither of us liked anything.  The salsa was funky flavor, rice barely had flavor, chile Colorado was hard to chew, not tender.. Etc.  Well, we tried! On to the next...
