Made reservations by phone and told them we were celebrating 2 birthdays. On arrival hostess acknowledged we were there for 2 birthdays.The bus person was great, tried to get the server's attention 4 times as I wanted to get a drink menu,finally got it wanted to order a virgin drink again difficult to get server's attention. Food took a while but worth the wait. During dinner 4 or 5 tables were celebrating birthdays sombreros singing ,when we were given the check there was no problem getting the attention of the server. No happy birthday wishes at our table! We always tip well maybe they thought the attention wasn't warranted. Very disappointed in the service. Yes I tipped the bus person.

Just finished having dinner for the first time at this restaurant after driving by it for so many years!  Well, we could kick ourselves for not stopping in before.   I ordered the Chile Rellenos Camerones, which were 2 mild green peppers stuffed with shrimp and topped with cheese. They were really tasty and the shrimp tasted fresh and not like they've been sitting in the fridge for a week.  This entree came with tortillas (corn or my choice, flour) freshly made on-site.  Curiously though, as many homemade tortillas I have eaten in my life, these got really stiff, pasty and cracker like once they got cold.  The wife had the Sopes with Carne Asadas which she enjoyed.  Our sons enjoyed a cheese quisadilla and the other, a cheeseburger and fires, which were really good.  All entrees came with a really good fideo soup.    Service was really good.  The only hiccup came at the end.  At the beginning of the meal (when we were ordering) I presented our 20% off coupon from our local newspaper that was valid Sun-Fri.  Our server told us he would deduct the discount when he brought our bill at the end of the meal and placed the coupon in his shirt pocket.  I made a silent bet with myself that the bill would not reflect the discount because the server was going to worry we would not tip him appropriately.  My wife and I are not those kind of tippers.  If they are good they will always get 20% from us and if there is a discounted amount, they always get the pre-discount amount for a tip, but we know there's a lot of people who don't practice this but to each their own.  Anyways, we finally got the bill adjusted and left, happy.  We'll definitely be returning here and bring out of town family and friends here also, since El Patron closed.  This place is a lot cheaper than Lindo in HD, whose parking lot also sucks!

I have been on the search for a great Mexican restaurant ever since I moved back here a few months ago & THIS IS IT! I feel like I am in Mexico every time I go. The atmosphere is great. The staff are friendly. The place is clean. The location, super easy to find. Good parking spots.   Firstly, the chips & salsa they serve when you first sit down are delicious. They also serve BEAN DIP! We always get the guacamole as well & it is made table side! Be careful not to eat too much & stuff yourself before you even order, like I always do.   The menu is so big, it always takes me a while to decide. They have a combination menu for people like me who can't decide on what to get. Last time I got the beef taco & cheese enchilada combination, which is served with rice and beans.   They also have a great desert menu! I forgot what the name was, but we ordered the Fried ice cream with bananas around it. It was delicious! Also, their margaritas are exceptionally good.   Definitely going here any time I want good Mexican food in Las Vegas.

The restaurant is nicely decored, and people working there are very good.  Perhaps the best part of the experience was their bartender. It was a pleasure to see a young woman with class, style, grace, as well as being a great bartender. I am glad to see that there are some young women left in the world like her.  She was amazing.

Let me start off by saying everyone was extremely nice and very attentive. First of all, as soon as we sat down, the waiter brought us chips and two different dips. Which was delicious by the way. We started with appetizers. Sopitos.... chicken on top of gorditas with cheese, sour cream and guacamole. Then they served us with a small cup of soup before our main entree, which we were not expecting. Then onto our entree... chicken mole poblano for me.....DELICIOUS! Made the old traditional way. My hubby had the beef chimichanga which was deep fried and topped with sour cream. Both plates were so tasty and of course huge portions. Needless to say we will be back!
I love it!!!! Very Mexican.  Tortillas made by hand  The drinks are great  And the food is amazing
This place had really friendly service. The food came out fast and hot. The food was great especially the fresh guacomole that they make infront of you, just the way you would like it.

I have never been to this location and I'm glad I came. The food here is so good.   There are several Lindo Michoacan Resturant and I believe this one is the original location...but I can be wrong. Located on Decatur in between Twain and Flamingo in a big corner lot by itself. Cool out door patio and cozy interior with low ceilings and different aesthetically compared to it's other big location in Summerlin and Henderson but the food definitely makes up for it in big ways.  I came with a party literally of 14 for a late company Christmas dinner in January and Violeta handle us with complete ease. She was not only helpful but she was so pleasant, swift and personably. I really enjoyed her, her smile and friendly service made it for a great experience. She went around the table with individual attention with and balance us and getting her job done Kirk a pro. The whole staff was amazing especially when we had the entire crew singing happy birthday to one of our guys. It was so fun complete with a mariachi band, a ginormous sombrero and a tequila shot poured into your mouth and your head shaken by the person who does so. It takes me back to my trip to Cancun; so much fun.   We had happy hour bucket of Coronas (they were baby ones) and some of us ordered margaritas which there was some very interesting flavors that I really wanted to try but I stuck to my tequila on the rocks and again Violeta did not disappoint when asked for her recommendation. I'm not sure how everyone's food was but the whole table had nothing but good things to say about what they got to eat. I got to try my neighbors carnitas and it was BOMB. So tender and full of flavor and not dried and tough like pork at other places can be. I gave him a taste of my Cilantro steak which I ordered Moo mooing as Violeta would say and he liked it a lot as well. The steak was rare and the green cilantro sauce on top was really good. The guacamole table side was so good but I missed the show because I showed up late.   All in all a wonderful experience and when the food is good out of the ball park is what they hit!

The best in Vegas by far. This is where the locals go for Mexican. Many different dishes not just tacos, burritos etc. Many seafood dishes.  Service was exceptional. They make the to taste right at the table.  Drinks are also good. As an added attraction there is a lady making tortillas right in the front. Not the easiest place to find but worth the search.

Everything you expect from a great Mexican restaurant.  Very home-ish feel. Good food. Good service.  Parking lot in front of the restaurant. No wait on Saturday night for dinner.  Everyone in my party had something different and it was all delicious.    Will definitely be back.
Get a free margarita when you check-in on Yelp! Generous portions of delicious Mexican dishes :)

Omg!! This place is amazing!!! By far at the best restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas. The spot is sooo cute and colorful with high ceilings which is a plus because it doesn't make the place feel all stuffy. I tried the enchiladas Michoacánas and they are a MUST the sauce is sooo tasty full of flavor a tiny bit spicy but it's perfect. Please please try it lol. All the main dishes come with fideo soup that tasted homemade just like the one my momma makes :) my friend had the ceviche de Camaron she disliked it she feels it needed more flavor by the look of her face i can tell she didn't enjoy it one bit. But overall the place was great at least my dish :) oh an their agua de horchata is very good tooooo

The service here is probably the most noteworthy, fun and relaxed- and ultra attentive. Everyone in my group seemed to enjoy their food-   For my Chile verde I substituted Lengua, and it was great. Their Utra Margarita is awesome though! 6 shots in a huge margarita glass you get to take home afterward. I can't belive I got through the whole thing! My fiance tried some of their cocktails which were just- eh, nothing special.  Go for the Tequila Margaritas you GRINGOS!  This is a fun place for classic mexican dishes. Ole!

Food always great and service always pleasant! Love this restaurant. Great for family dining out. Sometimes their table are a little sticky, management should pay a little more attention to it. Overall my favorite Mexican restaurant in town!
I've come here many times and it's never disappointed from the margaritas to the different entrees. I highly recommend this place

I really like this place. We come here pretty often and never really have a bad meal. Service is hit or miss, but we usually have a good time. My favorite dishes are the green pork burrito, whole fried fish and menudo. The salsa is good and spicy too.
I came here for dinner once. Their Carne asada was really good and guacamole amazing.  You must try this place out!

Delicious! The only thing better than the food was the service. The waiter was the best! He was warm and friendly and funny. We had 5 different entrees and everyone enjoyed. I had a creme and pepper base chicken breast entree that was so tender! Each meal came with noodle soup as an appetizer along with tortillas and salsa. We left very satisfied.

Food is delicious so tasty awesome service Eduardo our server was so nice and friendly I will definetly be coming back to this place. The ambiance is good not a long wait and great decor I'm glad I found this place while visiting from la

Prices are higher now but the quality of the food is still superb. I love the seafood cocktail and the fillet relleno(don't think I spelled it right.) It's very delicious and highly recommended. Food is 5 star. One star removal for the prices but I always go. Lol.
Best Mexican in the World!  Best Service and total fun!! We've made Bonito's a destination for us whenever we come to Las Vegas!

This is the best authentic Michoacan restaurant in Las Vegas!! We have tried several items on the menu, had lots of birthdays celebrated and this I seal way our first choice for Mexican cuisine.  The service is always impeccable. I am a picky eater and I can honestly say I have not had a bad meal. Every meal is prepared to perfection!   We will also recommend Bonito Michoacan.

Why I keep coming this place? Well, Because I really like the authentic Mexican food and here you have it. My wife is from Michoacán and she said that the food is definitely authentic from Michoacán.  This time I ordered mole with chicken, oh wow. It was delicious. The pasta soup they serve is so tasteful. The margaritas are so delicious. The personal is so friendly. They speak English or Spanish. Your preference.
Very great restaurant! Great service and great food! Thanks to Jonathan, Omar Soto, and Nacho give us the great experience!! Will definitely come back!

Can't give lower or I would...1:00 lunch on Saturday...crowded, with a couple of big parties of 10+...My wife and I getting a couple of burritos, maybe $18.00 w/$4.00 tip...got the chips and dips, with soup to start...and that was it...chips gone, soup gone and an hour later, we were gone...nobody came to our table for an hour...our waiter was next to us, behind us, but never said a word about where our burritos were...no refills, no water, nothing...at least the gal taking pictures didn't stop and try to get us buy pictures for $10 a piece...pretty intrusive....stay away unless you want to get free chips, dips and soup and then eat your entrée somewhere else

I like this place overall, it's clean,colorful and the employees here are friendly and work hard.  For food I've tried the Albondigas Soup,Chips,Salsa and Bean dip The Albondigas soup here tastes great with perfect Meatballs! Tip: make sure to ask for the sides that go with it if your ordering to go, which are Spanish Rice, chopped Onions and Cilantro and sliced limes it's great for hangovers.  I liked the free Bean dip and Chips but the salsa had a chemical taste that was off putting maybe the salsa bowl wasn't cleaned properly.  I gave only 3 stars because of slow service and the Salsa...both times I've come here the Bartender was working hard, but overwhelmed with trying to keep up on drink/food orders, they were working so hard it was near impossible to get my to-go soup order in and later to pay my bill.   I wasted a good 30 minutes waiting, because the bartender who was working as fast as possible was just simply overwhelmed with other chores and kept ignoring my trying to get her attention.  Tip to Owner: maybe 2 Bartenders during peak business times would lessen customer frustration.
Thank you for the delish food and for accomadating our big party. We celebrated our daughters 21st bday and it was a blast with  great food and drinks.

Not bad! The staff is super nice.  This place has a bit more diversity in their menu than most of the Mexican food spots out there.  Their menu is fun.  Clearly lots of people like this place as it's always busy.   Service is great and the food is good.  It's slightly more expensive than others but I say it's worth it.  I will gladly return.

Homemade tortillas are sooo good. Get the fundido, it's in the classic style.   I grew up in So Cal, and it's really hard to find good Mexican food around vegas (at least to meet my standards!) This place does not disappoint.

Granted there were two large parties in our area, but service was extremely slow and inattentive. The food was ok, nothing extraordinary, but not bad. We waited 19 minutes after we were visibly done with our meal for our waiter to finally come back by and ask if we were ready, then it took probably another 10 minutes to get our check give him the card and get it back. I went in at 8pm thinking it could be a nice quick dinner and took almost 2 hours for 2 people..just seems ridiculous to me.
Best part was the free frozen margarita with a yelp heck in. Guacamole made fresh at your table. Great service, tons of food, reasonable prices. Took left over that lasted 2 days lol.

The food here is very good. Coming from California, I know good Mexican food. The food here is authentic and tasty. I ordered guacamole and they made it right in front of me. The food was amazing and needless to say, I have been back numerous times to date. I will continue to frequent this palace as the customer service is superb.

I got to give 5 stars on my 1st visit on Septemeber 2016 on our vegas trip to celebrate my daugther bday the food was excellent and the service from a wonderful lady was just amazing give her 10 stars not sure what her name was they take cute pictures and the happy bday song and the sombrero was just amazing so we where happy to have come across a real mexican place in Vegas so we decided to come once again in Nov on thanksgiving weekend they server was man with horrible service we had drinks and coronas and ask for Lemon he came back saying they where out of Lemons like really how can a mexican place the sells tacos be out of Lemons so a few minutes later we see him on a another table making guacamole and he is using LEMONS!!!!!  Ok whatever i decided to stay quiet and not say anything he will take for ever to come to our table to check up on us or for refills he was just horrible the guys cleaning up the tables where more helpfull they have funny names on their food and its a cute place and our server did not even brough us the fideo soup i had to ask for it in the end and he only came with one he was just horrible
Great service Richard our server was on point . All attentive and profesional . Definitely recommend this place

This place is awesome! I can't complain about a single thing! The food is great! The people are great and its always fun! Ask for Juan as your waiter and I promise he will make your visit worth your while! We had our wedding rehearsal dinner there and it was amazing! Go there once and you will go there again for sure.

Best service! I mean impeccable! It's Mother's Day and we waited for nothing. Food was fresh and absolutely delicious!!! I'm so excited about this place! Out of town guests will love this it here! We actually feel like we are on vacation in Mexico. The music- the total vibe in here- so much fun!!

Great service and food as always. Can't go to Vegas without stopping here to recover after a long night. I had the Pollo Del Res. The veggies were so fresh with tender shredded white meat chicken. The tortillas both corn and flour are made fresh. I highly recommend!

This place is super awesome! The service was great! Very attentive! The food was absolutely on point. Order the shrimp fajitas and they were delicious! Drinks were amazing and at a reasonable price! Homemade tortillas were delicious! Ugh loved it here! Would highly recommend this restaurant to my friends!
The service here is just excellent! Fast and efficient.. the food was a little bland but the service makes up for it.. glad we stopped by before our drive back to Cali. Totally worth it!

Probably the best Mexican Food I've had, by the way I'm Mexican I eat these things all the time. We came to Las Vegas from Maui Hawai'i back in July of 2015. In Hawaii we have Mexican Restaurants but none are as good as this one. I was amazed at how authentic the food was because it really felt like home. The atmosphere was great and the service and employees were friendly. I hope to go back one day to eat here again.  FINAL JUDGEMENT:  5 STARS-----Customer Friendliness  5 STARS-----Taste of Food 5 STARS-----Restaurant Appeal  4.5 STARS-----Pricing (Well worth the cost)  4.5 STARS-----Cleanse   AVERAGE 4.6-4.8 STARS but Ill give it a 5 STARS simply because its too good to be missed.
Amazing staff and food. Ask for Armando because he's an excellent server. Will definitely come again !!

The service is always great, even when they have a packed house. They also offer a good selection of vegetarian options. The alcoholic drinks are nice and the tortillas are a must try! This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.

Steak cilantro was amazing. Went on cinco de mayo. Being a Mexican restaurant, it was busy, but in 20 minutes we were seated and had our drinks.THE STEAK. WAS THE BEST!!!!! I had chile relleno and it was delicious and... Delish. Do not miss steak cilantro! We stuffed ourselves with guacamole and their fabulous bean dip so we were already kind of full. Totally worth the short wait. I recommend this to anyone who likes Mexican food. Large menus ensure everybody gets what they are looking for and even if they don't know, it's safe to try something new!
I love love LOVE this place!!!! Great authentic Mexican restaurant.  Every time I'm in Vegas I make sure to stop here for some yummy food.

Their food was amazing! My first time going and I will definitely be going back! From their chips and salsa to their carne asade tacos this food is not heavy and is fulfilling. So glad this place is close to my job!
Every time I'm in town I try to swing by. I love the locals vibe.  The bar is fantastic!!!!
Our first time here.  Loved the bean dip and salsa.  Our meals were better yet.  Recommend the Camarones Saranadeados ... Delicious.

Every time I would drive by this restaurant the parking lots always at its max capacity.  So finally on a slower day I decided to give it a try :P  The ambience was highly energetic.  All the coworkers  gathered and sang two different birthdays.  The decor was very colorful and gave the Spanish vibe.  As I looked their menu I was getting pretty  full eating their complimentary snack- chip and dips.  They had bean, salsa and guacamole (this was extra $8)  :P  what was so awesome, was how they made the guacamole right in front of us!  Two whole avocados and get to tell them how spicy you like it.  Then they also give this comp soup cup - chicken/tomato I think ? It was pretty delicious.   Their cilantro steak ($16) was very tender - I ordered the steak medium rare.  They had  Green sauce with sautéed onions on top of the steak.  It came as a combo - with rice and beans.    I also tried their chilé relleño burrito ($8.95).  I wasn't too impressed with it.  This is what I would order at any other Mexican fast food chains, but this restaurant made it like an enchilada style - with tomato salsa over it.   Maybe next time I'll tell them just like a regular burrito with beans and rice inside the burrito and no sauce on top :P
I'm at the bar having huevos machaca for Easter lunch & it's delicioso! Their margaritas are delicioso too!

Wow!!! This place was a treat, I have no complaints service was friendly quick and hospitable. I was surprised when they welcomed us to our table with complimentary soup salsa n bean dip. But what really made this a great experience was the shrimp plate, I have never experienced a taste like that. I'll be back soon!
Love the Mexican food here, went this weekend with my in-laws and they loved it too. Some friends of ours introduced us to this place and were hooked. Mexican pizza is delicious.
If you go there, be prepared to eat!  The food there is delicious, and the service fantastic.  We brought our daughter for her birthday meal here, and they could not have been more gracious.

Great food here ! I'm from LA calif. And the food here is excellent. The service, waiters and waitresses are always checking on you for any refills or anything else you need. And the homemade tortillas are to excellent in flavor. quality overall, a 10!

Came here after recommendation from others as well as seeing the reviews on Yelp.  First off, the starter chips and refried beans/salsa are great. They come quickly, taste fantastic, and are plentiful.  Service is also great - I found it hard to reach the bottom of my glass before refills, waiters were (sincerely) friendly, etc.  Soon after ordering they brought an appetizer of spaghetti soup(?) which was way too salty for my taste.  I had ordered the fajita, which was just okay. The beans/rice/guac that came with were high quality but pretty sparse. It came with some pretty amazing flour tortillas though, which really carried the meal.  Flan topped off my lunch here for dessert. It was definitely too sweet and soft for my taste, but was edible.

I went here with a friend because of the reviews. 4 and 5 stars? I don't see it.  They do have a good mix of authentic and Tex-Mex on their menu. The menu is extensive...but I'm only going to comment on what I had.  Fajitas. I ordered a mix of pork and beef. When they arrived they were sizzling hot but flavorless. It's sad when the bell peppers have more flavor than the meat. The only way I could tell the difference from the beef and the pork was that the pork looked like pulled pork -- and about that... isn't fajita meat typically grilled? It honestly looked like they threw some pulled pork on the sizzling plate and tried to pass it off on me.   The only plus was that the tortillas were freshly made.  I forgot what my friend ordered but when I asked him how his was he just shrugged his shoulders and said, "It's ok I guess".  The service was great and the waiters were very friendly. The salsa was "ok" and the bean dip that came with it was, well, bean dip...nothing "addictive" about it like I saw in another review.  The lounge singer they had was playing mostly songs from the 80s. 'I Just Called to Say I Love You' by Lionel Richie? C'mon, Man. I think he played 2 Mexican songs the whole time we were there. I personally think it was more annoying than entertaining but hey, maybe other people like that kinda stuff.  I probably won't be back because it simply wasn't worth it. Bland and ordinary.

My 2 friends, son (toddler) and I ate here about 2 weeks ago and we loved nearly every minute of our lunch! We had the cerviche and shrimp cocktail for appetizers and they were both awesome.  I wanted street tacos but I guess that's only during happy hour but the tacos I had were decent. I really enjoyed a much needed Michelada as well! Our sever was really great, I'm kicking myself since I can't recall his name (blame the memory issue on the 1 Michelada) but it was like he knew what I needed just before I asked for it. We will be back and I'm very happy to see that the quality of food or device hasn't gone down over the years! Gracias!!

Better service, better food, and a LOT less crowded (although it's only Tuesday..), than their counterpart Lindo Michoacan there in Henderson.  Sure, sure, Lindo has the spectacular views and what not, and their food is decent but all of that gets cancelled out when you're in a packed and noisy (super kid friendly) restaurant. Moving right along..  Back to Bonito!  Greeted by a friendly gentleman and escorted to our table, my eyes scanned the room to observe the typical, I mean traditional Mexican themed decor; vibrant colors, cheesy artwork, and no Mexican restaurant would be complete without "football" on the telly. My party and I giggled at the music selection throughout our entire meal, it went from Latin Country, to Latin Classic Rock, and my all time favorite, Latin elevator music. I have saved the best for last though folks when it comes to the decor at good ol' Bonito Michoacan..THE MILLIONS OF CLOWNS EVERYWHERE!  What's up with clowns amigos? I just don't get how creepy clowns and puppets dangling from the ceiling tie in to delicious home made guacamole and sizzling, cooked to perfection fajitas. The clowns didn't sit well with me, but luckily their food did! (*round of applause from my stomach*)   In any event, this fine dining establishment earns 4-starts on the Kim-scale-o-food-places, the fifth lacking for, well, it's no real mystery here: the clown decor (ok and I don't fancy the location either).  Great job Bonito, I'm not positive you would be the first place I would pick should the mood for Mexican food strike again, but you're for sure in my top 5!

It was really good. The service is excellent and it has some pretty cool ornaments; nice ambiance. We had the carne asada plate which was delicious. My gf had the menudowhich was not bad, just a bit too much fat on the menudo.  The bring you chips, salsa and frijolitos mmmmm really good! It could use a bit more lighting in some areas.  They got this old guy playing music  from back in days.... de la era del caldo lol.

We came here with a Groupon. I was reluctant since I'm just not thrilled with the Michoacan restaurants as a whole. I find the food to be overpriced and ever so bland. But, Boyfriend wanted Mexican food, so off we went!  This location is considerably less crowded than the others. We were seated immediately and had drinks within minutes. We ordered not long after that and were eating quickly. I noticed that the menu items are cheaper than at the other locations (combination meals average $11.99, as opposed to $14). The food was marginally better than other locations, I think.  I would love to go back to this location, though, because the service was phenomenal. Seriously, the best service I've ever had, ever.

Another great meal (and I ate too much!). Service was great, nice atmosphere and live music that is not obnoxious. This is an main stay for Mexican food with plenty of options to choose from. Great margaritas!

This place is just eh... Edible I suppose.... Seems like their food always takes so long just to come out warm. The chips and salsa are ok.  The service is never great but ok. Like most Mexican restaurants they just take your order, bring your food and your bill.... I only eat here when I'm invited to join someone, never by choice.
Waiter had an attitude, used the check in for the margarita . Oh well keep it professional and ate our food. The attitudes not necessary. Food was great
Amazing food! We came on the recommendation of a bell boy and the food was amazing. The cilantro steak is delicious as well as the carnitas dish

This place is awesome come here every time we come to Vegas. The wait staff is great drinks and food come out fast. The chips salsa and beans are so good to start. My favorite is the carnitas and tamarind margarita
The restaurant is nice & clean service is good chips & salsas were good and overall the food was good.  Comparing this place to Lindo Michoacán it falls short.  I don't think I would go back.

Where should I start? This place has great Mexican food for Las Vegas! The bean dip compliments the chips very well. I visited this place mid November and I didn't know what I wanted to eat for breakfast. It was already passed 10am when I realized that McDonald's would stop serving breakfast at 10:30am! I decided to google some Mexican restaurants and voila'! This place is close to the Las Vegas new strip. I had the machacado plate and he had the chorizo with cheese plate. Everything was great, the customer service and the price. I will definitively be coming back here every chance I can when in town. I am from Texas and it's sad to say the food here is better than some places back home. Now, you know! When in Las Vegas stop by here for Authentic Mexican Food....Only a 10 minute drive from the (new) strip.

Came here on a groupon. Had bacon wrapped shrimp. good flavors, but the shrimp was over done. Typical beans and rice. Nothing special. The food did come to the table hot. Nothing really stands out about this place.

I've come here a couple times now...I don't love it or hate it...but there are certainly some very bright spots!    The gringo in me feels like i'm deep inside a different culture just by walking in here.  Also, I love that the menu does a little translating for us...such as: "Servidos con sopa de fideos, arroz, frijoles y tortillas" and then the translation they give, "Served with sopa de fideos, arroz, frijoles y tortillas"...could we be missing anything here?  Additionally, they have some solid prices on some of their higher-end tequilas!  They make fresh guacamole right there at your table!  Their hotter salsa is tasty and...eh...hot!  I haven't found a 5 star Mexican restaurant in Vegas...Bonita Michoacan does a solid, authentic, job!  Carnitas and I have this thing...we love each other deeply.  The carnitas here don't love me enough for me to come here for them specifically, but they'll do in a pinch.
Pros: good mole sauce Attentive staff above average food They bring out complimentary bean dip  Cons: busy on weekends
Have eaten at several Mexican food places in vegas great price.. excellent service excellent food..
Consistently delicious! Great lunch specials and good service. Love the sopa de fidelo soup it's sooo good!

One of my favorites! I've been going to this place for years now but as I've grown older I've grown to appreciate the amazing food they offer.  The chips, salsa, and beans they offer as soon as you sit down are always so delicious that I have to limit myself lest I spoil my appetite (I'm not fancy - I've just always wanted to say "lest"). If I'm particularly hungry I order the Nopalitos as an appetizer. I absolutely love cactus and the way that it's cooked with onions and peppers is amazing and it's healthy!  I've had the shrimp cocktail, which has never let me down. The shrimp ceviche is one of my favorites as well. On hangover days I like to go in and get the Fideo soup (I have tried the menudo - I wasn't a fan). And nothing cures a hangover like a Michelada! The ones offered here never disappoint! The margaritas are also very good, as well as the Corona Margaritas, but the mixed drinks I've found are way too strong.  The one dish that I actually had to send back was the Mole. Call me spoiled but once you've tried my mom's mole, nothing compares. Mine was too sweet and the meat was too chewy. I sent it back and got a shrimp cocktail.  I guess this place just depends on your taste. Amazing for something things, not so great for others. Try it anyway.

This was the second place we ate at while visiting LV(check my other reviews for into).  Coming from the San Francisco area, where good Mexican food is hard to find, this place was a step up with chips and great refried beans served right up, nice Mexican decor, and excellent service.  I started with their Cadillac Margarita with Patron Silver.  Nice size goblet and a nice buzz that lasted the meal.  My girlfriend ordered the "Vampiro" which tasted like slightly alcoholic cool aid.  We sent it back and immediately had it replace with a delicious pina colada.  I had read about their Chile Colorado, a new york cut into pieces in a red sauce(gringos need not worry about it being a spicy sauce) to which I added their flavorful spicy sauce and that did the trick.  I ordered the flour tortillas (I believe they are freshly made, as it tasted that way to me.)   My girlfriend ordered the Mexican combo beef taco, chicken enchilada,  and chile relleno ( The beef taco took first place, chili relleno second, I found it delicious on a taste test, and enchilada a distant third.  Finally, always in search for the authentic churro, it was done right served with small decorative flowered whip cream flowers to dip in.  It was crisp and not overly sweet.   Overall I give this place a B+, as their chili colorado good have been better, perhaps make it bit more flavorful.  Nevertheless, as Mexican restaurant goes from where I am from, this place any day.

The service is top-notch and as far as Mexican restaurants go this is one of the better spots in Vegas. The decor is bright and fun with a cheerful atmosphere.   They have an extensive menu with a nice selection of seafood. I've tried the orange roughy and the camarones a la diabla but my go-to is the red snapper. It's a whole fish served fried or in garlic sauce with rice, salad and french fires. You can sub for beans or veggies. I usually do, it just doesn't feel like fries are the best option for this meal.  The guac is good and they serve a habanero salsa with a nice kick. It's not the standard salsa that comes to the table with the chips and bean dip, but if you request it they are happy to comply. There are no taps at the bar and the bottle selection is limited. The beer is not the main attraction at this bar, it's all about the margarita.

If ur looking for authentic Mexican homemade food then look no further! Off the strip so its a total locals place! The decor, the staff uniform, the sopita de fideo, the beans, ughhhhh everything is HOMEMADE! I do wish the tortialls were hand made though BUT trust me u won't regret it! I had the cilantro steak n it was juicy tender and full of flavor! The food is delish! And its not greasy like some fake bootleg Mexican places ive tried out here! Am from Cali n recently moved to vegas in searc of some good authentic Mexican tacos n food like back home and FINALLY foubd this hidden gem!

Carnitas, carnitas, carnitas.  I have to give a place props when they make carnitas so tender and yet the meat is not fatty.  I respect that!  Portions are so big, you can easily share this dish with someone else.    The restaurant has a singer, our server was very attentive and upbeat, you get this addictive re-fried bean dip with the appetizer, it's easy to get full before your food comes.  I have yet to try the guac, everyone is talking about it in the yelp reviews.

Best Authentic Mexican Food!!  You gotta try the soups, chile verde and aquas chile!  Great skinny margaritas, too!  Local people come to this restaurant. You can't go wrong!  You gotta try it. No foo foo stuff here. Just real Mexican food!!

I have passed by this location many times and they always have a nice crowd. Tonight, we decided to try out Bonito for my birthday dinner. The atmosphere was authentic and our server was very helpful.  I had the chorizo tacos, which were filled with their homemade chorizo and served with rice, beans, and a scoop of guacamole. Their chorizo was good, not too spicy, but smoky. My partner got a combination platter with a chile relleno, taco, and enchilada. He said everything was good as well.  This location offered a free house margarita for checking in for Yelp users. The drink was actually very good and I ordered another. I did notice they only give each table one complimentary chips/salsa/beans starter and charging $3.50 for additional refills. I have to say I've never encountered this, even at more upscale restaurants.  The beans served were good, the salsa a little too smoky for me.  All in all, Bonito offered an authentic Mexican dinner for my birthday this year. There was a nice live band performing and the service was very good. We will more than likely be back to try some other options.

Looks are deceiving let me tell you!   This is NOT REAL MEXICAN FOOD. The salsa had no flavor the chips were stale  The coffee creamer was expired! Oh man our plates blaahhh!! We got huevos rancheros and chilaqueles it was horrible rice was nasty dry the salsa on top of the food was straight out of a can! Yuck! Never again..   I'M MEXICAN THIS FOOD IS NASTY STAY AWAY!! I KNOW WHAT I'M TELLING YOU!!
Servers are very nice but the food taste like microwaved leftovers.  However, if you give them a good review they give you a free margarita. Guess I'm not getting one...

Bueno, visited here with a large party after a family photo shoot. Service was really prompt, the chips were Delicious as was the salsa. I ordered the fajita platter, which was immense and tasty but i fought the battle of the belly bulge and won. Also at the time they offered a free margarita with my checkin so yay :D.

OMG I'm in LOVE with this place. I grew up and lived in this area and have been going to Bonito Michoacan for years. It's the best mexican restaurant that I know of in Las Vegas. I always start off with thethe part. Their steak pacado is my #1 dish!!   I love this place so much that everytime my husband asks me where we want to go on my birthday I choose Bonito! MMM! 5 stars all the way!

The food is on on point!  I ordered the carne asada and it was a full strip steak.  I loved it.  She had the cilantro chicken and it was great.  The chips and salsa with beans are some of the best in town.  Will definitely be back.  Great filling lunch specials too.

This place is a hidden jewel to all the tourist.  if you are looking for a tradtional authentic mexican restaurant then this is the place. the owner came from Michoacan, Mexico and they know how to cook.  from homemade tortillas to everything on the menu. You can not go wrong with nothing on this menu. they even bring you chips, homemade beans, and salsa in the beginning.  i would recommend this to anyone. Great food, Great service, and TRUE mexican food.

This is the place for Mexican food in Vegas. We go every time we're in town for both our daughter's softball tournaments and it's always satisfying. The salsa and beans they start you off with are great. The guacamole is made table side and you choose what you want on it. Almost every plate comes with a hefty serving of guacamole as well. If you check in they give u a margarita. It's always packed hit the service is great. Your cup will never empty.. Even with the Aguas Frescas. Their food is authentic and a reasonable price compared to similar higher end Mexican restaurants in the LA area.

In town with the family, we choose to eat out at a Mexican Restaurant, they being locals and we being from out of town took their word.  This place serves you chips with beans and salsa to start and their re-fried beans are amazing delicious.  When I ordered my food I had to ask for another side of re-fried beans.  I tried their Green Chicken Enchiladas, the sauce was not spicy at all which is a plus, because if the food is too spicy where you can't even enjoy it that's not a good experience.  I got 2 enchiladas with rice and beans and that was enough to fill me up, I wasn't left hungry or over full either.  My family members ate the Shrimp Ceviche Tostadas, I tried one of these and they were amazing.  This place was a good pick, they had music, great tasting food, the price was right, the atmosphere was nice and the servers were very fast and nice.
Place is great. Our server Lilly was so much fun to have around and did a great job. In addition, she made my experience a lot better than what I expected. Felt like family.
Really good service and nice people. Really good food. Especially the fresh made guacamole and menudo. I would definitely recommend it. I would come back whenever I come back to Vegas.
We love this place it's a must whenever we are in Vegas! Good food great service, Julio was awesome!! My kids love the bean dip they give with the chips and salsa.
Me and boys love going here a bit pricey I think but very good food I think their costumer service could be a lot better and be more organized

Excellent visit, it's been a few years since we have last visit this site , me and the family was so happy we took the time and made the trip again. First, server Martin was spectacular in every way. Waited hand and foot.. Didn't miss a thing.. Went far and beyond great service. All 4 kids loved him made the stay enjoyable . The food was timely and delicious . Portions sizes were more the expected . The Cadillac margaritas are a must try for a perfect mix of goodness . Place was very clean and nicely decorated , we witness a lot of happy go like tables eating , great vibe threw the whole restaurant we will for sure be back soon , looking forward to it. Great over all experience in every way. The way it should feel when eating out and spending Money ..

Ok this is a nice place... The food was good, I like the flavor of the fajitas better at other places but the tortillas were good. The guacamole my daughter said wasn't as good as a few other places as too chunky for her.... I like how they had basic options like chicken fingers for kids meals though. The mole poblano got good reviews at the table and some shrimp and cheese dish was big stars. The salsa had a nice kick.  The waiters were great.. Very attentive, and we were celebrating so they came and sang happy birthday (comic relief as maybe they sing that no matter the occasion as wasn't a birthday and they knew that lol) they put candles in the cupcakes they let us bring in and they offered to dance with the kids to the live music.  They let you watch the tortillas being made and overall a positive fun experience....other places I would go depending on what wanted but if the group wanted to go there I wouldn't protest

Very good food ,the fideo was delicious . Had a party of 8 ,would have been nice to have more chips and bean dip than the 2 small bowls. Definitely will come back when in Las Vegas again. Prices are very reasonable .

Steak Al Cognac was to die for!!!!! It wasn't even what I ordered but my Friend so graciously allowed me to taste it and it's definitely what I'll be getting next time! The red salsa was very hot, (I'm a but of a sissy when it comes to spice) but the green was much more mild and very flavorful! You do you have to to ask for it. You get bean dip and fideo soup with your meal it was very good! The service was great also. I'd also highly recommend the shrimp ceviche! So fresh and flavorful! I had the Camarones Dionisia..... basically Shrimp in a Chile Verde sauce with cheese melted in the oven with Rice and beans. Also really good! If your looking for real authentic Mexican food in Vegas this should definitely be on your list!
I love this place I come here often and they never disappoint me  food is always fresh and yummy I get the same thing every time lol

Not authentic at all. This restaurant is more for those who know nothing about Mexican food. People who believe chips and salsa is authentic enough. Ordered the carnitas plate and thought they came from a Chinese restaurant. The carnitas looked more like Chinese beef. The rice was dry, the beans were dry.  Id rather eat McDonald's than this place again.
The atmosphere, staff, and food are all wonderful. The waiter we had, unfortunately we forgot his name, but he was the best. The cilantro steak was amazing. It's a little pricey but worth it.
Fantastic food, great service and cute kitchy decor. My cheese enchiladas were delicious and my boyfriend can't stop raving about the fajitas.

Mexican food is a weakness of mine, especially since I'm supposed to et right for my blood type. However occasionally I will splurge and this is where I go!   Now the food is always excellent and I enjoy the atmosphere and even though the prices are still higher than I think they should be its a good stop to fulfill the craving.   I recently went to eat here with my husband,friend and little boy. The food came out hot and quick and they didn't miss a beat with filling our drinks. So they have great service. The only thing i wasn't found of is that the music was soooooo loud I couldn't hear my friend across the table. But that's really an observation rather than a complaint!   I will I back again and bring friends.

Came here for Cinco de Mayo, so it was pretty crowded. Parking can be a bit of an issue, but I was lucky enough to get a good spot. It took a little while to be seated, but I figured it was because of the holiday.   I ordered the Carnitas Michoacan, which was delicious! The pork was very tender and had great flavor. The beans seemed average, the rice was good, and the hand made tortillas were also good. I had the Tamarindo Margarita and the Mango Margarita. Both were very good! Our server, Violeta was awesome! She did great managing our large group, and all of her other tables. She was friendly, funny, and flirty, while getting all of our orders correct. I'm sure I'll be back!

All food was great!! Chili verde chimichanga enchilada style was delicious! They have a hot green salsa that's amazing add to chimichanga and omg even better. Margaritas are super tasty too.  Atmosphere is authentic and food was too.
Place is fire.. The atmosphere is a bit loud but food is amazing. Ceviche extremely fresh and the steak is on point

While I can appreciate restaurants closing for a holiday so the workers can celebrate as well, when your website advertises 'Come spend the 4th with us' and then you post a sign on the door that says your closed for the 4th as it's a holiday, I can't really get behind that.   It's cool and understandable to be closed on that day, but not when your website advertises that you will be open SPECIFICALLY on that holiday....   Normally I like this place, but that was lame.

Truly awful.  If I had not eaten here, I would not have believed it was possible to mess up Mexican food this badly.  By comparison, Taco Bell gets at least two Michelin stars.  Ambiance - A cut or two below Denny's, with Mexican colors.  The best I can say is that I didn't actually see any cockroaches.  There was some noise, which I assume was intended as music, but which sounded more like drunk UNLV students celebrating a basketball victory.  Service - Quick and disinterested.  In fact, quick is an understatement.  The food appeared within less than a minute, and was obviously pre-cooked and sitting under a heat lamp in the kitchen.  Food - Awful, awful, and more awful.  The tortilla chips were not fresh.  The guacamole had so much lime juice that it was nearly inedible (and I LOVE guacamole).  The soup tasted like equal parts dishwater and vinegar, with a thimbleful of ramen noodles thrown in.  My beef burrito had chunks of beef (God, I HOPE it was beef) that appeared to be boiled soup meat, although the tortilla was fresh.  Even the rice and beans tasted acidic.  The portions were small (no Woody Allen jokes here, please), and the prices (by Mexican restaurant standards) were no bargain.  Don't get me wrong - $8 for the guacamole and $10.50 for each Margarita is not ridiculous in and of itself, but by the time the check came I was thinking they should have paid me to eat here.

This place has an authentic mexican vibe to it. Great ambiance and the best service I've had in any restaurant in a while. The waiter and bussers are super attentive and friendly. You can tell they all care about making your experience memorable. Great food, drinks, and live music on the weekends. Great place to have a birthday dinner!

I have been eating here for years and finally decided to put up a review... To keep it short this has to be the best mexican restaurant in Las Vegas, the staff is always nice, the food is always delicious. I'm sure everyone says that moms cooking is always the best and believe me it is but when its my moms birthday or mothers day my mother shouldnt cook and I know her favorite authentic mexican restaurant to take her to is and has always been Bonito Michoacan.

We just had a fantastic experience here.  OUT_SSSTANDING.  The food was excellent, fresh guac prepared table-side, excellent salsas, chips fresh from the oil, great portions, super service, super prices...  The food was delicious, fresh, our server Julio was superb...the hostesses were smiling and really friendly.  No visit to LV will be complete in the future without a trip to this place.  It was that good.

I have been there 10 plus times now and still have never had a meal that wasn't outstanding.  Best authentic Mexican I have ever had and I travel the us for a living.  Just ask the server Richard for his favorite and you will never be disappointed.

Saw this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. Let me say everything from the service to the food was excellent. I got the queso fundido w/ mixed fajitas for two. Oh and the micheladas hit the spot for sure! RICHARD thanks for the great service.

Not sold on Bonito Michoacan.  Food was mediocre.  Guacamole was wonderful- avocados freshly cut in front of us.  Sangria tasted like cheap box wine with lemons.  Shrimp enchiladas were good.  Would stray away from this place but wouldn't suggest it. Maybe better for takeout...

This has always been my favorite Mexican restaurant especially for lunch. For over two years I've ordered lunch  here... never a problem. But today we ordered the green chili burritos there was literally about three chunks of meat in it along with a spoonful of beans and it was the flattest burrito I've ever seen. There was a spoonful of beans on the side and a fair portion of rice. Typically when we order and pick up we get the lunch special which includes one order of being dip and chips and a drink. Today there were  no chips ...just a container of salsa. I know sometimes things happen I hope this is just a rare occasion!  we'll give it one more shot but we were really disappointed. I hope this isn't another case of great restaurant gone bad.

One of my favorite vegas places. Giant margaritas, crazy clown decorations, live music, wacky servers. If you are looking for fancy Mexican food this is not the place for you. I always bring out of town guests here for food and fun. Once the server got up on the booth behind us and danced as he made guacamole ha! The food is good and the menu has lots of choices so you are sure to find something you like. Even though its casual the service is always great. Refill waters BOOM, refill chips BOOM. Birthdays are hilarious, they come out and sing to you and put a sombrero on you haha. It's fun and funky familiar Mexican fair.

This place reminds me of a El Torito chain with mildly better food.  I started at the bar while we waited for our table. I ordered a negro modelo and she handed me a bottle.   I had to ask for a glass and I got my own lime wedge.  The appitizer selection was a bit week so I started with just a dinner salad.   I thought they might have some  mexican infused dressing but nope. Bottle sauces.   For my entre I had the cilantro steak.  The steak had a lot of silver skin and the steak was covered in sauce but lacked much flavor.   This is a typical gringofied mexican restaurant.   You guerro friends will thank you.

Great Mexican authentic food. Read about this place and decided to try it next time I was in Vegas; It's like El Toritos Mexican food but better.  The hot bean dip they bring to the table is good.  I ordered the chese enchilada and beef taco hard shell you don't see hard shells these days anymore.  Service and ambience were good. I would return next time in Vegas.
The bar tender is beautiful an a sweet heart. Food An drinks are delicious. Will definitely recommend An bring ppl here to try this place.

Went for my dads birthday. The service was awesome the waiter and bus boy were both really nice and funny made you feel like you were at grandmas house. The food was just as good !!! They bring chips and salsa and beans that's are to die for! Then they bring sopa de fideo it's so yummy! Be careful and try to save some room for the main course! I had the caldo de res and it was very yummy!!! One of the best Mexican restaurants in Vegas it's very authentic in look and taste !!
Great food. Great service and of course Amazing drinks! Can it get better than this ? Yes sometimes they have live music! Pass me a margarita please!
Excellent and friendly staff.....the food is terrific as well. If your looking for mexican food near Sahara and Decatur don't pass this place up.

Fun place to celebrate a birthday because they sing to you and give you a sombrero to wear and maracas to shake. The mariachi guys take requests of regular songs too.   They serve complimentary warm bean dip and spicy salsa with fresh tortilla chips.   Fast service even when it is crowded. Authentic decor but the booth table was too high even for my tall husband.   The fried shredded beef tacos are awesome! Good enchiladas, rice and beans.
My server was larenzo he was AMAZING and made sure my beer and water was always full. Everyone here works fast and efficiently together. I will come back again.

Delicious, mouth watering fajitas. Outstanding service and even better margarita's. I'm a Mexican food consumer and have eaten at many authentic places from Las Vegas all the way to mexico. So far this is good in Vegas!

I really enjoyed the authentic vibe of this place, the food was delicious, the service was fabulous and the wait was non existent even for a crowded brunch hour.   I would/will be coming back when I'm in Vegas again visiting my family, next time I have to try the drinks.

Good mexican, good prices, great tableside guacamole.  A friendly atmosphere when you don't want "fast food" or "gourmet" mexican, but something in between. Not outstanding, but serviceable, decent food.

I love this place! Great service, food and usually there's fun music. Ask for the extra spicy salsa (not just the habanero one) because it's delish!   It's a go-to for date night when we don't want to spend a bumch of money.
Just fulfilled my craving for Huevos Rancheros. Great place. Beautiful friendly Hostess and great server. Of course I will return.

Got the campechana and the ceviche and both were amazing. The soup was good and I love the salsa that comes with the chips. The only reason why they're getting 4/5 is because we waited an incredibly long time to get our orders taken. They were busy, but not so extreme as to where we should've waited the time that we did, but you have the chips to keep you busy anyways! Regardless, the food was great and so is the atmosphere.
It's was just ok. It's nothing special. It was very loud, and the service was kinda slow. It's kinda crappy that they charge $3.50 for chips after the 1st tiny bowl. The salsa wasn't very good...

Terrible service.   We're waiting for 15 min outside coz like the foods.  Will never come back. The girl said never see us before didn't let 3 of us sit at big boot. Even no customer there yet. Coz we're the first customers.

Unfortunately, this restaurant has gone downhill.  I travel to Vegas frequently and always make a point to visit Bonito Michoacan.  Tonight, I took two friends there and we were all very disappointed.  The food was fair but the service was terrible.  We were treated as though we were a pain-in-the-ass and I even suggested no tip for the rude server but my friends are too nice and left a tip.  Quite frankly, our dinner and the service were an embarrassment.  Watch yourself, Bonito.  There are too many excellent Mexican restaurants in Vegas.  I'll move on to Mi Casa which is located in the Silverton and receive better service and better food.

Ughh i eat her at least 4 times a month and today decided to take it home :-(.. after i got done eating the side of rice i looked at the inside of the container and along piece of black hair i will never get it to go again and think about going back I'm grossed out ..I ate it all
The nicest service of all time. The best food in all of Vegas!! This is the best place. Forget the strip this is where you want to be!!!

I have been coming here off and on for about 16 years and this gets better and better they have extended their menu over the years as well as their desert and cocktails. You really can't go wrong with anything you order I have had chicken, steak, and seafood. Breakfast is also good and the posole. Prices are fair and it's a good little spot if you want to get out of the strip a bit and enjoy some good Mexican food and yes I am Mexican

Sad I have to give this place such a terrible rating because service and employees were impeccable; so friendly and accommodating. But the food was absolutely terrible. Paid about $13-$15 for a plate of 2 chicken enchiladas and rice. Others in my group hated what they ordered as well, my cousin ordered the enchiladas Michoacan and he said the steak meat inside tasted like rubber... all of our meat was tough, the enchilada sauce was more like a dried on paste, yuck. And again, I keep reiterating it because for some reason everything was just so dry! The Fideo soup was very good. I will give them credit where it's due, and the soup was truly good. In all honesty, You know it's bad when the chips and salsa were your favorite part of the meal. Will never return here :-(
Excellent ambience.  Cilantro steak was delicious. Service was top notch and checked in to enjoy a margarita on the house. Finished the dinner with flaming ice cream that was a hit!
Great place to eat! We come here every time we come to Vegas. If you like Real Mexican food and a free margarita stop by. You'll keep coming back for more! Guaranteed!

Very good food! Fast service. Came at lunch (1145). We got our meal within 10 mins of ordering.  My husband and I shared the lunch fajitas! Very delicious ! More than enough fo two people !  We also had the queso fundido!  So so good! Highly recommend!   I also checked in on yelp and got my free margarita!   They have free Wi-Fi here as well!  We will be back for sure!

Came for Happy Hour. We shared a shrimp quesadilla & ceviche & a small margarita. That was enough for me. My Fiancé had 3 street tacos plus a large margarita. I think his belly is very happy. Mine sure is. My favorite Mexican restaurant.

These guys have spent hours cooking and delivering free food to all the hospitals around town since the terrible mass shooting. It's a great representation of the heart of this family. Awesome to know they care and freely give to their city. Thanks bonito Michoacán !

Okay I have been putting off this review for almost 2 weeks but I've finally got the time to explain why my rating for this place is only 3 stars! I came here with a co worker on a lunch break a little over a week ago. Greeting from the hostess was pleasant as well as the customer service from our waiter! Good we ordered was the tacos lengua(cow tongue) and my fish tacos! Everything tastes okay UNTIL I went to go eat my last tacos and noticed a baby ant hop off my plate O_o yeah and we all know ants just don't roll solo now do they? Know what this means right? There's clearly more and to what wasn't a surprise I glance over at the window seal and it's plenty more under this vase! YUCK! We immediately got our server who apologized and told us this wasn't likely well we decided to kill one of them and save it in a napkin for management and surely she came out thinking that it couldn't be possible.. She explained that they always clean very good.. Well apparently not because these ants been shacking up for a while. She apologized and gave us HALF off our bill which actually should've been completely comp'd and maybe even a gift certificate to try them again. After being grossed out I didn't even want a to-go box..not sure if i would've wanted anymore ants to bring home (a lot of pun intended)..

I typically hate going to mexican restaurants because I usually leave thinking that I could have made better mexican food at home but this place totally made me feel like I was at home eating my own homemade food. Their guacamole is delicious, the beans were so good, tacos were fried perfectly and not greasy. My husband had the chile rellenos and enchilada and loved them. My son had the fideo and quesadillas, he said his dinner was "the best" :D Our favorite was the sopa de fideo. This is the first restaurant I have been to that offered it in their menu and it tasted totally homemade and was incredibly delicious!! Also the service was awesome, probably the best we've had in a long time. Waiters were friendly, our drinks and chips/dip were never empty, and they made sure to check in with us pretty often. Highly recommend this place! Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas!!!

The husband and I came here on a whim because I had an overwhelming craving for Mexican food. We searched via yelp and luckily were just down the street.  Juan might be the best server we have ever encountered- he was fun and personable. The food was authentic Mexican, genuine Michoacan flavor! We had the carnitas plate and eggs with shredded pork, highly recommend both dishes and this restaurant. We've decided to make this a tradition and stop here every time we come to Vegas!

If you are looking for authentic Mexican Food that is as good as it gets then you have come to the right place!  I'm pretty sure that someone's grandmother is cooking in the kitchen, it's that good!  What I like most about the menu is the variety of home cooking dishes that you don't find on the menu in other restaurants. The fish and shrimp dishes are great. Yes, we order the specialty dishes rather than run of the mill ordinary dishes. My wife and I have been eating here for 15 years and the food has been consistently good.  The staff are courteous, gracious and very efficient.

Craving the delicacy we call carnitas, I found myself at Bonita Michoacan.  I ordered the Michoacan carnitas expecting deep fried goodness but came out with a savory, saucy goodness! It was coated with a delicious green sauce that was superb for the carnitas!  The tortillas were thinner that what I was use to but they were homemade. Being different made it better!! The tortillas were also larger than the normal corn tortillas.  I LOVE BEANS! So it was a plus that they gave SALSA and BEANS with our chips at the beginning of our meal.  For all you clown-a-phobics, do not go here! There is clowns galore near the bathroom. If you go, you'll know what I mean.

The food was very delicious and authentic! I am definetly coming back. I had the chilaquiles and they tasted like something my grandma in Michoacan Mexico would make. Very satisfied, with food and service overall it was a great place.
Great service, great guacamole, generous Margaritas, and all around very good food.  It's the tastiest Mexican food in town and the best service too.

Good food when there open. Whenever that maybe ?? They have been closed three times since the first of the year for BS reasons. Most recently on May 1st .. the reason was to show support for there employees for employee appreciation day. My employer didn't close did yours ?? I was a regular but I have moved on. There is plenty of alternatives in Vegas to eat lunch. Maybe if the owners focused on business instead of being politically correct they would be better off. You have lost my business for good !

We live near this restaurant which appears to always be hopping and very popular. I truly appreciated the welcoming and very attentive staff. Margaritas were good. My husband had camarones rancheros which come in a red sauce with beans and rice as well as a soup. I had flavorful camarones borrachas which were better- buttery garlic sauce with red pepper flakes. We had very nice coffee and split a flan.  I thought at around $18 the entrees were overpriced. Portions are not overwhelmingly huge which is good. A good solid family place- not Wow but Good.
Came here for the first time. I had the cilantro Steak and my wife had the camarones sarandeados. Both were Bomb!!

Very expensive...but way worth the high prices because the all male staff is the greatest best courteous kind waiters in Vegas....a lot of the food comes out Luke-warm. Refried beans and the rice came out Cold...and the Fideo soup came out cold also...but waiters are so apologetic
I've been here several times. It's really hit & miss on food and service. The bar and live music can be fun. Steak is decent. Combos I avoid. Servers can be forgetful on drinks and other stuff.

I went the other day for lunch with a friend and was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is very authentic with hand painted chairs and decor. I liked the chill atmosphere. I had the lunch special beef fajitas and LOVED them. They didn't get served on a sizzling plate, but they were scrumptious all the same. I also really liked the complimentary chips, bean dip and salsa. I will totally be making a return.

I love the authenticity of the decor and cuisine. I celebrated my birthday there. It was a blast. The salsa and chips were savory and spicy and had you wanting more. The portion sizes was pretty plentiful I left with a to go bag. The waiter we had reminded us of a family member serving Sunday dinner he was laughing and joking and also very friendly. I had the "combancion mary y tierra" (Grilled steak and shrimp) which was DELICIOUS.... It was an enjoyable experience. I truly recommend for authentic Mexican and a good time....Try this place...

I went here with a friend of mine. The hostess and waiter were very friendly. The waiter took the time to understand what we liked and recommended a couple entrees. The food was delicious. Two disappointments were the chips and salsa and the small amount of guacamole. The salsa lacked character and texture. It did not taste fresh homemade. The guacamole garnish on the entree was about 2 tablespoons. Still, I will go three again for the appetizers and entrees, and the pleasant service.
Foos is great but service from the hostess could be much better. Get rid of the two gals at the front and then maybe 5 stars. They are rude, not welcoming and careless

This is one of the top two places I've had the best Mexican food in Las Vegas.  The food is authentic and the delicious EVERY time I have dined here. The staff is extremely helpful and pleasant on a consistent basis.  Occasionally they have a Groupon but it's rare.   PROS: Steak Cilantro               Chili Relleno              Steak Fajitas              Lengua Tacos              Pollo al mojo de ajo    I haven't had a bad experience yet and I've been here a few times. It's great for meeting friends for lunch or dinner. There is something on the menu for everyone.
We stopped by on Super Bowl weekend and were not disappointed the food was great Bam Bam was at his best. One of the most interesting men in the world ! Friendly and entertaining waiter.

Me and my family eat here every few years on special occasions. Both the outside and inside is very beautiful, adorned with beautiful colors and decorations. There is often times a mariachi band inside, filling the room with romantic ballads. Usually we get a platter of grilled meat and seafood, unless we want some of their quesadillas, caldos, and other dishes. Their torillas are handmade, very delicious with either soups or carne. Don't forget to save room for dessert (if your not full by the main course that is).

This was my first time here and the food was amazing. Being that my family is from Michoacan I saw a lot of familiar foods on the menu that reminded me of grandmas cooking. I tried the Enchiladas Michoacanas - sooo good. My boyfriend had the carne asada torta which looked great too. The beef was very tender and flavorful. The waiters were excellent too - very attentive and sweet. I can't wait to come back during my next trip to Vegas
Parese un restaurat de fast food la parrillada fria nada q ver con el otro de la desertinn por el mismo precio la atencion desordenada

I can't write a review because I'm too busy enjoying my chamoy margarita and delicious food!! Seriously, A+ guys. I haven't found a decent Mexican food place since I moved out to Vegas 4 years ago, and this place is like a dream come to life. GREAT service, excellent margaritas, and as authentic as you can get!  I'm in love!!
Best Mexican food in Las Vegas... chips and salsa aren't great but their Cilantro Steak is very tasty.  I would also recommend their Chicken dinners.
This is a very nice place to eat authentic Mexican food in vegas the is nice the flavor off the dishes here are perfect and the drinks are terrific!!! Thanks you guys for a very good experience
A nice mexican restaurant!!! Very good food!!! Our server donal was very kind and funny, litle bit loud cause of the tv , but is ok

There is no better mexican food in las vegas as far as I am concerned. The service is top notch the food is excellent and fast! Do yourself a favor and order the table side guacamole! You will not be disappointed !!

I went with a friend because I was really craving tacos and margaritas. I think we went on a Saturday night around 10pm. There was no wait.   The tacos were really good. The margarita with the 7oz corona with it was amazing! I seriously couldn't love the taste of it more! I definitely want to come back here again. The staff was also friendly.
The menu is amazing. I can't wait to come back so I can try everything. I had the ceviche and fish taco. Everything was delicious! Great service too!

I always get the same thing at Mexican restaurants, shredded beef taco and chicken enchilada with rice and beans. I've eaten here about 3 times and I think I keep going back because of their lunch specials. Their rice and beans is not the best. Sometimes when the main dish sucks, I can just fill up on rice and beans and be ok with that. But not here. They do have good horchata and my boyfriend absolutely loves this place. I don't know, just me I guess.

Atmosphere is Very pleasant, the service is very good. Menudo homemade and is very tasty, enchiladas are all very good, the bean dip is tasty with the salsa which is brought to every table. The avocado dip know as guacamole is very tasty but very high in calories. The cactus appetizer is very yummy served with either homemade flour or corn tortillas.  We first learn of this location on Cico De Mayo and have been back several times. One thing I must insist that you do not order are the tacos unless you want to become very disappointed like I did after ordering myself and my date at lunch a la carte two tacos and tostada de ceviche. Only the tacos were very small and fried with maybe a tablespoon and half of chicken and cheese combined and served over shredded lettuce.  These taco's looked like something you would generally avoid at Jack In-Box.

I'm back at it again with the yummie Bonito.. I really like this place with the happy hour and the drinks are great. I love coming here it reminds me of the real deal LA food. I've been to other Mexican restaurants but this one just makes me want to come back for more.   The service is great. When we go there we try to go during happy hour. I always have to order the Ceviche, Street tacos (carne asada, carnitas and pastor), sopitos and Toreados con chorizo. The hubs just shares with me but like to order the guacamole and chips. But the drinks oh man I get the Paloma and margarita.  The hubs get the beer. The tacos are delish, reminds me of LA taco trucks. Love the home made sopitos.  It is made in house which is amazing. The Treados con chorizo is good but I think I would rather just have cheese but then that would be called Chili Relleno. Good stuff this place has. With great happy hour price can't beat that for Mexican food.
Food was good but the margaritas was amazing service was a little slow but OK one of my favorite places to visit when ever I'm in las Vegas

Second time here and it was just as good as the last time. We arrived Saturday night @730pm. It was packed but we were able to get a table right away. The hostess was friendly and was able to get us regular table instead of a booth by a very loud party. Our water and chips were almost immediately served. The salsa was hot......ouch, but not for my partner who devoured the bowl!  Seconds followed and so did our waiter to take our drink order. I had a mojeto.........pardon my spelling. It was tall, cool and refreshing. This was laden mint leaves and plenty of alcohol. While waited for food, a DJ played some funky 70s tunes with Mexican music, we laughed and thought it was cool.  Our food was good, nothing out of the ordinary...I had the shrimp sautéed in a cream sauce with lots garlic which I love. My partner had the burrito....covered in cheese and sauce......uh interesting since burritos are not covered in either.  It looked more like a huge enchilada.  The overall service and atmosphere was great. The food, good....but not exceptional.  We will go back.

The steak & shrimp fajitas were very good, and it's a great meal to share. There was definitely enough to share with 3 people, the service was quick and I loved the chips & beans. For appetizers the cheese with chorizo dip was the best choice and delicious

Came in during my lunch hour and it was very fast and it was very delicious. My friend asked for freshly made guacamole and to my surprise they actually make the guacamole right in front of you. It was very delicious as well. I had a chile relleno which did not disappoint me at all. It was a great atmosphere, great experience, and most of all great food. Will definitely go there again!

Wanted something different from the strip buffets and restaurants, so I decided to give this place a try. Very close to the strip, excellent food at a reasonable price and great service! Will definitely patronize this place again!

A pretty big disappointment all around. Decent location, ample parking. This is a plus. Enter, no clear host stand/seat yourself situation. We stood awkwardly waiting while people piled in doing the same.   Got seated in a cute booth. Fun decor. Lighting hurts. Ceiling fans make for a strange strobe light effect. Maybe a special for Halloween?   Service is terrible - possibly the worst in Vegas. Our "server" was Israel (so says our receipt). Forever to greet us. We probably were 1/3 way done with complimentary chips (the salsa is hot, the bean dip with is excellent) before he remembered to ask someone to bring water to our table. We ordered cocktails. They came out separately. By about ten minutes.   Ordered an appetizer (ceviche - pretty okay). Israel came by to ask for our entree order. We said we wanted to wait for our appetizer before we ordered our entrees. It had been a while. He gives us an "oh yeah!" Guess he forgot that too.   Ordered our meals. A table sat down after us. They got the included soup and chip refills AND entrees before us. We had to ask for included soup - from I'm assuming a food runner - he was hustling though!   Our busboy had our meals boxed for us before Israel came by to see how they were.   Food was okay (pollo al cognac). Not worth going back for, when such terrible, neglectful service is "provided". Definitely not worth the price though.   However, shout out to Domingo, our hardworking busboy who kept our water full and table clean. The server could learn a thing or seven from his work ethic and care for guests.   Sucks it's so close to home, but I'd say it's worth the drive for ANY (maybe even Bell of Taco) other mexican food in the area.

2nd tine coming here. Food is bomb, and huge portions. The mixed drinks are authentic and on the spot. Pricing is on the expensive side but definitely well worth every penny. Steak cilantro is delicious, the nopalitos are perfect, amd the parillada mixta is the best ever. Great vibe and workers are very respectfull.. managers greet u once u are at your table. Suggest anyone thinking bout coming to just come. U will not be dissapointed

Fun! The experience is fun, yummy margaritas. The food isn't anything that I haven't had before. I ordered one of he combinations, it was tasty but nothing crazy different from other Mexican restaurants I've been to. I'll be back though, it was a lot of fun and looks like a cool place for birthdays.

4.5 stars  My family and I were introduced to this place by my in-laws.  They are regulars to this place, and it didn't take us long to see why.  This place has good food and good service.    The experience is started off with Chips & Salsa AND Bean Dip.  Chips are nice and fresh; not salty.  Salsa is usually good, but I love the bean dip!  The bean dip is excellent when enjoyed with the chips.  It is served warm and just melts in your mouth.    Our Entrees were just as good.  Some ofthe entrees that we ordered included a Chicken Flautas (my item), Chile Relleno / Beef Taco Combo, Lightly Breaded Thin Slice of Steak served with French Fries, etc.  although I feasted on the chips and bean dip, I was still able to feast on my Chicken Flautas.  They were nice and crispy (not oily) with juicy chicken pieces inside.  We also had the pleasure of ordering a large mango margarita.  Wow, it was definitely LARGE.  We even got to keep the margarita glass (rinsed clean thanks to our server).    Loved that they sang to my wife in celebration of her birthday!  A churro dessert was served as the birthday dessert.  To top that off, our server even had a shot of Tequila and Sprite to help commemorate the occasion.    Service was great!  Our server and team (food runners, etc.) did a great job.    Prices were also not too bad, especially considering we were there for dinner.

Bomb! Bomb! Bomb! I love everything about this place.  1. Service is great 2. Food is as authentic Mexican and delicious  3. Price is very reasonable.  Micheladas are the reason we first went here and they did not disappoint they are delicious with the Perfect amount of spice and lemon. Table side guacamole is always a must. The aguachile extra spicey was so fresh and delicious,everything just perfect. It's a must go to place whenever I'm in Vegas.

Outstanding! Best Mexican food in the Vegas valley. Nora the bartender is fabulous. She is always a joy see. She greets you with a smile and is always happy to see you. She is very knowledgeable on menu and makes the best suggestions on what you would love to eat. Make sure you sit at the bar next time your in and say Hi to Nora for me.  P.S. watch out for the owner. He stands at the end of the bar with a grumpy face and watches you eat...
