Came here at 1pm for lunch and they are packed! We waited for 5 mins and got a table by the window, yayy love it! At first they served us the chips, salsa and bean. The salsa kinda disappointed me because its plain, tasted like chilli oil without flavor. But that's not a big deal because it's free lol can't complain about it. I ordered the New York steak Carna Asada. It was very good.  Will def come back!

My husband and I went here to use our groupon. He ordered chile rellenos and I carnitas. Food was great specially with our groupon. However our server was not the best. He waited several minutes  before he checked on us or to refill our drinks. But the busser was very attentive and took care of us because our server wouldn't. Also the so called live music is just a man with a key board. If my review was solely based on food I would rate it 4.5. However based on the overall experience I had to rate 3.

i been coming to these restaurants since 2003,Bonito,Lindo and all the others...service is always been great,better than great food in the other hand not so much...and i understand since i eat out at least 3 to 4 times at week not everytime food will taste the same,but today i order Birria and it really let me down,the stew had no flavor at all amd the meat wasnt any better,tasteless both of them,really desappointed of that dish....the hand made flour tortillas were so good that made the experience not so bad,but ill stay away from Bonito for a while...hope next time i venture there i can get a better tasting Birria

We celebrated my wife's birthday here and the waiter got the mariachis to come sing Happy Birthday in Spanish and English and put a big sombrero on her head while she downed a shot of tequila mixed in lime juice. I recommend the 16-ounce rib eye with a bone. We only went here because the one on DI was closed for the employees Christmas party.

The margaritas are good.... not too sweet, but not trying to drown the sweetness with too much liquor. The food took a little long, but they were busy for a Monday I thought. Once the food came out, it was easily worth the wait. I had the mojara which is a pretty traditional dish that is replicated a lot in Mexican restaurants, but is a hit or miss. It was crunchy on the outside, moist in the inside. The waitress was friendly and efficient. This location is a gem outside of the strip and I would highly recommend it.

Real Mexican food , really good food, at a good fair price. Good atmosphere ,on the left as you walk in if you have kids please sit on the right as you walk in. I'm addicted to their beef cognac seems to be better at night. All the food seems pretty good.

Today we decided to have Mexican food for lunch.  We have been here before, but I have never reviewed this restaurant.  We started out with the chips and salsa along with bean dip.  I could actually make a meal out of these alone, but I paced myself.  Unlike my last review I was able to get my favorite Raspberry Iced Tea, and it was delicious.  Mom had a Chicken Chimichanga, our daughter had a Steak Burrito, and I ordered a Chopped Beef Burrito.  All of them came with the usual rice and beans.  We ordered a side of Guacamole and to our surprise, our server Lorenzo brought out all of the ingredients including the fresh avocados and began to prepare it right there at our table.  He seasoned it just to our liking and wow, delicious.  Mom and I spooned the fresh guacamole on our burritos, mmm, a nice added spice to an already delicious burrito.  Lorenzo was a great server, very attentive to our needs, and of course, our drinks never went dry.  Overall, Bonito Michoacan is an excellent restaurant and we will certainly be back.

The service here is amazing. The food and the drinks are even better. Best happy hour in town! Great prices and atmosphere. Alejandra the bartender makes beautiful and very yummy drinks. I will definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas. Thanks again

Good, solid food- a cross between Tex-Mex and authentic Mexican, definitely a place that caters to both American and Mexican tastes- the menu is HUGE! Chips and salsa are outstanding as is the guacamole. I had enchiladas and they were awesome, beans and rice typical.   Vibe is great and waitstaff are wonderful. I will definitely be back!

Normally me my boyfriend & friends go to eat here every time we go out to Vegas & honestly use to LOVE this place ! But this weekend that we were there the service SUCKED & the food had a different taste. . . I normally get the shrimp cocktail which is my FAVORITE & didn't taste the same as well as for the rest of the food ordered, what we did like was the oysters with ceviche on the top we got a dozen to share within 4 people & the waiter didn't bring us any side plates to use for them until we asked for the place was just way to dead unlike when Juan was there he was the life of this place !!

I really like the food here. the restaurant itself is really cute from the outside looks like something that belongs in Mexico! I love it  they sang me happy birthday with a full mariachi it sounded like. the staff is really nice and attentive.   good place to come if your in Vegas and in the mood for some Mexican food.

I'm surprised by all of the 4 and 5 star reviews for this place. I found the food to be very blah. Let me first say that the service was excellent. The servers were so friendly and checked on us often. If it weren't for them I would have given 2 stars.  The meal started off with chips, salsa and bean dip. The bean dip was ok but the beans really had no flavor and were very runny. The salsa was horrible.  It was also watery thin and had a weird flavor. After what I heard about this place I was excited to try the salsa but I prefer a chunky fresh salsa and this tastes like something from a can.  Then came a cup of Fideo Soup for us. This was tasty and it had a lot of noodle in it.   For my meal I had the #4 which consisted of a cheese enchilada, beef taco and a bean tostada with guacamole. Blah blah blah! The enchilada had barely any cheese in it and the sauce they put on top was as nasty and weird tasting as the salsa. The beef taco was cute and small but the beef had no flavor. My tostada had beans and tons of lettuce.. The small of guacamole I had was actually very tasty. I would never order this again I just didn't care for it and the taste. I could have done with out all the lettuce and had more of the other stuff on it.  My man had Fajitas and he said they weren't as good as Ricardo's or Cabo but he said they were decent. I tried a piece of his flour tortilla and I have to say I should have just ordered a stack of those and some guacamole because the tortillas were good. And the tortillas weren't small either they were a decent size.  The pic I took and posted on here looks way more appetizing then it really was. I tried to like it but I just honestly didn't :(  They had a man singing live music which was a nice touch. and happy hour specials  but during happy hour a margarita is still going to run you $4.50.  I don't see when we would be back here since there are other yummy Mexican places around town and especially with Ricardo's just down the street.
We stopped by here on vacation. The food was great, service was great and the environment was great. It's well worth a stop.
I love this place is so good. Every time I come here the food is delicious and the service is awesome. Make sure you check in you get a free margarita:)

3rd visit and it was excellent, as expected. I had the Camarones Dionisia with a Cadillac Margarita. This includes chips and salsa and a tasty soup before the entree. The service, food and atmosphere here are wonderful. The best Mexican food in Las Vegas!

Fan-friggin-tastic. get the chicken they recommend - it's a mind blower! Menu is insanely difficult to navigate so I just asked for a recommendation and poof, it was killer good. The best Mexican food I have ever eaten.
Came here today and ordered the lunch special  tacos. The tacos were super dry, barely any lettuce or anything else just a plain taco with chicken. Service was great but not too happy about the food.

Great atmosphere, but that's where it ends.  The dips were okay, not the best salsa.  The rest of the food was terrible.  The red sauce was like someone opened a can of tomato sauce and poured it on top.  not the worse Mexican food we've had, but close.

My favorite Mexican food joint in town. Hands down.   Customer Service is always excellent, but I like to sit down on the right side of the restaurant and get served by the pretty dressed up lady. Otherwise, service is usually pretty good overall.   I would come back here whenever I come back in town. Its one of those must.
Thanks OMG  O. M. G.  SO GOOD GREAT PORTIONS? and there's so much to look at services were excellent alsi

I visited this place yesterday afternoon with a friend. I hadn't been in years, but thought I remembered it under a different name years ago?? Anyway, decor, service and food did not disappoint. The restaurant has a very authentic feel and I love the decorations. Our server and other staff were very pleasant during our dining experience; chips and salsa and drinks never went empty. We both ordered combination plate entrees--mine was a pork guacamole burrito (excellent), a cheese enchilada, and a chicken taco. We also enjoyed the house margaritas which are offered through check in. They were so good, we opted for one more :) I would definitely recommend this place for people looking for good, authentic Mexican cuisine.

If you're looking for more authentic taste like home Mexican food, this is your place! When you seated they bring out bottomless chips with salsa and bean dip, they also bring out Fideo all complimentary. The food proportions are huge and the food is amazing. You definitely won't leave this place hungry. Not to mention the excellent staff & customer service. Been coming here for years.
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant! The food is always spectacular, service is good, and I love the atmosphere!

O M G amazing food and amazing atmosphere! Staff is so friendly and prompt, and well I have no complaints at all! I'll be back again for sure!  Combination plate #6 pictured. So good!! Oh, and a freshly squeezed lime juice margarita on the rocks!

Came here for a family gathering. Unfortunately, there are no real vegan options. Even the beans are made with dairy. The rest of the family seemed to enjoy the food, but vegans should come prepared to starve.

Searching desperately for a Mexican restaurant that stayed open a little later than 9pm on the night of my friend's dad's birthday, we settled on Bonito Michoacan.  What we received was extremely friendly service, a lot of delicious food, and they had like a 4 piece band sing happy birthday and gave our man of the hour a free shot of tequila.  I don't really see anything I could have criticized from our experience. We were seated promptly, treated well, and the food was surprisingly very delicious. Additionally, we stayed there for a good 40 minutes after their closing time and never felt rushed at all.  I had the steak cilantro, whilst the others around the table had an assortment of chimichanga, a crazy gigantic burrito, and chicken helena or something along those lines. Everything was cooked really well with rich strong flavors.  We also got the hand-made table side guacamole and it was extremely tasty and fresh.  All in all it was a very pleasant experience.

We came for the Preparados - also referred to as Michelada - so yummy and refreshing when you feel a little crappy after too many drinks the night before. They're very satisfying here.  I also got the cactus appetizer which was super juicy and fresh, very large portion, too. My friend got the steak with rice and beans and the steak was super flavorful and tender.  The beans they serve have so much flavor and I ate them w chips over the salsa because the salsa gave me a crazy cough attack (I think a little bit of pepper was stuck in my throat) which was embarrassing and something I didn't want to happen again lol Also, the service was really good. We were laughing because I would ask for something and they would bring it two seconds later. We started to think they could read our minds!

I'm sureee there's lots of opinion on best Mexican restaurant here in Vegas..let's review bonito Michoacan. NOT to be confused with, lindo Michoacan, that's just wrong. Atmosphere 8/10. Menu 8/10. Customer service 8/10.  Trust me, if you want good Mexican food, I don't see how you'll leave this place disappointed, yes I've had better, but not in this city. So let's be fair, when it comes to providing all of the good stuff like tacos and tostadas, you'll find that here. I love the live music and friendly staff, adds to the experience. Get a margarita here because they do that veryyy well. Good food, good atmosphere, and nice staff...all three aren't easy to find.

Was in Vegas for a friend's birthday weekend and looking for a place to go eat brunch/lunch at and one of our friends mentioned Bonito Michoacan, we all thought it sounded great so off we went!  When I got there, I check in on my handy dandy Yelp App and guess what! Just checking in I scored a free margarita, how sweet is that!  But they also had a little text promo too that gave you a free margarita as well, so the table of 12 was already set with free margarita haha.  They start you off with homemade chips, bean dip & salsa, the bean dig is great, mix it with the salsa and it becomes amazing!  Just take note, 1st round of homemade chips, bean dip & salsa are complementary, additional orders are 2.99, but we were a party of 12 and there was plenty.  After checking out the menu I went with Zitacuaro - 2 enchiladas in a Verde sauce, I picked chicken for my meat, and I have to say these enchiladas were great, the corn tortilla I believe was homemade, it was perfectly cooked, the chicken was shredded and it was moist and very good tasting, however they season/marinade the chicken was delish! The Verde sauce was delish too! One of the best I have had, full of flavor and the perfect texture. These were some great enchiladas.  Service was great and friendly, glad to have found this lil gem in Vegas!
Went here to celebrate my hubbys birthday. Eduardo was great. Service wonderful. Good excellent. Will be back for sure.

Excellent meal, and quite a steal when you add in the Groupon discount. The salsa and bean dip were good. Not the best I've ever had, but tasty and they were quick to bring a second serving when we finished off the first. Very quick to take our drink and food orders, and service was quite fast. I ordered a tilapia dish to do something different from the usual burrito or combo plate, and was very impressed. Whole fish, flaky moist meat, crispy skin and a flavorful sauce. It didn't feel at all heavy for a fried item. Came with a healthy portion of rice and beans, as well as french fries? Don't understand that part but even the fries were delicious. Very reasonable price ($13) for seafood and the portion size. Everyone else at the table seemed to thoroughly enjoy their selections as well.  I would definitely go back, even without a groupon.

This has akways been one of my favorite Mexican food spots, they make the best handmade flour torrillas.  The cilantro steak is an all time favorite, but anything on the menu is good.  The lunch menu has great deals too, the 3 item combo's always great.  At night they have great ambience with the live piano singer along with one of their many Margaritas or specialty drinks.  They are always busy but the waiters and staff are always ontop of their game.  I would recommend this place 3 times a week.

Best food quality in Las Vegas and better than my home town in California better than anywhere else. And the next best thing about it is, that they have live music with the best beans and chips. The top place where I would recommend people to come is here.

It was between here and Amigos Tacos, I decided to try this place because the reviews were pretty good. The parking was wide open, we were seated immediately and as I was excitedly anticipating, we got our chips - salsa - and beans. The chips were good, fresh. The salsa was very good for me but my BF prefers salsa with a little kick. The beans... well... they were OK, a little salty, but add salsa to the beans and a wonderful treat.   The menu is HUGE! It took me a while to go through everything and make a decision, I finally decided on the 2 taco combo (beef tacos) and he got the beef enchilada with green sauce combo. While snacking on the chips they brought out a soup.. I wasn't expecting soup, I still don't know what kind of soup it was but it was OK. About 2 minutes after the soup came, our meal came... The food looked good, plates were hot, that's always a good sign.   Now the meal... I took a bite of my taco and it was... a taco. The beef was lacking flavor, it was almost like they didn't season it while cooking, every Mexican restaurant I have been to has always used a combo of onions and other veggies/herbs to season their meat.. it just seemed.. blah. The rice was good, a little on the salty side as well and I usually put salt on everything, I like salt, but it was too salty for even me. my BF and I swapped plates to try each others dishes and his was very good. His beef was good, and it was the same type but since his food was covered lightly with enchilada sauce... i think it helped it out. I used some of his sour cream and the salsa and fixed up my taco.. not amazing but it was good.   All in all, I am happy we got to try it and I would come here again but I would definitely order something different. I will give Amigos Tacos a try next time and hope that their menu isn't as costly as it was here... over 5$ for guacamole..? Not worth it. But the main reason I will come back was the service, everyone was very friendly, our server paid attention to our table and once our drinks were half empty they had fresh ones on the table...

The best Mexican place out of the strip!  If your looking for a delicious Mexican place out of the strip in Las Vegas this is the place to go to!!!! Also the drinks are amazing I tried a cucumber margarita on the rocks and it was the best!! Cheap good prices and food, drinks are great. The best part of it, it's away from the strip and craziness... free parking too :)

If you are going to dinner with another person order the Tierra Cliente. This dish comes steaming hot with chicken breast, carne asada, carnitas and chorizo stuffed jalapeños.  With a compliment of beans and rice you will need a to go bag and several hours of exercise to work it off.  Great service and hot food. Absolutely worth it

Nice authentic feeling environment with a very large menu. I am not sure if i had a bad day but  the service and food were not very good. Tried this restaurant based on Yelp and another persons suggestion. But after eating here it was disappointing. I ate the fajitas and my friend had the Carne asada. Nothing seemed to be very fresh and the vegetables were overcooked. I wasn't expecting to be this disappointed but it really was not what I expected. Overall not great and will not be trying to return anytime soon. Sorry but that is the truth.

Our favorite Mexican restaurant of all time. We've been going here for 10 years and never had a bad experience. Table side guacamole is delicious and neat presentation made in front of you.  I've tried about everything and loved it. Lorenzo or Julio take great care of you.

Just tried this place tonight. I liked the free margarita that they give you just for checking in on yelp. I ordered chicken enchiladas with green sauce and they were really good. They came with rice and beans. I thought that the service was good, but I didn't get asked if I wanted anything else to drink when my margarita was getting low, but that is okay. My friend ordered the steak in coca-cola sauce which was good. I think if I end up going back here, I may order this dish. I liked the laid-back atmosphere of the restaurant and the prices were good as well.

I moved to Las Vegas from Phoenix where excellent Mexican food is very common. Which surprisingly, is not the case for Las Vegas. But alas, after almost 3 years in sin city and my search for a great Mexican spot has finally ended........and although i cant pronounce the name of this joint, it is delicious! and not over priced! Make sure to get the guacamole! (SP?)  Hand made to your taste, right at your table, just how it is suppose to be made! I have only been there on one occasion and it was packed, which is understandable, however i don't enjoy eating in overly crowded restaurants (which is the only thing holding back from a 5 star rating)
Great food and great atmosphere. I would highly recommend this restaurant. Authentic Mexican food and I would recommend the Cadillac Margarita!
The food here is great. Authentic Mexican food from Michoacán. I recommend you try this place if you love Mexican food.
We asked Our server, Jonathon, for a recommendation.He suggested the Carnitas lunch. He was right on, awesome food.We will be back.

The food and atmosphere is great. It gives you that authentic feel. This isn't my first time here and I came back because I like the food, however our server was meh. I had to ask for everything from other people and he didn't come to check up on us much. I still gave a decent tip, not exactly twenty percent. Lol. (I got to the restaurant before it was busy) Four stars for the food. Two and half for the server.

Definitely the best Mexican Food in Vegas.  Their salsa is fresh and delicious.  Ask for the verde if you want to kick it up a notch.  All of their dishes are good, but I have fallen in love with the pollo sarandeado.
Came to Vegas and was a bit tired of the overpriced Vegas Strip food. I love coming to this place when I visit from LA. I highly recommend it!
I love everything about this place. Its always packed, and the service never slows down! These guys do the same super fast service no matter how busy it is! Awesome place, with hilarious live music.

The atmosphere, excellent service, ice cold beer, and most importantly the FOOD!!! I had the Fillete Relleno, a seafood entree & it was magnificent! Violeta provided an exceptional dining experience with her attentiveness, smile, attitude, menu knowledge & all with authenticity not being forced & monotonous!! She's 5 STAR!!! All staff assisting her also provided the best!!! Manager also was genuine! Highly recommended!

Violete was perfect!! She helped us decide between apps and was so cheerful & polite!! Surprisingly it's not often to get such great service in this hospitality town (we are locals).   The food was like being back in Mexico on vacation, authentic and fresh!!  We will definitely be back and be referring to our friends!!

Great service, friendly staff. The food is so delicious!! I Highly recommend this restaurant. It was our first time being here and We fell in love with it! We are most definitely returning when we are in town.

Such great food! I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered. The chilaquiles and chorriqueso are my absolute faves. Only downside is that it's off the strip, but definitely worth the short drive from it.

There are lots of things to do in Las Vegas, but there is only 1 thing that is mandatory on our list: dinner at Bonito Michoacan. For me it's all about the carnitas. My wife it's all about the handmade flour tortillas. A trip to Vegas hasn't even begun until we've had our fix. We just love, love, love it.

This is easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  The chips and salsa are great.....both are home made and the salsa is very spicy.....just the way I like it.  It is not for the weak.  My favorite dishes are: Queso Fundido w/Chorizo - Basically a cheese appetizer with chorizo served on a hot fajita plate.  Comes with flour or corn tortillas....this is very good.  I order this when I take friends to this restaurant for the 1st time and every one of them agree with me.  Carne Asada Burrito - Very tasty, good quality Carne Asada.  Inside their menu, they have a lot of dishes to choose from....not to mention an extensive combo menu where there are a lot of combo dishes.....I have tried at least 7 or 8 different combos...all are very good.  We go to this restaurant at least 1 to 2 times per month for lunch at work and 1 time per month for dinner.  The prices are very reasonable too.

*The BEST Fideo soup. Ever.   My favorite Mexican Food place in town, hands down. Better than Viva Zapta's, Roberto's and some of the more expensive places. They give you free chips, salsa and bean dip from the get go. If you order an entree they bring the tomato/noodle (fideo) soup out pre-meal as well. The enchiladas are fluffy and cheesey and the enchilada sauce isn't so strong or greasy it gives you heartburn. The 'Mexican Pizza' appetizer is awesome, very crunchy with light fluffy chicken (or beef if you choose) on top. They'll make guacamole right at your table for like $7. It can get a little chunky if you put everything in it, but it's a big amount you can take home. I enjoy everything I order here and have heard rave reviews about the Steak Ranchero as well. Haven't had anything bad yet. I'd like to save room for once to try their fried icecream, it looks like they give a generous portion!

Everything started out so well! We were greeted straight away, seated at a cute little booth and given some water while we looked over the drinks menu. Looking around the restaurant, it's got a lot of decor that represents Hispanic culture, even down to the art on the backs of the chairs - super cute and interesting. I ordered the piña colada cocktail and my partner had some fancy beer/tomato juice thing. No idea of the name, but it looked impressive and he liked it. I LOVED mine! It was made fresh and was one of the best PC's I've had! I could taste the rum but it wasn't too strong. We were also given some chips and beans which was a nice touch and my partner ordered the ceviche appetiser while we looked over the entrées. Now, here is where it goes downhill.. firstly, the entrées spanned about 5 pages. There were too many options and too much going on. My thought was: 'how can they make each dish so delicious and impressive if there is so much going on in the kitchen?' Well, in a word (or 2), they don't. My partner went for the steak burrito. It was generous with the condiments and was filled, however the meat was a little chewy and pretty tasteless in itself, would have been nice to have been seasoned. I went for one of the fish dishes- the playa azul. NOT what I was expecting for an $18 dish when it arrived. When the server put the dish down, he had to be careful as the plate was just swimming in thick sauce. There was not much in the way of fish. When I tasted it, it did melt in the mouth, although unfortunately, all I could taste was this very thick and gloopey red sauce. The rice was dry and tasted reheated with little shrivelled peas hiding amongst it, the tortilla that came with it was also too dry (thank goodness for all the sauce to soften it I suppose). After about 6 mouthfuls, I'd had enough of all the stodginess and boxed what was left of the fish to attempt again later.  Such a letdown because the vibe was lovely, the drinks were amazing and the appetiser was great, but the entrée reminded me of what I used to get given for my school dinners. Not a restaurant dish at all! I think I'll come here again for some drinks before heading somewhere else for some dinner next time. So disappointing!
By far the best Mexican restaurant I've had in a long time I'm from Oregon and there's no good love in Oregon I need to come to Las Vegas to have some great Mexican food because they're the bomb.com

Came here with me and my 2 friends we instantly were seated. Sat down the food runner brought us chips, beans & salsa the beans were good the salsa good but a little bit to spicey for me. On yelp if you check in you get a free margarita it was delicious.  I ordered the 2 shredded beef tacos (comes with rice and beans) everything was delightful!  Also a mixed coctel the shrimp, ocotopus and oysters yum! The preparada and the coronarita perfect!  My friends scarfed down there food so overall wonderful Mexican food with good prices we never had to asl for anything.  Our waiter was on it!

My fiancé and I stopped by here while in Vegas. It was delicious food with a unique taste. I ordered the enchiladas michoacanas and they were delicious, the taste was very homey and authentic. My fiancé ordered the veggie enchiladas and he loved them. The servers were attentive, helpful, and had great energy. We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!

I actually sat down and ate here today.... my husband really wanted to try this  place.  The food was great, our waiter  was awesome. Hostess was still stank in attitude.  She rolled her eyes so much i thought she was having a seizure. I had carnitas lunch special and hubby had green chile  and pork. My margarita was soo good.  We will be back

So when I walked in I went through so many doors. The soup there was below average. The location is not the most convenient Mexican restaurant for us therefore with average food we may not go out of our way to go back. If you have kids they will beg you for the toys they have there. If the kids don't like Mexican there's more options like cheese burgers and chicken. The service was average.  Very average.  The patio may be wonderful once it warms up a bit.

Delicious chicken fajitas, fresh and tasty shrimp ceviche. Very attentive staff, from the bus boys,expo and server great guys. Bomb fideo soup, reminds me of grandma cooking that .Cannot wait to go back

We've been going to Bonito's for a few years and I'm not sure why I haven't added a review yet.. Anyways the food is great, the staff is friendly and it's a fun place to go.  Juan the waiter is a superstar and I think he has quite a following.  Always hugs both my husband and I when we arrive and leave. The guacamole made at your table is so good, and last night I tried their ceviche for the first time and that too was yummy!  Of course the margaritas aren't bad either!  Love this place!
Great food great service  The carne asada is very good. The oysters with ceviche is bomb. Definitely recommend this place

Great food this place did not upset especially since I'm visiting from California. I had enchiladas they were great the service was excellent food came soon after ordering they give you sopa and chips with beans and salsa while you are waiting I highly recommend this place

Thats is not a real mexican food we ordered chicken mole we got grilled chicken w mole on top grilled chcken con mole l am from mexico a my wife fron guatemala and she like mole but not grilled chicken horrible  and chilaquiles con huevos estrellados the eggs was raw eggs l told them to cook om they burned and the chilaquiles w no cheese and onion Would I do not eat not recommend the place is nice But the food is not real Mexican food we never come back again

Yum! Hard to find decent mexican food in Hawaii so I always look for good ones when I'm in Cali and Nevada. It seemed most of the entrees came with the delicious tomato fideo soup, beans, rice, and tortillas. They even have a glass booth where you can see the cute guy making the tortillas.   The margaritas were the best I've ever had. I had the cucumber one, my friend had the jalepeno one. They both came with a chili lime salt rim which was soo good. I'd be happy with just the comp chips which also come with salsa and refried beans.  I can't remember the name but I had the pork dish that's marinated over night in orange juice. It was pretty good. My friend had the Carne asada and the steak was so tender. My other friend had the deep fried snapper which was ok but nothing special.

This was our second time coming. I was so disappointed on the service. I was so sad I brought my parents with me. There was so much mis communication between the staff. I should have left it with our amazing first experience last year.
I prefer New Mexico mexican food but Bonito Michoacan has some very good dishes.  The carnitas are very good, as is the mole enchiladas.  The gratis chips, salsa and beans is a nice touch too.
Love that they make the guacamole right in front of you

Pretty standard mexican fare. Cheesy mexican lounge singer singing christmas music added to the ambiance or something. I had the camarones al cognac which was in a rich cream sauce and quite good. My mom had some camarones a la diabla or something like that was spicy, but it masqueraded any flavor. The rice and beans were not good. The salsa was pretty good, had a good kick to it. It was okay, but definitely not the best I've had. Their menu is massive, which yields a lot of choices for groups. Standard is all I can say. And the booths are definitely not at a normal height.

When you come to Mexican Food, I always tell people to go to this place. Great interior and exterior color such as authentic mexican feel you were in mexico. I cant say anything bad about this place little bit of louder music who playing the keyboard in the corner. May be that's a part of mexican lol. ANyway, The very first thing you try is the Fresh Guacamole  they made in front of you and give with home made chips and the mouth watering beans ad salsa. They have a biggest verity of any mexican restaurant in the town... Their Number of stake is right on the money and their other plates are also huge.  Also, The soup they gave you before the meal is make a great appetite.    Finally, they have great magaritas and great seafood if you love to be drunk and a islander....

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant that reminds me of the authentic Mexican food found in So Cal! Great prices, free chips and salsa and bean dip, I love the deep fried taco combination and the fried ice cream! Every time I go to Vegas, I have to eat here! Very fun atmosphere and lots of singing for bdays also which makes this place extra fun!

This is our second time at Bonito Michoacan and it is even better the second time!! The service is amazing and the food is off the charts!! The margaritas are yummy, but the handmade tortillas are the best!! Very authentic and so worth spending our Easter here with family!!!

I had a Groupon for Bonito Michoacan.  I was seated in the bar area and the bartender was my server.  She brought me chips, salsa, and bean dip quickly along with my iced tea.  She passed the empty sweetener bag test with flying colors!  First. my dinner came with fideo soup.  It was very good with less of a tomato taste than I'm used to getting.  There was more of a chicken stock flavor.  For the main course, I ordered the Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo, two cheese enchiladas heated in a red mole sauce with a chicken breast, refried beans, rice, and some lettuce shreds and a dollop of sour cream.  The mole tasted a bit sweet at first but then I got the undertones of the other spices and the richness of the mole came out.  The chicken breast was good.  It was seasoned in any manner so I gave it a good shower of Tapatio.  For dessert, I got the fried ice cream.  I guess fried ice cream is just something that comes out of the freezer.  I don't think anyone "breads" and fries the ice cream in real time anymore.  I was very pleased with my visit.  I was of two minds about where I was seated.  Two men were having a loud discussion (argument?) about politics in Spanish and the one had enough tecate to not know how loudly he was talking.  However, I could have been sitting in another part of the restaurant where there was a crying baby.  I think it was better where I was.    This was an enjoyable dinner!
Huge portions, great food.  Guacamole made fresh at your table, and the chips are fresh.  Pleasant atmosphere, and great for families.  The margaritas are very tasty, and the staff is very attentive.

A must any time we're in Vegas... the food is 4 stars but with all the added "treats," it makes it a good 5 stars. You are greeted with chips, salsa, and refried beans followed by a warm yummy fideo soup when you order an entree.   The staff is attentive, friendly, and welcoming. Today, we tried the Carnitas Michoacán and they were absolutely delicious. The hand made tortillas were soooo good. Completed our meals with an order of warm churros!!! Time for a nap now :)

We've been coming here for a couple years now since we found it. The environment is colorful and culturally authentic to the food. Although I haven't quite yet figured out how the dolls & clowns play into it but whatever, it's fun to look at.  The staff has always been very friendly and on point with their customer service. My glass is never empty, the buss boys are like ninja re-fillers.  I love that they do table side guacamole and you can make it as mild or spicy as you like. Chips, salsa and bean dip come to the table when you first sit down.  One of my favorite dishes here is their fajitas. Shrimp and/ or chicken. The tortillas are home made, you can't beat that! Fideo soup usually comes with an entree. I always add a little salsa for a kick.  If you're celebrating a birthday be sure to let them know. They'll come on over and sing in English & Spanish.  We always save room for some sopapillas too.

This place is great! One of my best places to go, the Steak Cilantro is my fav. All the waiters are nice and they never leave your drinks empty. They always offer us tortillas to take home and they serve you Fidelo Soup before your meal..  YUM.

This place was cute, but pretty average.  Our server kept trying to rush us to order because he had a party of 15 he was trying to help as well. We sat down and felt super rushed into ordering he kept saying if we didn't order now the part of 15s order was going to go in before ours and it was going to take way longer to get our food.  The food was nothing spectacular. Tasted like pretty much every other Mexican restaurant I've been to.  We ordered fried ice cream and bananas for dessert and to light them on fire they poured a full shot of tequila over it. All we could taste was tequila it made it pretty much inedible.   Decent food but nothing I would recommend.

Bonito Michoacan is one of the more authentic Mexican restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas. Even the funky decor is pretty damn authentic!   The complementary chips, salsa and bean dip are excellent, we always end up getting more because of how quickly they disappear. Rarely do we have to ask for more chips, salsa or anything for that matter since service is always very attentive...   I tend to stick to 'standard' dishes when I eat here... they have great tacos, excellent fideo soup, wonderful enchiladas and the strawberry margaritas are made with real fruit, yum! They make their guacamole table-side here, you can request it as mild or as spicy as you prefer.  Prices are reasonable for the large portions you get...   This isn't your on the strip, "fine dining", spending $50 a plate, fancy dancy type restaurant but it's still well worth a stop even for a special occasion like a birthday... The employees come out singing, with musical instruments and a big sombrero for the special person to wear. I think you get a complimentary dessert as well... It's embarrassing if it's your birthday, hilarious if you are with the birthday boy/girl and entertaining if you just happen to be there when it happens.

One of my bosses from the East Coast loves this restaurant and we'll hit it up every time he's in town.  All of my experiences here have been during lunch time so I really can't tell you much about dinner. I'm sure it's the same, busier, and minus their lunch specials.  You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  My favorites include their carne asada plate and steak fajitas.  Their plates are huge and they hook up more than just the rice & beans.  Sometimes I'll dine here in the middle of dieting and have always found something "clean" enough to eat.  They'll even substitute some of the rice & beans for more steak.  Besides Vegetarians and Vegans, who doesn't want more steak?  It's not surprising that a lot of Yelpers rave about the service here.  The hostess and servers are all over customer service.  They treat you good here and most importantly, they'll keep your bowl of chips full.

Walked in and was greeted by friendly faces, assigned a table, drinks brought. I waited for the waiter ... And waited ... Had to get someone to get him. Party of 5 by the way. Finally he shows up, waited for my food ... And waited .... I liked the food wife did not like her's. Finished my Food. Check was brought promptly.  Waited for him to come get the card to ring me up ... And waited ... And waited ... Wife left with two of my three kids .... I still waited ... And waited ... And waited. One of my kids fell asleep cause im still waiting  and waiting .... Still wai.. Zzzzzzz ... Zzzzzz

Okay HI! We tried a different place each night on this last little jaunt to Vegas and because I am so much of a Smartina Navratolova I wanted Mexican food and so I went to my Yelp app on my Smart phone and searched for a highly rated restaurant with reasonable prices and Bonito Michoacan came right up.  We were in the neighborhood (my brother in law is Chinese) so we hung a U and drove right into the parking lot (yeah buddy they even have parking fa YA)!   We went inside and the place is beautiful.  There is a beautiful woman who hand makes tortillas RIGHT there. I love that.   The bathrooms are beautifully decorated ...beautiful I LOVE the copper basins.  The whole place is colorful,extremely inviting and interesting.   So we walk inside from hot to cool.  We are greeted by a young woman with a beautiful smile and they have a table ready for us (party of 7).  They bring over these hot chips, with warm bean dip AND really delicious salsa.  (This is new, most places offer salsa and chips and that's it right?)   Then a very nice gentleman asks if we would like drinks YEAH! We order 3 top shelf frozen margaritas (two plain, one mango) and my Mother said it was the best margarita she's ever had...they came out quickly, very well blended and huge (meets all my criteria :-)    So far ...I AM IN HEAVEN I thought...but then we hear music and there is a male singer who sings a beautiful array of Spanish dinner songs and even one Bossa Nova (EYE EYE YEY) Now I am in heaven.  So we check the menu, very reasonable prices, I ordered the Steak Ranchero medium rare, my Mom ordered SHRIMP Ranchero and there were 5 other orders ...I was a little too busy with my margarita to tell you what they got but I can tell you they were all happy.  We did not have room for dessert this time but I am definitely going back next time I get to Vegas and I will update this report when I do okay?   The food was fresh, tasty, hot and it came out of the kitchen quickly.  I had to get a to go box and so did my mother.    They offer hot tortillas, with butter if you ask and the service was oN POINT. Friendly, polite, sweet and generous. My mother said she loved that place and believe me ...she is usually a ...well... a mother.   I have not felt as if I got MORE than my money's worth in quite a long time but (well technically since I didn't pay ...oh you get the picture)   Very very good find, thanks yelp, thanks everyone who rated this restaurant because you all helped make a great evening possible for my family.  My mother has been ill and we thought this trip would cheer her up and she loved this place so much, we all did.   Now you go and eat there and bring your family and friends ( I saw a wedding party y'all) and tell me how you liked it.  I know you are going to be so happy! Go now.

One of my favorite sit down Mexican restaurants. The staff is always friendly and polite. Went in looking for some sort of chicken tonight and decided to go with the chicken fajitas. Portion was large and the perfect blend of meat and veggies. I've had them before and always enjoy them. Only thing I didn't get to enjoy this visit was the fried ice cream... Dang diets. Next time gadget, next time.

I sure like this place.  It's the "go-to" Mexican restaurant for meeting friends in Las Vegas.  I've been four times.  It's been excellent every time.  Service is outstanding.  Quick friendly seating, attentive waitstaff, and an eagerness to get everything right.  I once had a dish that wasn't as hot as I wanted and they fell over themselves to please me -- getting it exactly right the second time.  I don't eat onions.  No problema.  I want extra sauce, or sauce on the side, or extra jalapenos.  No problema.  My latest visit, with my good friend Andrei, was typical.  I had a monstrously large Caldo de Pollo (Chicken Soup) as a dinner.  Wonderfully ample white meat chicken -- at least a breast, maybe a breast and a half.  The cilantro was fresh.  The other spices delicious.  My friends garlic chicken was similarly spectacular -- even without the red peppers he's allergic to.  All the chips, salsa, and guac that you could want.  And a price that left money for our main purpose -- playing poker.  I love variety.  And Las Vegas probably has more Mexican restaurants than any city, including Mexico D.F..  Even so, a trip to this city always includes a trip to this restaurant -- so sure am I of getting a high quality, reasonably priced, delicious meal.
Been in Las Vegas for two years now and haven't found any good Mexican/texmex. Well, hold up y'all. Found it. This place is authentic and delicious. Absolutely loved it. I will be back.

This place has the best food out of all their restaurants! Delicious drinks!  The atmosphere is so live with music, the best service, & very colorful! They all make you feel so welcomed. Juan is my absolute favorite server! He just lights up your day as soon as you see him, he's always happy & always makes you laugh! Their birthday surprises are the best! Definitely must try!!
Love the fish in a foil!  Ask for Richard, he's the bomb!  Oh and try the top shelf margarita....

My husband and I found this restaurant through Yelp's reviews as we were looking for Mexican food off of the Strip. This was, by far, the best Latino food that we have ever had. The atmosphere was great and everyone working there greeted us warmly and were very friendly throughout. There was a Mariachi band playing, but not too loud, and everything just felt comfortable. The decor was bright and festive, but it was not over the top. The thing that we noticed first was that almost everyone eating there was Latino, and that, to us, is always a good sign of authentic food. The food did not disappoint. Everything was so good overall that we came back the next day for lunch before heading back home-- just to get another taste of it. The best of what we tried: the oysters (I am not a fan but my husband ate the heck out of them happily), the cheese fundo, and the guacamole. The warm, homemade tortillas were the best tortillas I have ever had as well, and if I could somehow magically have them at my house every day, I would be eating a steady diet of them. All in all, a good value for the money, a nice experience, and wonderful food.

If it weren't for the excellent service this place would have 1 star. The food was awful, the soda was watered down, and the restrooms stunk like sewer. I have eaten here years ago and it was very good, i'm very very disappointed in Bonito Michoacan. Also, the mariachi band, AWFUL and ANNOYING!  Note: try Frank and Finas on Grand Canyon and Flamingo instead, best Mexican food in town, IMO. And guess what, no mariachi band:)

They have the best oysters, always taste fresh $9 for half a dozen or $17 for  twelve of them, you can also add shrimp salad(they have another name for it)on top of them. Their fideo soup is amazing and great for hangovers. Their lunch specials is a great portion with reasonable prices.  The shrimp cocktail had no flavor what so ever and I also ordered the bacon wrap shrimp plate here and was disappointed because the shrimp was under cooked with no seasoning. Everything else is great

This is probably my favorite Mexican restaurant.  We come here often for lunch and some Birthdays. We always sit in Violeta's section and she has it together. She knows what we want without us ordering!  Margaritas and food magically appear!  The chips and salsa are delicious as is the fresh table side guacamole!  Well worth a trip!!

We checked in on yelp for the free margaritas, I was surprised and delighted that they were 2 margaritas on the rocks and not frozen overly sweetened blended margaritas.   This was a perfect way to start our meal,  while we were looking over the menu we were served chips, salsa and beans.   We were starving so that went pretty fast.   We then ordered our entrees,  I ordered the camerones al conac and he ordered camorones dionisio.  We were still hungry after the chips and salsa so we ordered chips and guacamole which they prepare tableside.   (You can definitely tell these servers do the tableside guacamole several times a day) it's nice that they ask if you want all the ingrediants and how spicy you would like your guac.  The guacamole was nice and refreshing with our margaritas.   Then our soup came.   The fideo soup was a small cup of tomatoey brothey noodle goodness,  I finished every last bite.  When our entrees came out, we both finished everything off our plates,  shrimp,  tortillas,  rice,  beans and a dallop of guacamole,  everything was good!   I enjoyed everything from the service to the margaritas to the appetizers to the entrees,  by this time we were pretty full so passed in the desserts,  I definitely recommend this place for the service,  atmosphere and food.
I love this place! My favorite dish is Camarones Dionisia! By the way ask for Juan the waiter he's the best!!!

We met a local friend here at his invitation, and it did not disappoint.    Curb appeal is inviting and parking ample.  We were seated immediately and our very gregarious, personable waiter took excellent care of us from beginning to end.    The margaritas had plenty of authority; the warm chips and salsa delicious.  Apparently, every entree includes a small cup of chicken-broth-style soup, which had a nice flavor.  We didn't see our favorite thing on the menu--a fajita combo of steak, chicken, and shrimp--but we asked and they gladly made it for us.  It was perfect, with just the right amount of char, served on a sizzling platter.  The rice was flavored superbly and the guacamole fresh and creamy.    My only complaint is the lighting:  It glares just a bit, and could be solved easily and inexpensively with dimmer switches.

Tasty margaritas that come in giant sizes.  Not only do you get the standard chips and salsa but a really yummy bean dip too.  Friendly, if a bit over the top service.  A gargantuan menu.  I think this place is a solid hit with tons of Mexican standards.  Even though my carnitas weren't the best I've ever had, some of the other dishes were delish.  I'd eat here again.  Three plus plus stars.

I have been to a few of the Michoacan restaurants before. I feel it is safe to say Bonita Michoacan is my favorite.   I came here with my family last weekend while they were visiting from out of town. They were told of Bonita Michoacan by a waiter they met at an IHOP who also works here also.  We were seated quickly upon arrival even though it was a Friday evening and we were a party of five in this busy restaurant. We did not have to wait long before chips and salsa were brought out. Then we were also brought the sopa de fideo as is customary at the Michoacan restaurants. As were were looking over the menu and munching on chips, we saw another table which had ordered the fresh guacamole. We thought it looked good and ordered it too. I'm glad we did. It was chunky, creamy, fresh and just the right level of spicy. That was a nice way to start our meal.  For my entree I ordered pollo al cognac. One bite and it quickly became my favorite chicken dish any where. The plate was huge as was the chicken breast though I could not really see the latter. It was a large breast grilled to perfection while maintaining tenderness then smothered in a sour cream sauce with mushrooms, onions and a touch of cognac. I am a sucker for sour cream and mushrooms so this was just awesome. I would go back and order that again for sure.  There are only a few small things I take issue with at Bonita Michoacan. They are the margaritas, the salsa, and the sopa. At least on this occasion. I ordered a house margarita and that is exactly what I got. My issue with it is that it taste like a premixed syrup like the ready made stuff in the grocery stores. It is very sweet and I don't care for that. The salsa was Ok. It had good spice but then there was a bitter after taste. Possibly from dried chilies being used. And finally the sopa was kind of salty. I realize it is soup and soup is salty. This was just a bit much for a couple of us in my party. Aside from those things that I'm just nagging about, this was a primo spot for dinner and we were all glad we tried it out.

Its really Mexican food in a great ambiance. The service is A1. I had the freshest soup since I live in Vegas. The ingredients were naturals. As many places they alway serve chips with salsa. I would go again.

Typical Mexican fare and atmosphere. The margaritas were refreshing. Service was good and attentive. The table side guacamole is always fun and tasty. I liked the chili Verde.  Overall, it was all good; just nothing different that most other "good" Mexican restaurants. If you're looking for a solidly good meal, this will meet your needs. If you're expecting anything more than typical Mexican fare, I'm not sure you'll be happy.

Bomb!!! However this rude waiter brought the check to my party and said outlays that both mine and my boyfriend was declined. That was upsetting and embarrassing. I'm from LA so our bank put out account on hold. He should've not done that infront of my family. He should've pulled us a side or in low voice. But he rather screamed out on purpose. We didn't like him btw.   Other than that it was amazing! My bday surprise my bf got me was fantastic! Maybe mariachi every night would be nice.

Went to Bonito's today for lunch and I'm sure I'll be back!  Great fish tacos!!  The "special sauce" that goes on top was all that, it was delicious.  Chips and salsa were awesome, but the beans weren't right.  I'm not sure what it was about them, but they weren't as good as at other places.  Others in my party had the chicken burrito and the chicken sopas -- both of which were reportedly great!   Service is super speedy -- they are quick and that includes taking your plate as you shove the last bite in your mouth and bringing you the check while people in your party are still finishing up too!  That's better than waiting for the check in my opinion though!
Cozy atmosphere and great food. Get out of the casino and go eat authentic Mexican food. We took uber from Caesar Palace and with food was cheaper then one dinner at casino. Highly recommend!!

This place has the best customer service, truly. I came in needed to place an order for pick up later in the afternoon and they were so helpful. I was not sure what to order and the staff was great at recommending what I should order.  Then when I came back to order like three people asked me if I needed help. Just very nice and the prices are good and this place is clean.
The fresh guacamole made at the table was delicious.  I had chicken enchiladas which were huge portion & taste wonderful
Busy cozy colorful place with great Mexican food at a reasonable price. Lots of  blue collar workers have lunch here. They know good food.
Good place to eat good decor and good food and drink. Chili verde was good Cadillac margarita was good.. Nice service guac made fresh bean dip was good I'll definitely go again when I'm in the area

Food sucks, cheddar cheese is NOT used in authentic Mexican cooking. Also, place of business discriminates. My son & I waited to be seated while 2 white customers were seated before me. I waited 20 minutes until someone finally asked for our drinks. I finally asked to speak to the manager & he stated that the host did not let the waitress know that someone was seated in her area. I try to give my people (Mexicans) all my money but, this is one place I will NEVER visit again... & yes I will spread the word.

This is a place that my friends from California really like to go to.  The service is quite excellent where when you get chips you get salsa as well as bean dip.  When ordering food I suggest you get the Flour tortillas to be used because they taste so much better than the corn ones where the nachos are very delicious where they don't skip out on anything in it.  I ordered the Flautas (which are nicer taquitos) and it was really really good.

This place have really good & authentic mexican food!! I try a lot of food there and all good!! The ambience make you feel you are not in America but Feel like you are in mexico.. And they have good horchata drink as well.. All the employees are so welcome and nice. Love it!! Love it!!

Seriously some of the most authentic Mexican food I've had here in the states besides my abuelitas cooking.  The service is outstanding! They are super friendly, fast and helpful.  We come from Utah twice a year to come to this amazing restaurant.

The atmosphere here is like a family restaurant, but larger and with lots of people. Very colorful rooms. Mexican art and sculptures on the walls. The menu has lots of authentic Mexican choices. Almost makes you feel like you're in Mexico.  Before the meal, chips, salsa, and refried beans were provided. I expected the salsa to be a little spicier but was rather mild. The refried bean dip was a nice touch.  A small bowl of Sopa de Fideo was provided. Small thin noodles are served in a broth. Good.  For an appetizer I had a small Campechana, a seafood cocktail with shrimp, octopus, and oysters. The small size was plenty large enough and the seafood was all excellent. There is a Timo's Size that is larger than the 'large' size, which would be interesting to see, if not so much to eat because of the size. There was a small amount of cilantro and spice but it was very mild. A bottle of Tapatio hot sauce was provided so one can spice it up to a hotter level if one wants. A bottle of ketchup was also provided, which is something I didn't expect, or use.  There are a lot of entrees to choose from and I selected one of the dozen-and-a-half seafood items, the Pescado A La Vallarta. A fillet of Orange Roughy is pan-fried. An orange roughy fish is orange colored but the fillet is more white colored. The taste of the fish was very mild, which is normal. There were olives, green peppers, and red peppers plenty. On the side of the plate was Spanish rice, average, Refried Beans with cheese, very good, and some guacamole, also very good.  A nice filling meal with a touch of different options not found in corporate-style Mexican restaurants.

Loved the camarones a la diabla..not too spicy but just right. Even the micheladas were so great I had to order two. It was a bit crowded but luckily we got there just in time. I'm not from that area but I can tell that place is very popular by how people kept coming and going. I went with a group of people and they did not have not one complaint. Our waiter was efficient and quite the charmer. I definitely will be back when in Vegas.

Coming from a native San Diegan who has been exposed to GOOD Mexican food her entire life THIS PLACE IS LEGIT! Their menu had a good variety of dishes and the service was absolutely great! Boyfriend had the steak in cilantro & lime and I had the tamal plate. Everything was fresh and delicious! Will definitely be back!

This place is a very good Mexican Restaurant. The people here are very friendly and welcoming. I usually do work birthday parties here at this location. I always reserve a spot for 15-20 people at lunchtime and they never say no!! When its your bday they bring out a big Mexican hat and make you wear and sing Happy bday to you in Spanish. Then they bring out a nice complimentary desert. I recommend this place to anyone that craves Mexican Food!!
I have eaten Mexican food all over the country and this is some of the best I have had. Great service, great food. I highly recommend coming here. Just a short 6 dollar uber ride from the strip.

Found out about this place via Yelp while out in Vegas with my whole family. So happy I did! From the moment we walked in to the time we left, everything was great!!! To start off, the waitress was super attentive and friendly.  We all got the menudo... Yummy! My sister had some type of mango margarita with chamoy that was refreshing and delicious. My dad had a michelada and swore it was one of the best.  It's a bit of a drive from the strip but it's worth it!  We will definitely be going back when on Vegas!

By far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants that I've found here in Vegas. Traditional Mexican food. First time here and thus far I'm loving it. Great atmosphere, great service and beast of all great quality food! I'll definitely be frequenting this place more often. Thanks Saul for your service! My only complain... homemade tortillas yes..... but though to eat.

The food was OK, not impressive. My tacos dorados has cheddar cheese in them, not authentic. If you are ok with Americanized Mexican food, go for it! But again, it was just OK. The drinks were really good.  The reason I gave a 2 star is due to the service. We went on a rainy day, no wait at all. Our waitress VIOLET/VIOLETA pissed me off. She kept forgetting stuff and was overly cocky when she was providing shitty service. It started to leak on our table and ON US! She grabbed a pitcher and put it on the table to catch the leak, THATS FUCKING GROSS! We pointed out the leaks and she ducked out of the way worried about her helmet hair. Offer to move your guest! But no.. she kinda just forgot about us. I was with a large party celebrating a birthday so I didn't want to put her on the spot, although there was plenty of open tables and pretty slow she still managed to give us crappy service. One of our guests asked her if she was going to discount or comp anything since she had us sit under a leak she said, "oh yeah sure, I gave you guys double discount" (sarcastically) and walked away. No discount, no comp $2 soda, NOTHING!  I wasn't going to review this place but the service she gave really nice customers was messed up.

This restaurant is anything anyone could ask for, great customer service, the food is amazing, very welcoming and clean facility. As you enter you already feel welcomed, to start you off they provide Fideo soup, chips, salsa and of course anything you'd like to drink. The menu has a wide variety from seafood to tacos and burritos. The plates are just right definitely allows space for dessert! Tue salmon has great taste, the rice and beans have a lot of flavor and the shrimp is a must if you're a seafood person. I ordered "Camarones Abuelito Timo" which is shrimp wrapped in bacon, with melted cheese on top not to mention the shrimp were on top of the rice which gave it great flavor. I will definitely be coming back to try out more of their menu, it's a must if you're ever in Nevada. I'm sure I'm not the only one when visiting other state it's harder to pick and find food that's appealing this restaurant met everything I was looking forward to. 10/10 recommend!!
Amazing Mexican food and service !! Authentic Mexican food and very friendly environment ! Will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again
Very nice place for lunch!!!  Fast service,great food and awesome employees.(teamwork) everybody want you to feel comfortable and in family. thanxs so much Lalo and all the team for a great time.

Came here with my friend because I was craving Mexican. We ordered our own strawberry margaritas and he brought us out the biggest cups for margaritas. He said it was happy hour. Drinks were big ! I liked it! Our drink was around $9-10 for the big cup. My friend and I shared a special dish for $38. It included shrimp, chicken, and steak. I would have to say the price is pretty steep here for Mexican compared to other places I've been. Our food was good but it didn't come with rice or veggies/beans but it did come with cheese. Everyone loves cheese. I would say the dish was good but for $38, I would have probably ordered something else. The restaurant is too dark inside. I would recommend them making it a little bit more lighter inside to see the food and menu.

I've come here several times over the last 12 years. This time was one of the worst! The food was lacking flavor. Normally you get a huge plate full, not this time. Very little of anything. My daughter ordered the kids shrimp. The price was $8 and it literally had 3 shrimp and about 10 fries on the plate. I doubt we'll be back any time soon, if at all. It'll probably be another couple of years.

Came here for Mother's day 2014. Sign said open at 9am, but the doors were still locked.  As we were walking a lady said the door will open shortly.  9:15 the door finally open, guess who opened the door...yup the lady that was walking from her car.  Can you say getting to work late?!  Anyways we order chilaquiles, one with red sauce and the other with green sauce with eggs.   It was okay.  Two kids plate,  one had a long hair in the rice. Yuk as my daughter commented.  They comp one of the kids meal and gave her a plate of new rice.  Julio did an excellent job, but the women Griselda (i think that is how you spell her name) was rude. She didn't acknowledge when we ask for things and her body language came across very negative.  What a disappointment since it was our first and probably will be our last time here.   Thanks for an unforgettable start to mother's day.  Glad we still have the entire day to make more memories.

Excellent service, excellent service, excellent food.  The prices are a little high, but they don't nickel and dime you for more chips and salsa.  They also have fresh refried beans with those homemade chips..  Staff was very attentive and in point, this is the kind of place that will bag your to-go portions for you.. awesome. Overall this place was very nice and I highly recommend stopping by.
Love the atmosphere! The waters are so upbeat and fun and the food is really good! They also have a great view of all the pretty lights from the strip. Careful though they really like to up sell.
Happy hour is good. Margaritas r ok. Food is and always had been outstanding. Need a bit more attention to service at the bar.

One of our favorite Mexican places in town. The handmade guac at the table is delicious, entree portion size leaves you full and the Margarita's are tasty. Good service and very good family crowd. Lots of creepy clown type figurines prevents the 5 star review...

authentic mexican. live music, bar, attire & decor make fresh salsa & guacamole tableside. my tea never got 1/2 empty. more chips & salsa without ever asking truly the best authentic mexican yet!! very spicy & meats were tender and juicy. crispy tacos too a truly authentic mexican joint with great lunch specials. $5.99/$7.99/$9.99 for 1/2/3 item combos

Had dinner there Saturday early evening. At 4:30pm this place was already very busy, i see that as a good sign. We were seated right away and the staff immediately got to us with chips, salsa, bean dip, and our drinks. Everything we ordered was awesome, not a bad dish at our table at all. Everything was delicious, hot, fresh, and served quickly. Awesome food plus awesome service!! Will definitely be back to this place... our new go to spot for Mexican food!
Excellent chips and salsa Verde! Great device and they have a vegetarian fajitas which were very yummy!

Omg this place is the best!!! Home made tortillas either harina or maiz. My Family and I had an amazing experience. It was 8 of us in total. Customer experience was beyond great.  I just loved how the girls and boys servers were dressed. The restaurant is beautiful from inside out, definitely a Mexican touch. When I'm in town again I will definitely make this place the "to go" place forget tacos el Gordo  here in Vegas lol  the mangoniada was super delicious.  Mine and his plate and they serve you sopita
Great food. Great service. Tortillas were perfect. And the margaritas are huge! They did not skimp on the liquor. Love this place.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet! We have been going here for years and have never had bad service, food or drinks! That says a lot. Even when they are super busy, the staff is always amazing!  Drinks: We LOVE the Cadillac margaritas! Be forewarned that if you order the large, it's huge! All of their other alcohol-based drinks are top notch, too. Their horchata is delish as well. Food: Love their bean dip and salsa that's complementary. The table side guacamole is awesome! We've had a huge array of their food. We love the carnitas. Everything from seafood to chicken to steak is yum yum. Pricing: Totally reasonable! Whether it's a date night, celebration, or just dinner with friends, it's totally affordable.

First time in Vegas struggling to find a place to eat. Saw that Bonito Michoacan had 4 stars so decided to give it a try and I was thoroughly impressed! The service was fast and most of all DELICIOUS!!!!!!! the service was great & I enjoyed sitting next to two parties that had the staff sing Happy Birthday Fiesta Style! I'm happy and full!

Food was great and so was the service. They make you feel like you are at home. The only bad thing is that you leave in a food coma since all the food is beyond amazing !!! My props to waiter Violeta and Mario for the great service.
The food here is amazing. Plenty of parking and great ambiance. Traditional plates. Love this place.
Nothing to special about the place , the portion size of the food was good but for my personal taste it needed a lil bit more flavor, the service was good even though it was packed.

Our favourite Mexican restaurant whenever we visit Vegas. The taste and quality of food is great. Many choices in the menu. Ambience and service are top notch. Having been to lots of Mexican restaurants in California, this place definitely is the best I've been out of many, because they seem to get everything just right.

Came here hoping for some authentic Mexican food, but was disappointed. The two stars are for the very good service , unfortunately it didn't make up for the food. It was not at all good in fact it was bland and the salsa was tasted really odd like it was old or something . The bean dip was cold, and the prices are way too high. Save your hard earned money and keep looking .
Food was ok, was bearly warm when I got my plate, kind of pricey. Nice live music, clean place. Friendly service.

Love this place! Love the beans/salsa/chips they start you off with :) love their chilaquiles and their enchiladas Michoacán. Yum! Such a nice atmosphere, love their soft Spanish rock music playing in the background.

This is very good quality food and excellent service! I have been here several times before, this particular visit I was a little disappointed with the bean dip. I look so forward to the chips, salsa, and bean dip that is served when you are seated. Usually it is AMAZING and I dive in like a maniac! Today the beans were hard and dry, just not good at all. Chips and salsa were still good though..... just a bad day for the beans I guess.  Today, my husband and I shared the Parrillada de Marisco. A huge platter of shrimp, crab, fish, and rice. A very good value for $45.  There was shrimp prepared different ways, butterflied and fried (which was very tasty) bacon wrapped (wasn't my absolute favorite) shrimp in enchilada sauce (very good, especially when eaten with the fabulous rice in the center of the platter) There was not a lot of crab. One bunch of snow crab legs... they were nice and sweet though.  A large Tilapia filet in a butter sauce, which was very good.  Wonderful creamy rice piled right in the center of the tray. Then on the side they serve an amazing queso and warm fresh homemade tortillas!  We accompanied our Parrillada de Marisco feast with a couple of shots of tequila, 1942 and it was FABULOUS!!! Pricey tequila shots, but good!!!

I've been in vegas for almost 8 yrs and me and my family just haven't found good Mexican food like in Los Angeles until yesterday . For my birthday we came here and the food was really good , authentic , the place was clean , the service was great !! We will be back!!

Amazing Food and Experience! Took 4 others with me to celebrate my birthday. We made reservations earlier in the day for 6:30pm. We walked in and were sat immediately. They had a Yelp checkin that offered us a free margarita so we all checked in and got some. Our Servers were Awesome and they care very much about making our experience with them Wonderful. They sang to me with a band of fellow servers and gave me dessert and tequila slammer to top it off.  Needless to say we Highly recommend Bonita Michoacan!  Must try the carnitas and Enchiladas with green sauce.

Randomly driving off the strip and happen to spot this place. The bean dip tasted just like typical frijoles so i wasn't that impressed, but it was good. I had 3 tacos de chorizo and they were super delicious! The chorizo was piled high on these which was a nice surprise. My plate came with more beans and some rice both good. The sopa de fideo wasn't bad either but I love my mom's better :) the service was awesome. Our waiter was super courteous and came frequently to refill our drinks. The place is very nicely decorated with authentic Mexican decor and the Spanish music (Vicente Fernandez) playing in the background just added more charm and authenticity to this good Mexican restaurant. I'd definitely eat here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Absolutely one of the 2 worst Mexican restaurants I've been to ever.  I thought maybe b/c it's in Vegas and not southern CA? It starts out with soup that tasted like freeze-dried Lipton noodle soup. None of the 3 of us ate it. We took our waiter's recommendations, and although he was efficient, he was not right.  We ordered from the Specialities, and 1/3 was good: the camarones a la cognac. Booths were too short for the table. The live music-1 guy- was okay for free, but sang American songs, which did not contribute to the Mexican atmosphere. Subsequently, 2 of us went to El Nopal restaurant in Vegas, which was excellent, and proves Vegas does have good Mexican restaurants!

Parking here is super easy! If you go left when you walk in you'll see a full bar and they do karaoke! If you want it a LITTLE more quiet sit on the right side. My hubby and my daughter went with another couple who also had a 3yo and they had an easily accessible table for the 6 of us. Us ladies ordered frozen guava margaritas which were veeeeery tasty and the consistency was very smooth. I'm usually a rocks kinda girl and I'm truly not a guava fan but I tried hers and needed one too!!! While we were deciding our server brought out sopa de fideo for the kids which was nice because we didn't even ask! Now to the food! With the location of this place the prices surprised the hell out of me.....I'm not saying it was über expensive but the average was probably $15 which is a little out there for a Mexican restaurant IMO. Every meal comes with chips, salsa, and beans and the sopa. I had birria de chiva which is goat cooked in a red sauce or was pretty delish! Hubby had a shrimp/octopus coctel it was the usual nothin special. The other couple had an enchilada and then shrimp fajitas. All pretty ordinary. I did see they make guacamole table side and got to watch another table have it made it looked pretty cool!  We were too full for dessert...  Service was good Drinks were awesome  The food...nothin special. Will I return, yes! I think I'm gonna try somethin different/unique so they can change my mind a lil :)

By far one of the BEST Mexican restaurants I've been to from LA to Las Vegas.  They give you chips salsa, and a warm bean dip to start!  I ordered the Ceviche tostada to start and my main  course was the hueto plate that included a chicken taco, tostada, and enchilada. The food was so flavorful and well seasoned that I didn't need any salsa!!!   The salsa is actually my only issue. It lacked flavor, and was a little too spicy for me and they only have spicier salsa, so I was a bit disappointed that my request for Pico de Gallo was turned down, but if spicy is your thing then this place will hit the spot!  Overall it was a wonderful experience and somewhere I will ABSOLUTELY visit anytime I'm in Las Vegas!

We went at 4:30, which unfortunately is before the live music! (I don't know if it was every night, but as we were finishing, a mariachi band started playing).  One weird thing, either the seats at the booths were low, or the tables were high (or both...) but when I sat down the table was noticeably higher than a normal table...but I'm short.  This was some delicious food.  We got the tableside guacamole (made fresh, to order, pretty good, but no tomatoes) and it was quite an amount, more than most other sides of guacamole I've gotten.  We (me and three guys with appetites) didn't even finish it.  Of course, that may have had something to do with the HUGE portions that came our way.  One of the guys got fajitas (I think shrimp) and all his fixin's took up a full third of the table.  I got nachos with carne asada...mmmmmm.  A huge plate, piled high.  I think I only got through a third of it before collapsing.  After lunch (lunch at 4:30...this is what happens when you wake up at noon...) we went down to Fremont Street for a couple hours, and even nachos after fours hours sitting in a car were soooo goood....

The food is good, not excellent, but good. Customer service is what can take a restaurant to another level but they lack that here.   Not friendly, no eye contact, they don't smile and seemed annoyed being asked for normal requests. We politely asked for more chips and for our drinks to be filled. They brought more chips but didn't bring more salsa or beans for the chips?    They forgot about our fideo soup and asked us if we ever got it and we told them we never did. They ended up bringing the fideo soup out with our meal.  It became uncomfortable asking for service from waiters or waitresses that simply don't want to be there or help you.  Like I said, the food is good but don't expect great customer service here.

Nice people helpful. But the food I ordered was very very bad!!! I ordered some asada tacos, I didn't even eat them. they were full of oil and it didn't taste nor it looked like carne asada. Very disappointing. I have to say their free margarita was very good and their chips with salsa and bean deep was good. But I wouldn't go there just for margaritas and chips with salsa and beans

My hubby, son and I went here to Celebrate Cinco de Mayo and give the restaurant a try since we always drive by.  The food was delicious with really good portions. They serve chips, refried beans and salsa right when you are seated. We devoured them!   My hubby and I ordered us a round of Cadillac Margaritas which were worth the $12 we paid for each.
