I took my time looking throught the entire menu, trying to figure our what i wanted to eat since everything sounded so good. I decided to go with the Mar y Tierra (Surf and Turf) since I was able to order from any of their shrip dishes and NY steak dishes! Best decision ever.   The atmosphere was good and the service was decent. The only reason we would come back would be for the food and drinks!

Received free margarita for checking in, so decided to go here for Cinco De Mayo. The margarita was served on the rocks in a very small glass. We could not taste any liquor in the drink,  and noticed other folks paying for their drinks had full size glasses. We've been traveling the southwest (new mexico, arizona, california and west tx) for a month eating at a different Mexican restaurant every day and this place is nothing out of the ordinary. The flour tortillas tasted store bought and the green chili verde was gross, pork rubbery not falling apart like we are used to. The chips, salsa and bean dip are served complimentary, but did not wow us. Our server Lorenzo was arrogant and acted as if we inconvenienced him. Worst food we have had in a month. We will not be back. Go to Yuma or Tucson for some really great authentic Mexican cuisine.
Best Mexican food ever!! Everything is so packed with flavor and deliciousness, even to the extent that something as simple as Chile Relleno is superb.

Love the Margachela (margarita) and their service! Look for Julio (attendant) and Jose (food server) you will love your time there and the cozy atmosphere and the very cultural ambience and wood carved, painted chairs and tables. Lovely tine and friendly people!

Came here for some awesome menudo. First time ever! The service was amazing. Hand made tortillas. The Agua de Limon bombness in its self. Great for hangover food. Customer service on point. Went around 12pm and it starts getting packed. Come early for the afternoon type a feeling. Atmosphere was like you were in that setting of amazing culture!!

Can you say,"The best Mexican food in Vegas!"  This is a must if you love real Mexican food. The staff was great, from the hostess to the cooks. They take the time to explain everything if you have questions. The margaritas were delicious too.
Chile relleno was excellent.. Free margarita with check in.. You know a Mexican restaurant is excellent when over half the customers are Latino...

Pattern of sadness: BIG Mexican restaurant = BAD tacos. "No rice en beans por jur tacos??"   My eyebrows grimaced at the waiter with a silent OH HELL NO. Whoops, I've become such a taco-snob. "No thanks", I replied more politely. "But can I please get onions, cilantro, and salsa for them?"   At that he half-grimaced back at me with a silent HUH? "Chure, ob course." ...aaand then they forgot the toppings when my tacos came out...   2   S T A R S  * FOUND THE TACO GEM! Never fails -- every place has an unexpected taco-gem. The joy of a Taco Flight is that sweet moment of discovering the stand-out. "JUREKA!" :::: Raja Con Crema Taco -- MEXCELLENT! Slices of poblano peppers and steak bathed in a creamy mushroom sauce, and served in a fresh tortilla. Every bite was moist and delicious!!  :::: Fried Fish Taco -- DECENT. Crispy and fresh. Toppings could have been better, but nonetheless it elicited happiness. :::: Fresh Tortillas -- WOOT! :::: Consomme -- DECENT. Starter soup with tiny noodles.  * BIG, FESTIVE JOINT Bonito Michoacan is the prototypical, fun-for-the-whole-family, Mexican-American restaurant. It's got the hostess in bright, ethnic dress, southwestern colors and faux-adobe walls, mariachis selling songs, a photographer selling photos of the dining parties. No cheesy sombreros, so a little dignity is preserved.  3   M I N U S E S  - TERRIBLE MEATS :::: Carnitas Taco -- MEH! Soo dry! They forgot the toppings. SKIP! :::: Asada Taco -- BLEH! Flavorless beef. Basically inedible. SKIP!! :::: Steak Picado -- TRASH! My buddy's steak was just disgusting. Dry, worst cut of the cow, tasted like meat-cardboard. :::: Rice -- AVERAGE.  - EXPENSIVE!! Dude! $28 for 2 average margaritas?? $18 for a plate of STEAK TRAGEDY??  - DISCRIMINATION? My dining buddy watched the restaurant photographer go from table to table, taking nice pics of the customers and offering to sell them prints. Our table, which featured the only Black man in the restaurant (not me), was ignored. Hmm... The photographer came back a few minutes later and skipped us again. Coulda been nothing, but the double cold-shoulder left a taste in our mouths almost as bad as the Steak Picado.

As one of the first to arrive on this Saturday morning, we were promptly seated and provided menus.  The complimentary chips were commercial grade and both salsas probably originated in a factory.  We ordered the breakfast of champions, huevos rancheros, but both dishes were slightly overcooked and unremarkable as were the accompanying frijoles refritos, salad and rice.  My disappointment was only nominally tempered by the use of a 2/1 coupon found on the RJ's website:
The restaurant is a classic family owned mexican cantina vibe with quality food and a fun atmosphere. The menu is large and the drinks are strong. Definite a solid place to check out.

Good authentic Mexican food. Huge servings and good flavor. My only issue was the service. Our server was not very friendly and honestly seemed impatient with us when we placed our order. The hostess was nice when we walked in but just the server was not nice.   I enjoyed my Posole and enchilada. Oh and the free chips and salsa were very good too. They also give you free bean dip.   We did get a free picture with our meal. The girl was trying to sell us photos but when we opted out she gave us our free picture and also seemed annoyed. Oh well.   For the food in itself I would probably go back but wish the service was better.
Superb service. Sat in a bar booth.  Served immediately despite a heavy Valentine's Day crowd.  Food was awesome (carnitas michoacan). Highly recommended.  Would love to eat here again.

I totally forgot to take a pic of my food! UGHH   I love Lindo Michoacán and this is their sister restaurant. The atmosphere here is so fun they have live music is a very authentic Mexican restaurant.   The service was a bit slow that day, but I guess it was because of the fact that they had a large party there.  I got a complimentary margarita when I checked in on Yelp! I LOVE LOVE the guacamole at this place its hand made and they prepare it in front of you! Love it! You also get a complimentary soup with every entree ordered a vegetarian enchilada it was amazing!  Price is affordable.

This place is the best Mexican food I've found since moving to Vegas! It's Mexican food that is up to par with my favorite Mexican food from LA.  I'm so happy to hAve found this gem and can't wait to go back.  I had their strawberry margarita, but the bartender told me to try the prickly pear (I think that's what she said) next time and of course I will! The chips, salsa and bean dip was my for sure favorite. Although a little more chorizo in that bean dip would make it even better! See you soon!

This is the best Mexican food I've ever tasted in Las Vegas . Their ceviche was delicious and their table made guacamole was even better . I recommend this place to any and everyone . And their customer service was awesome .
Such amazing food! I'm a sucker for Mexican food and this didn't disappoint! The service was phenomenal and very attentive!

Found this restaurant via Yelp. The complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip was great. The peach margarita was good, but needed more tequila for the $14.00 price. The food was average. Although I purchased the group photo for memorabilia, the Photograher was horrible. Would not return.
The service was really great, the atmosphere was incredibly authentic. The food was delicious. I would definitely come here time and time again. It also was really good for a larger group.

This place has good authentic Mexican food but is definitely a little pricey. I understand that it's a family owned restaurant, but in my opinion is a little old and outdated to be paying that much. When I go out I don't want to only pay for the food but the atmosphere; and that's all this place is really lacking. Other than that, I was happy with my experience.

First time here. Recommended by my compadre. I am impressed. The service was fabulous. Julio was great! He was friendly and he even gave my kid a complimentary sopa de fideo. Maybe because I told him I was going to split my meal with him and he felt bad. Hehe. 3 of us ordered the beef machaca. Our plates were left clean. Two others ordered huevos rancheros. Plates were left clean. It's located about 3 miles from the Orleans.

People, if you are in Vegas for a few days, hire a car and get off the strip.  The restaurants are 100 times better off the strip.  I have to confess:  I have never been a fan of Mexican food until I discovered this place and Lindo Michoacan - also in Vegas city.  Admittedly, the only Mexican food I've had has been in Toronto and ... well, need I say more.  Everything at this place is good.  They even prepared (complimentary) table side guac. for us.  OMG the freshness of the ingredients is unsurpassed.  They have traditional Mexican food like pozole (one of my favourites) and chicken with wine and prunes.  I salivate just thinking about the place.  Spouse loves the chicken verde as well.  The freshness of the ingredients ... tomatillos that were not out of a can ... indescribable.  The refried beans is like silk going down.  One of my all time favourite restaurants ever.  The owners are truly nice guys who really make one feel at home.  Go there.  Tell them I sent you.

This restaurant has a very welcoming and casual atmosphere and the hostesses and waiters are very friendly. For starters, complimentary fresh fried tortilla chips are served with warm bean dip and red salsa or you can request for the spicier habanero salsa which I love. They also give you a complimentary small bowl of fideo soup to wet your appetite. For appetizers, we ordered the beef sopitos which were very juicy and delicious topped with guacamole and sour cream. If you checkin with your Yelp account, they give you a free margarita! I always end up getting full just from the the complimentary appetizers, so save room for the delicious entrees.   For dinner we ordered the Carnitas Michoacanas and the Chicken Mole Poblano. The carnitas were cooked in spices and were very succulent and tasty. They are served with a green salsa and a spicy charred jalapeño, yum! The chicken mole poblano was juicy and served smothered in a flavorful, mildly spicy and sweet brown mole sauce, so good! Both entrees are served with Mexican rice and warm beans topped with cheese.  Also all of the entrees come with freshly made corn or flour tortillas that are warm and delicious. We always leave here stuffed, satisfied and with leftovers because the portions are huge!
One of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley. Our go to for the travel club luncheons and definitely for a date night out with my hubby!
Amazing service and great food!!! Personally loved the Guava blended margarita with the shrimp enchiladas.

Visiting Vegas and a local recommended this near-Strip eatery.  Ambiance: 5 stars - adorable location, well decorated Mexican charm, very cutesy location.  Bright colors, facade of a Mexican balcony overlooking main area.  Great family location.    Service: 5 stars - super friendly staff.    Food: 3 stars.  Food was just Ok.  Guac (made at table) was pretty basic, not worth the table-side service preparation.  We ordered a few apps (cactus plant thing, mango salad) and both were just OK.  Ordered their signature enchilada but wasn't super special or flavorful.  My brother ordered shrimp fajitas and enjoyed a flavorful sauce.   Wanted to love the food because service was so attentive, friendly and sweet, but just couldn't give more than 3 stars.

Came here to celebrate my Dads birthday and we absolutely loved it! The food was great and the service was exceptional! Thank you Bonito Michoacan for making our celebration a little more special there's nothing better than going to a restaurant and getting great service and great food! We will def be back!
Service was excellent, good margaritas and standard Mexican options.  Salsa was a little off, but overall, not too bad.

Made reservations for my daughter here for her 21st Bday while we were here in Vegas...she wanted Mexican food and based on all the reviews this place looked like a great pick. Drove in and the barely found a parking spot so for me was a good sign for also a good pick as well...dropped the ladies off at the front door and parked the car.   After checking in with my wife things didn't look so positive...they didn't have our table ready which was very frustrating! I gave them hours notice which in my opinion is totally their fault. I will say the staff was  very friendly and very apologetic about the situation. The managers even came out and bought our whole group a round of drinks and brought the kids lemeonades. Finally after a 25 minute wait we did get seated, but again the manager came over and gave us free table side guacamole and again apologized.  At this point no one remembers the wait my daughters could care less and everyone was having a good time. Our waiter Richard made my daughter feel really special and did an awesome job with her birthday. The food here was really good and everyone really enjoyed the atmosphere...would love to come back and enjoy this place again on a trip to Vegas.

I enjoyed this restaurant a lot.  Everything from the atmosphere, the friendliness of the staff, to the food and drinks.  The maragritas were delicious and so were the tacos and enchiladas. I highly recommend eating here.

Every time I go to Las Vegas this place is on my must do places.  Everything is always delicious, excellent service and menu items! All meals come with a delicious cup of Fido soup chips salsa and refried beans!

Great Mexican food! I ordered the Tacos de pollo which also comes with sopa de fideo. I am not a big fan of soups but this soup was very light and flavorful. The service also excellent and I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant.

Second time here and never will I return. Service is good drinks r good. But there food is just not my type.  Got chicken Chipotle last time n was just tomatoe sauce. Got drunk shrimp today and had no flavor. Sent it back to add some spices still the same. Only ate 1 shrimp that's how bad it was. Sorry but I'm from southern California and this is more for different type of people

We are in Las Vegas for a convention and wanted out of the hotel for dinner, the bell desk recommended this restruant. Six of us went,  we all ordered different items and drinks.  All were pleased with their meals.  The chips, salsa, bean dip along the the guacamole, made at table side were great.    Pricing was reasonable.  I would return if in town again.

On a company business trip to Las Vegas and we decided to come here and since its highly recommended to us.  We were greeted and got us a table right away upon arrival. With chips, salsa and beans with water. The drinks was very good. The menu selection made very difficult to choose. Food was very good, our group ordered different things so we can taste from each plate. The service staff was excellent and attentive. Most definitely come back here again.

Great Mexican food off of the strip. It's a short cab ride and was recommended to me by a local. There are a lot menu items to choose from, even some that are very traditional Mexican.   I had the Carne Asada which was very tasty, cooked perfectly and with the homemade tortillas were fantastic.  Nora, the bartender, had great service and made a really good margarita.   I would recommend this place to anyone in the Vegas area.
Food is DELICIOUS and the staff ultra friendly and accommodating. Love this place!

Love the ambiance but i think it was the ambiance that made the food taste good.  Food was on the bland side.   I got the steak fajita and i prefer the steak fajita served at Chilis. It was very bland and steak was over cooked. I mean overcooked to well done and i don't believe anybody should eat steak well done.  I will definitely be back for the ambiance and hope that the next dish I order isn't like the fajita.

Years ago this place was the greatest. Unfortunately, I can't say the same anymore. I use to love the vibe here and live music, but the service went downhill along with their food. We were seated right next to the music so I couldn't even hear the person next to me. The flavor of the food was was off, chicken was chewy, orders were wrong, and the kids meal was not eatable. The only plus to my dinner was the margarita I ordered. Maybe the restaurant was having an off day... but it made me not want to go back ever.
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Great Fideo soup, enchiladas and tamales. Don't forget to try the Sophie's

Good food and great portions. They keep the fresh tortilla chips with beans and salsa coming. I got the pollo con rajas y crema, which was freaking awesome. Oh, and you get a free margarita if you check in.

Not bad.  Living in LA and having this place suggested for dinner, I thought 'meh', but it was pretty good.  Very good service, an old building but clean - food was excellent, with homemade tortillas as a big plus!  Nice to get away from the casinos, thanks Yelpers for the suggestion.

Delicious guacamole made table-side. Staff was prompt and took care of our needs quickly, they seemed to genuinely enjoy their work. Bar service turned out delicious Cadillac margarita's, customized for each of our parties particular tastes with no complaints.

I came to here to eat with my boyfriend and my son and it was a terrible experience. I am vegetarian and didn't see much on the menu, So I decided just ordered a bean and rice burrito with some sides  (sour cream, pico De gallo) and some chicken tenders for my son. My boyfriend's dinner looked great but ours looked horrible. First, for my burrito looked like they just slapped down a cold tortilla with some cheap yellow (yes yellow) lettuce from the 99 cent store. It wasn't even presentable o could have made that myself at home for what they charged me. My son's dinner was just insulting. They came out with some fries and the chicken tenders  (which says they are homemade) , the chicken tenders were literally the little dinosaurs in the frozen aisle of the grocery store!! I ripped them open and they were still cold shaped exactly like the dinosaurs!!! It was ridiculous! So i told the waiter and he went to the back to see what's going on and he came back didn't apologize or anything he juat said would you like something else in place of this? I said no we do not want to pay for the tenders just the fries, he took it off the receipt. At least he did that. In any place, I will not be coming back to this place. It was the worse experience. If you bring your child please don't order off the kids menu , total rip off.

Went here for lunch with my co-workers and it was a great experience. The food is phenomenal and the service is top notch. We will definitely be returning for lunch and I plan to bring my family in for dinner some time as well. Definitely worth a visit!

I really like the food here.  My standard is the Tacos con Carne Asada.  It;s very similar to Tacos al Carbon which is grilled meat, with rice & beans.    I also like the bean dip and salsa they provide for free. Refills are no problem and the service when I've there (3 times) has been quick and friendly.    The last two times there was a guy on an electric keyboard playing which was (ahem) interesting.  Depends on your musical taste, but played a lot of cheesy 70's toons.  Overall solid choice for Mexican, I'll be back.

Yes! Yes! Yes! Si! Si! Si! I put hot sauce on my burrito babay!!! Make sure you try the fresh made guacamole! Can't go wrong with anything you try but if your unsure. Ask your friendly server and they will certainly lead you to a tasty choice!

My favorite mexican restaurant. Atmosphere is awesome. Food is unlike what you get at other restaurants its authentic mexican food. The peach Margarita is my favorite! I love fried ice cream and Bonita's makes theirs the best. Its on fire when it comes to the table. Very cool! Waiters and waitresses are very fast and always tell you "see you tomorrow" as you leave. Bonus soup before your meal. Cost is very affordable. Very clean restsurant. Love this place!! Wish they had a location in North Las Vegas.

The atmosphere here is beautiful. The building itself looks straight out of Mexico. The paintings on the wall are astounding and even the tables and chairs go with the overall theme of the restaurant.   I've ordered to go from here several times, I always end up getting Timo's Grandeto Burrito on the A La Carte menu (11.99) and it's HUGE! It could feed me for breakfast, lunch, and dinner!  On top of that, their green habeñero sauce is amazing. I did stop in once to dine in on a Sunday night, they had live music (which was wonderful, might I add) and the server was amazing! When we first walked in however, the hostess did not even acknowledge us but she was with another customer so I let that slide and hope that next time that doesn't happen.   Overall, this place is amazing. If you're craving some great Mexican food with a beautiful atmosphere this is the place!!

This place was great! The ambience and decor reminded me of my Abuela's house, and the staff was super nice and friendly. They gave us complimentary chips, salsa, beans, AND sopa de fideo. The food itself was great and was a nice reminder of home and home cooked meals. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for authentic Mexican food.
Amazing food, great atmosphere, fair prices. This place has great tasting classic Mexican dishes. I've been coming here since I was a kid and will continue!!

We were so surprised at how excellent this restaurant was. We had no idea. The food and service were impeccable. We had taken guests out to a well known steak house the night before and the food here was 100 times better than the fancy steak house. The service was much better too. The food we all had was great, the atmosphere was perfect and the music was very enjoyable. We have found one of our new favorite Mexican restaurants and the prices were great too and offer such value for the high quality food you get.
I ordered the Machaca con Huevos; Superb! However, the service was super slow though. Because the food is so good and authentic, I give them a pass.

I tried this place cause every time I drive by it the parking lot is always full. I can't say it was disappointing but average Mexican food price was kinda high for the portion given. It not a place I would think of again or recommend when asked about a good Mexican food spot.

First Time here.. reviews seemed great but over all service is was killed it for me. Our waitress was really rude and kept ignoring us when we would ask for refills, chips and sauce and made it seem like it was our fault for not asking.

I went to Vegas with a large group of friends, and we decided to try this place out after it being highly recommended. The recommendation did not disappoint. It is about a couple miles off of the strip, and is situated in the middle part of a suburban area.   As soon as we got there, it was evident that this was going to be a great restaurant judging by how packed it was. There were nothing but locals here, and the waiters/waitresses were great! They were really funny and accommodating. There was live music playing in the background and I think there must have been at least 4 birthday celebrations while we were there. They make a huge deal about birthdays and even bring out the tambourines.  The food was excellent (I highly recommend the Steak Al Cilantro), the service was great, and the atmosphere was fun.  The prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get. Oh yeah, did I mention they give you fresh made tortillas?   Try this place out for some great Mexican food! You will not be disappointed!

For me being in Vegas 30 Years now..this is the best by far all around restaurant..food..service..its always packed for that reason! Tho its quite large inside and have never had to wait. The ambiant..decor is stunning! The waiters are 1st class and can handle even the worst drunk customer with the up most class! A must try..you will not be disappointed. Everything here as far as the food is to die for!!!!  And on top of that they can satisfy any special requests too...the sopapillas are the best..I always end up ordering like 3 orders..haha!  It has a casual and refined and relaxed feel..they just got it right!!!! What else can I say?

No, no, no. Not for me.   - They got our order wrong 3 times.  - Forgot our requested condiments. - Drink refills were hard to come by.  - Lumpy and uneven booth seating. - Flies!  - Live band was wayyyy loud- sporadically. - Waiters were just standing around and talking.  - Bland food!  Will not be coming back.

Been enjoying this place for years!  I am not sure if i should review today's experience or combine my overall opinion.  Today there was a VERY long wait for our food.  This is not typical so I am not going to give less than 4 stars.

Ok it feels wrong to add stars for this reason, but I'm doing it anyways. As my coworkers have a borderline obsession with this place, I'm learning to adapt. I'm on a loose sort of "diet" (very strong word), I'm really trying to avoid Mexican food joints as they are very hard to eat semi-healthy at.   As I stared hard at the menu searching desparately for something I could call "diet".. I did notice they have a diet section, but all the food sounded bland and too well diety for my taste. I decided to try the lunch special called chicken #9 ($9.99 with soda). It rocked! It was chicken marinated in garlic, spices, chilis and it was full of flavor but light on the spice (just my style). It was served with guac, rice, beans, and tortillas (hardly diet food, but just noting you could eat this as a full calorie dish as you desire). Some of the best grilled chicken I've had in awhile... yay for a mexicn place that has something on the menu not full of lard !
Seriously! Why would anyone ever go to Lindo.... So they can pay double for 1/2 the flavor?  Bonitos is the best.  Cheap, yummy, fun, great service! Eat here!  Get the pollo sarendeado tia esther!

Gaudy, loud, bright colors and stereo-typical Americanized Mexican restaurant. Average all the way around. The chips are normal, the salsa is non-offensive, even the salsa that was supposed to be 'hot' wasn't any different that a typical jarred salsa. Refried beans with lard, orange rice with frozen veggies in it.. you get the picture. Nothing that would drive you back there. The prices are ok - we had 4 adults and 2 kids eat for $110, which included 2 beers and 2 margaritas.  Those margaritas are pre-blended. - pretty gross really. However, we sat at the bar waiting for our party and they pour a serious shot, so order tequila and hope for the best. Even though it is off the strip, its not authentic by any means.
The food was great but they refused to honor my free Margarita offer for checking in via yelp. No bueno.

This place has AMAZING Mexican food!!! Serving portions were big and the prices were right! Be sure to check in on YELP for a free margarita, then vote for them through text and receive a SECOND free margarita!!! Can't beat that!!   I showed up with a friend who was having his birthday dinner there and our server "Richard" took great care of us. He was funny, entertaining, and attentive to our needs. He recommended the prime rib carne asada plate and it definitely did not disappoint! He kept the drinks coming and even showed us how to get the free margaritas on the house by voting on text and checking in through YELP.  He also recommended the sampler special and made us fresh guacamole and dip at the table side. Real funny guy also.  If you show up at dinner you also get treated to listen to their one man mariachi band on the keyboard doing his thing lol. 5 stars for EXCELLENT service. Will definitely be back if I'm craving for some Mexican food!
Good authentic food with reasonable price. They have exceptional service with live band... I will definitely come back here with my fam... Have to try their fresh  guacamole made to order...
Good service, good food, good drinks, good times. Authentic. Not too far from the strip.

Came here again and as per usual, the food is great and so was service. Unfortunately our eyes are bigger than our stomachs so we didnt manage to finish our meals. If we had a fridge and microwave in our hotel we would have taken home the leftovers. The tableside guac is a nice touch and made to your tastes.
Great food and fun atmosphere. If you enjoy good Mexican food in a nice setting please check this place out.
Came here to finish our vegas trip randomly found it on yelp ! Food is so good cant get more authentic . Service js great !! Dont forget to check in for your free margarita!
This place was really amazing. They have a great menu and very creative dishes. I had the fillet relleno, wash it down with a ice cold michelada and you're set.

Not a ton of vegetarian options, but I had their veggie fajitas, and they didn't disappoint.  The service was great, and the place has a nice vibe to it.  The only thing that surprised me was when one of the (typically Strip) photographers approached my friend and I and asked if we wanted pictures.  We're locals, and just friends, so... no thanks.  I thought this locale might've been off the Strip enough to escape that phenomenon, but apparently not.  I'm not irritated by it; actually my friend and I thought it was funny.  Anyway, a solid choice for Mexican food in town; I'm sure I'll be back at some point.

How awesome is it you get a free margarita with just your check-in! This is not a watered-down drink...it's a delicious and refreshing blended margarita!  Anyways... onto the review. As usual, I will split the review is three basic areas:  Facilities: Very clean and inviting, with an authentic flair. Sitting in this restaurant makes you forget you are in Vegas! Centrally located, its a great restaurant to visit if you are in the mood for some great food.  Service: There is an opportunity in this area. Although our drinks were always full and bussing was prompt, the staff could have been a bit friendlier. Do not expect smiles from your waiter.  Food: Probably some of the best Mexican food in Vegas. Any item on the menu is fresh and delicious! Do yourself a favor and try and try either the chicken or the steak with cognac sauce... it is out of this world!!!

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after work and LOVED it!!!  I think our waiter name was "Israel" and he was so so helpful, funny, and courteous. Not only did we get free seconds on the bean dip and salsa, we got free soup too! He also hooked my boyfriend up with a flavored margarita instead of the regular house kind. They also helped me with certain Spanish words and answered all of my annoying questions! Lol! We even got our picture taken and printed on a free coupon!   The food was excellent! No complaints what so ever!   The restroom cleanliness was about a 4 out of 5.

I have to remember, just because its near my house doesn't mean it's gonna be better!  Viva Michoacan and Lindo Michoacan  have such better food an atmosphere, I've learned my lesson to take the extra time and gas and get some good food.  Our waiter was friendly, and full of energy, he made the experience better.  The free tortilla chips were dark and over fried, also tasteless. The bean dip and salsa were okay, just seemed not as hot (spicy). The fideo soup was watery with about 20 noodles in it, I mean, it is so cheap to make fideo and this is what I get? I got a Soft Beef Taco and a Crunchy Chicken Taco, there was so much lettuce and shreded cheddar cheese on top I had to dig my way to my tacos. Both were edible and had a good amount of meat but didn't have much taste even after I drenched them in salsa. The crunchy taco was a little greasy. I actually thought they'd be more like street tacos since that's what I'm served at the sister restaurants. My husband got the Carne Asada Burrito, but he had them add cheese and mole sauce which they gladly did, it was okay, but was still missing something...especially some heat (spice).  I won't be going back, especially since there are so many better mexican restaurants.

Stopped in for a quick lunch and the service was amazing.Their soup is so tasty and the food is just as good. I will for sure recommend this place for a great Traditional Mexican Meal.Ill be frequenting this stop more often.

The lunch was outstanding!  My wife had the Chicken Sopes, I had the De Cammaron Cocktail with shrimp, oysters and squid!  The serves was good, the bus girl Monica looked unhappy and had frown on her face the whole time.  In the past we have had Pedro as the bus boy and that guy set the bar high with great service and a smile, Monica not so much!  It was one of the best lunches in town, I  would recommend their food to everyone!
Update:   Violeta, while still full of awesomeness, only works the day shift now.  If you visit in the evening Evelyn (Evie) rocks!

This is my favorite place to get Mexican food. I live in Salt Lake City and make it a point to come here at least once every time I come to Vegas. The guacamole is awesome, they make it fresh at your table.

I recently moved from Cali and was looking for some bomb Mexican food. I definitely found it here. The whole family was pleased. They give you chips, salsa and beans as soon as you sit down. Than they bring you tomato Fidel soup. Oh my so yummy. The customer service here is off the chart. all the way around.

Great food and service. I sat at the bar and ordered margaritas and chile relleno and a taco. The bartender was very attentive and personable. Good conversation with a couple of the locals. Very friendly atmosphere would definitely come back.
My favotiate Mexican in Vegas! Since I moved here it's the one neighborhood spot I always come to. The staff is great and food never fails me.

Food was excellent the staff is super nice the drinks are amazing very clean love there bathrooms there are so pretty, but the food is super authentic Mexican food love this location in Summerland it was super nice

Yum!!! I love that they serve beans with the tortilla chips. If you order a combination meal they serve fideo soup with it which is tasty! I like to order the #5 Santa Clara (enchilada, tostada and taco) with rice and beans which don't disappoint. I like the huevos rancheros too. Friendly service and fun atmosphere! The mariachi band is great!

Excellent vibe here! Came here for my boyfriends birthday and they have live singers! The food was incredibly tasty. I ate it all before I could take a photograph! More so the guava margaritas are to Die for. Not too sweet and perfect! Our waiter Nacho was friendly and attentive even though his side of the restaurant was jammed  packed! They even have a mariachi band to come sing for the birthday boy with a free shot of tequila!

My lunch was delicious! The service was fast, our waiter Julio was very courteous, and the rest rooms were clean. I recommend this place for people who are looking for something off the strip when visiting Vegas.
Extremely friendly and made me feel like i was at michoacan. I loved it! Food was delicious. We checked in and received a free margarita.  great place if you are looking for great mexican place!

Delicious, traditional, conventional (non-fusion) Mexican food. REALLY friendly servers. Try the Gringo challenge. If I can do it, you can too (you'll see).  Really, the food was quite good, and I'm a snobby Californian saying that.
Hostess and Server were awesome, gave suggestions and the Cilantro steak was so delicious! We asked him to customize and it was perfectly cooked and amazing. Best place for real Mexican food!

Yet another great experience, just when I thought it couldn't get any better...we tried the seafood combo plate..... Wow!! It was absolutely delicious. Its enough food to feed 3-4 people. We washed it all down with climato prepped beer! Another favorite of mine. Overall great food, nice atmosphere and friendly staff. I highly recommend Bonito Michoacán.

Very good food and great portion:price ratio. -1 star for slight inconsistencies at every visit. Sometimes the beans are more runny, and sometimes the salsa is more watery than other times. Sometimes the Chile relllenos are completely stuffed with cheese, and sometimes there's much less. When. It's very busy and they have large parties, the smaller tables can be forgotten about regarding refills. Minor things like this can be easily overlooked because the taste and quality is always great and staff is always friendly.
Our family enjoyed dining here. All our our were perfect potion. Service is pretty good too.

Nice atmosphere and great service.  They had live music for Mother's Day which added to the experience.  Even though the restaurant was very busy, all the staff seemed to be in a great mood.  I came here expecting a great experience all together, but I can't say I did and it's only because of the fish I got.  The drink I got was a bit strong as well, but I'm not one to complain about that!  I do hope to return and give this place a second chance because I do like the Michoacán in Centennial Hills.  Just don't get the garlic fish.

Bonito Michoacan -  Consistent excellent service, food, and affordable selections. (I'm getting hungry just thinking about your menu) So this is what we are experiencing. We like to take our visiting guest out to a nice dinner (affordable). Throughout the years that we have been taking our guest to your restaurant, you have never let us down.  So now, we have created clientele for you driving in from the Bay Area, California wanting to dine at your restaurant.  We will see you soon as our California family member wishes to celebrate her 17th birthday at your restaurant.  Thank you for all the great food, awesome service, and the smiles you bring to my family.
I was part of a big group on Cinco de Mayo. Great food and great service!! The staff didn't miss a beat. Too bad that their parking lot is so small.

This was a recommendation from one of my coworkers and I decided we would stop in there after work the other day and get dinner...   First thing is first, the building is not the prettiest of places but i guess it fits the overall feel of the place, you walk in and 2 young ladies dressed in old Mexican dress great you and get you seated, the waiter then came by to see us and offer us drinks.. Let me stop and say that the waiter was extremely friendly and on top of every aspect of our meal. We ordered a Margarita and waters with the Table side Guacamole for an appetizer. this was probably the best guacamole i gave ever had. The meal also comes with not only your entree but you get sopa de fideo with every combo plus beans and rice, My grandma used to make sopa de fideo before she passed and it tasted just like her.  memories!!!    Okay so now that my review has turned into one long run on sentence I will just finish by saying the meals are huge, tasty and fairly priced, I definitely recommend this place if you like Mexican food and great service.
We are from the Rio Grande Valley  on the border of Mexico and this was the most authentic food  I have ever had.  Fantastic  service  really cute waitresses, and  very cold beer.  Well done

After an all day trip to Death Valley and back my aunt recommended this place.  First and foremost the atmosphere and customer service was exceptional.  I had the Uruapan combo which had green pork and bean burrito, beef enchilada, and chicken taco.  A very tasty and esoteric medley.  I will certainly be recommending and experiencing this place again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Firstly, I really like this place! Now down to brass tacks:  Food: I've been here twice, and the second time was specifically because of how much I loved the food. The green enchilada sauce is amazing, as well as the citrus marinated carnitas. I had some huevos con machaca tonight (breakfast for dinner!) and it was great! Oh! The flour (have not tried the corn yet) tortillas are very good.  Margaritas are made with fresh squeezed lime juice rather than a bottle or gun of sour mix. Very tasty. The chips are very disappointing and so is the salsa. This is the only reason I could not rate it 5 stars.  Service: This is some of the best service I've seen in a while. The staff (bus staff included) truly want to make sure that you have a great time and love every minute.  Atmosphere: While the typical Mexican restaurant theme is the basis for the atmosphere, it is done well and does not feel "cheesy." Pretty quiet most of the time, but can get loud when busy (of course).  Can't wait to go back!
Great place to eat! Excellent authentic Mexican food  sope, enchiladas, taquitos, burritos & carnitas michoacan
Hands down best Mexican in Las Vegas! Food & service is always great. Staff is super happy & on point. Everything is delicious! No complaints!
This place is great!  Huge portions, great service and awesome food.  The decor has a little to be desired here but who gives a flying F when the food is this good?  Awesome lunch specials too.
I cannot be bothered with this one, anyone who has wait staff add more to their tip than I wrote down cannot be surprised with one star

Bonito Michoacan is simply the best. We come here every time we come here everytime we come to visit from California. Everything is absoultely delicious and we bring everyone here everytime we come. Homemade fresh delicious taste this restaraunt can not be beat. It is the best mexican food in all of Las Vegas Nevada.

Great place for music, drinks and mariscos very friendly. Friends and I stop by for dinner on our vacation to vegas we had verity of food.  Coctel de camaron, agua chile, ostiones, camarones al mojo de ajo, margaritas, vampiros everything was as expected good great taste drinks on point, deftly will eat at this please on my next vacation to sin city.
Excellent service! Violetta section the best ! Excellent food , great place to enjoy family
Best food in town! Make sure to request Richard as your server, he's the best!!  And special bday dance for the ladies  Don't forget to order table side guacamole and queso fondido
I don't remember what the specific name of dessert but it was their version of bananas foster was $7 and worth it ... perfect amount of bananas ice cream and alcohol.

The staff was so friendly and welcoming. We just happened to stumble upon this place(Glad we did). Food was great! I really liked the Mexican feel and the live music: a guy playing a keyboard and singing..not loud so you can still talk and enjoy the atmosphere
good place to eat mexican food. ambience is also pretty cool. i feel like im in mexico lol.

If you are in Las Vegas please come to this mexican restaurant it is the best. Great service and wonderful tasting food at its finest. The best service I have had here were from Nacho and Gabriel. Gracias chicos son de lo mejor, cada vez que venga ha las vegas vendre visitarlos

Proud to make this my first ever Yelp review. This place is one of the few restaurants I've ever been to that give you a full on "experience" from beginning to end. A group of friends and I in our travels dropped in due to a free margarita promotion and the party started with our awesome waiter, Richard. Then I - a black guy - took on the Gringo challenge (not spoiling it, go and take it on yourself) and got another free drink! The food was top notch and pardon the misogyny but the ladies are gorgeous too, please respect them as they want to make sure your time there is optimal with pictures and drinks as well. I'd type more but the tequila is working  go here!!!

Out of the way restaurant -- in more of a residential area -- but the food and service are great. Extensive menu. Never had a bad meal here. Try it. You'll like it. And a big hug to the lady who hand makes the fresh tortillas -- to die for. Love her.

Even better food than the Lindo location in Henderson just without the view.    Consistently good food and lively atmosphere.  Our server Mimi was awesome.  She was engaging, funny and took great care of us.  We will ask for her next time we go here.    The food is super fresh, well prepared and plenty of it.  The tortillas are amazing and we can't get enough of them.  This is my favorite place when I want Mexican food.

This place caught my eye Becuase of its colorful exterior building design outside. I mentioned this place up to my girlfriend ,and so she decided to take me here on a Sunday lunch. We had this excellent waiter which I totally forgot his name. But he was very friendly and explained everything on the menu. We checked in on Yelp to receive our free margaritas which was awesome. He only downfall about this place was just the ceviche tasted a little watered down but my main dish made up for this restaurant. The steak was really juicy with my side of salsa to balance the flavor. Complimentary chips and salsa of course is the best.

Love the food here! One of the best mexican in town hands down. Service and time to wait for the food though NEEDS WORK. The staff does not really know how to coordinate seating and we had 3 different waiters come to our table almost every time i ate here. Otherwise highly recommended for good authentic mex.

Good food with genuine flavor, good variety of items on the menu, and the waitstaff was nice and attentive. Minor complaint--very noisy where we were seated, making it hard to have a conversation at times!   After being in the area a few days and always seeing lots of cars parked out here, we gave it a try--figured it must be good with it always being crowded!

Even though my husband and I have been here several times because it's the closest mexican restaurant to where we live...I will still give it 3 stars. Out of the about 6 or 7 times we've been there, food is always GREAT and Fresh...but unfortunately, we've never had great service. Either something is forgotten, they don't come around often enough to check on us, they bring out the wrong order, etc. I hate to only give this location 3 stars because the food is so good...but as far as the overall experience, I hate feeling "forgotten about" or a "burden" because I ask for a refill on my drink, then have to wait for 15 min to get it. : /

My family and I absolutely love Mexican food and this is a great spot we've been coming to for years! The margaritas are very delicious and the food is quite traditional!The staff is very attentive and I look forward to coming back very soon!

Tired of Toxic Bell, or restaurants that claim to be Mexican, but serve food that can be found nowhere in Mexico? Then this is THE place for you, even if you can't pronounce the restaurant's name!  The menu includes all the dishes you'd expect at an American restaurant: burritos, tacos, fajitas et cetera et cetera, blah blah blah. But the enormous menu, literally pages long, includes many dishes you've probably never heard of, unless you happen to have spent a lot of time in Mexico.  Your meal starts out with complimentary chips, refried beans and very VERY spicy salsa. It was a bit much, even for me, but our server very happily and quickly replaced it with a slightly tamer version. The chips are made in-house, as are the tortillas, a nice touch that makes a big difference.  We ordered from the lunch menu, which is available from 11:00 to 3:00. It contains a plethora of items from the dinner menu at different price ranges, and doesn't include some of the extras that the dinner menu provides, like the bowl of chicken noodle soup that comes with the pricier dinner menu items.  If there's shrimp on the menu, you KNOW that's what I'll have. I've had the Camarones Borrachos (drunken shrimp), made with tequila and simply delicious, but not available on the lunch menu (I could have ordered from the dinner menu, but couldn't justify that much $$ for lunch), so I ordered the Camarones Saradeados, large shrimp cooked perfectly in a sauce that I'd never heard of. It's made from roasted peppers, undisclosed spices and a touch of mayonnaise, and they could bottle this stuff and make a fortune selling it! It was in the pricier category, but worth every peso and then some! My husband, whose palate is more conventional, ordered chicken fajitas, which came to table beautifully charred and sizzling. Both orders included beans, rice and house-made guacamole, the fajitas came with those yummy house-made tortillas. We had margaritas with lunch, labeled small but actually ample.  The restaurant itself is clean, well located, and with ample parking. The service is friendly and prompt, and the prices are reasonable. The voluminous menu includes Mexican delicacies like beef tongue, and they offer menudo on the weekends for those of you who may have partied a leeeeeetle too hard on the Strip the night before. It's a local place that, unfortunately for them, is unknown to tourists. If you're here from out of town misbehaving though, this is one off-Strip place that's definitely worth the short taxi ride - it's just minutes from the Strip. Do NOT miss this jewel!

Nice sit down Mexican restaurant with good food and decent prices. I drive by this place almost everyday so I decided to give it a try. Came here on a Saturday night around 8pm. Place is very large and can seat a lot of people. There were some people having dinner here but it wasn't too crowded. The inside decor sort of reminded me of a red lobster lol. One thing that's cool about the decor is there are picture decorations on top of the tables and with matching chairs at each table. My server was "Lorenzo" I think. Service was very good and fast and the waiter were funny and entertaining. There was an old man providing live Latin music in both English and Spanish. While I normally don't like live music with my dinner, the artist was very good (he gets 5 stars). They give chips and salsa at the start. Their menu is very large and they have pictures for a lot of items which I assume are the more popular ones. I got the steak cilantro which came with rice, beans, salad, and guacamole, and tortillas. The plate was huge probably should be shared by 2 people. Definitely a must try at this restaurant. I got a fried ice cream for dessert but I don't think the ice cream is actually fried. It tasted like vanilla ice cream with a corn flake cereal coating. The vanilla ice cream was delicious but I wanted more of a crispy shell. Overall, I was very happy I decided to try this place out. Definitely come here if you're craving Mexican food. The portions are generous, the food is delicious, and at a decent price.

Found them online, got takeout from them tonight.  One star less as they forgot a single fish taco in our order, but everything else came as ordered and was excellent. They may have the best guacamole I've tasted outside my own kitchen. Great refrieds and all else was very good. Super friendly on the phone and at pickup.
Great spot. Love the fideo soup they bring out and the tableside guac. Good atmosphere. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend.

Ordered a Shirley Temple and didn't get something close. No cherries either. The Ceviche tasted and looked like imitation shrimp and the tostadas that came with it were so hard you could have broken a tooth.I found stems from the avocado in my Ceviche. I had to ask for a refill, more chips and the bill. The over weight sweaty waiter was not friendly at all. The only friendly one in there was the female waitress with blonde hair. She's a gem stuck in that hole. Wish I could post a pic but it's not giving me an option.

Well, I think I know why their other location closed down...  We had very bad customer service this time around. We have been to the other location that got closed down (Viva Michoacan in Henderson). It took forever for them to take our order, the waiter forgot about my guacamole & sour cream, they forgot to refill my boyfriend's soda and my friend pronounced the very long Spanish word that supposedly earned him a free margarita...which they never brought.  Yes, I'm Mexican so let me say that the food is mediocre. I think you'd had better luck going to Pepe's Tacos down the street. The beans needed salt and. I felt that they were like Rosarito beans that you get from a can and just heat up. I don't understand why all their burritos are smothered in sauce and cheese. that's more of a enchilada...and if I wanted an enchilada I'd order one. A burrito is meant to be eaten with hands, not with a fork.

First time i been there honesty the waiters are very nice and the food taste so good. Shrimp cocktail is alright to compare to others i have. Tostadas of shrimp are the bomb and also we had other plates which i heard they were  delicious. Agua frescas were good. I would recommend to someone else to come and eat there.

Me and my family are regulars here. The food is good and the service is awesome, especially if you have Ricardo as your waiter. If you are a seafood lover you must try the fish enpanada with their creamy sauce on top. If you are into steak their new York strip with cilantro sauce is very good. Hubby and I really enjoy the Oyster with ceviche on top (they are not stingy with the shrimp).  We do birthday dinners here ALL the times because we love the atmosphere.  For birthdays the waiters and waitress get together and do a band like show for the birthday person, love it! Thank you guys for a pleasant experience we will see you soon

Had a nice lunch with my sisters on a Sunday afternoon around 12pm. Busy, busy, busy!  The food is always very delicious which receives a 5 Star, but I rated this review a 4 Star because the servers were not very attentive and seemed like they really didnt care. Upon checking in on yelp, you can receive one free house margarita, which we showed to the waiter. He wanted to take our phones to the bartender...Whoa...ah, no you cannot take our phones to the bar(which was on the other side of the restaurant! Would you let a person who you did not know, take your phone and your sisters to the bar? No! LOL. So, I had to walk all the way to the bar and show the bartender myself. I thought that was weird and not very professional. Anyways, after that incident, it seemed like the waiter became dis-interested. Our water glasses were never refilled, had to continually ask for a refill of the salsa and chips, and when we were presented our check, he just set it down and never said thank you. Ok, I know they were very busy, but it just seemed like he could careless. We would have left a higher tip, but felt like we really weren't treated very well(we have been dining here for years).  All in all, the food is great and I will continue to dine here.
The food in general is pretty great, but the home made flour tortillas!!! Oh my goodness. I'd come back for those alone. Great service and atmosphere.
Excellent guac, and the shrimp and avocado salad was delicious. Very busy with locals for lunch.

If you were a fan of Viva Michoacan on Sunset, you're probably still crying about its close.  Well, dry those tears!  This place has recipes that are similar, if not the same, as Viva!  The soup, tortillas, and dishes like Shrimp Dionisia and Chicken Zirahuen are to die for.  And the service!  Our waiter was so nice - you truly feel welcome there.  And if that wasn't enough, there was a man playing music, too!  Excellent Mexican food, excellent service, and prices way better than the Lindo in GVR.  We will drive out of our way to Bonita whenever we want the best.  PS- Football fans - there are TVs everywhere!

What has happened to this restaurant?  Just two years ago when my husband and I discovered it just blocks from the Rio Hotel and Casino, we were thrilled to have a great Mexican meal so close to the strip.  When we ate there in November we thought the food was not the same quality that we had just a few months before Then my daughter and I tried it in February and it was worse.  I ordered the steak Fajitas.  They arrived on a cold plate, not sizzling like they normally do.  There were 9 small pieces of beef, three small pieces of onion and 3/4 of the Fajitas consisted of bell peppers.  The Fajitas were flavorless.  No seasoning, just cooked meat and peppers.  What a disappointment.  We noticed on the menu that if you want more chips and salsa, you must now pay $2.99 for them.  What a ripoff since the bowl of chips is small and was about  1/2 full.  Ricardo's is at the corner of Decatur and Flamingo and I hear it is better thanBointo Michoacan.
Waiter was great, food... not so much. Shrimp were really over cooked. Standard "Americanized" Mexican fare. We won't be back.

This place is fantastic. Very Mexican looking, a large restaurant with plenty of seating.  Staff is wonderful and very attentive all the time. They have an extensive menu and their food is really good.  They even make plates that are not listed in the menu. I always get the "Pollo Milanesa".  They have a live band as well.  Their tortillas are so so so fresh and so so so yummy. You can have a soup with your plate as well.  Their prices are great and you get a lot of food. Their chips are really good and they come with salsa and bean dip.
The food was really good especially the salsa  rice & beans and the servers were very nice
Not really much to say.... Really good food excellent customer service and one if the best wetback burrito spots in town

The food is authentic and the service was great! We went on a Saturday late morning while it was busy the service was better than anticipated. The portions are generous and the ambiance is clean and cheerful.  If you like spicy ask for the habanero salsa it was tasty with a strong kick. Overall a must try when in Vegas its a short drive away from the strip but well worth it.

What can I say? Girlfriend wanted to go to a Mexican restaurant and heard some good reviews from some of my coworkers at work so I decided to give it a shot. Immediately we were greeted at the door and a booth was found for the two of us. We ordered our drinks, and then chips and bean dip and salsa (which we did not both particularly care for) sat in front of us. The fideo soup was simply amazing, and was complementary as well. She ordered the carnitas plate with beans and rice and guacamole. 10/10 for that. I ordered the Pollo Al Cognac. 10/10 has well. The carnitas was better in my opinion, but both dishes were extremely flavorful. We took our dessert home with us since after the beans, fideo soup, and our meal we were absolutely stuffed. I ordered the cheesecake burrito and she ordered flan. She said the Flan was good. I personally do not care for flan at all, so I did not try it.  Food - 10/10 Service - 8/10 (merely for the fact they sat the menu down in front of us and literally 20 seconds later asked us what we wanted. Made me feel slightly rushed) Atmosphere - 9/10 (the live music was a tad bit loud and sometimes I could not hear by date while she was talking to me)  I would definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for a good Mexican restaurant with decent prices and huge portion sizes.

Absolutely the best Mexican food in Las Vegas!  We always stop here when we are in town and it never disappoints!  Juan has hot to be one of the waiters I've ever had.  Upbeat and fun!  Great food!  All around great time!

Ok, first time here for us here. We were greeted with fresh chips, salsa, retried bean dip and sopa de Fideo and two Free Margaritas for checking in! After another long day on the Vegas strip we worked up an appetite. I had a large shrimp and octopus cocktail that was pleasantly loaded with shrimp and octopus. The flavor was great! Same with the Asada. Service was very fast efficient and friendly. Really enjoyed this place

It's so sad I have to change my review. First we walk in and as we waiter a table a lady is talking to what looks like a manager about finding a hair in the god. Uh ok anyways we get our table. The server takes forever! His assistant did most of the work. I got a refil after it had been empty for 10 min. We had to ask for soup, which was served the same time as our food. My mother in law got nachos which was just cheese and jalapeños. No beans? I could've made those nachos at home. I'll be going somewhere else for Mexican food :/. It was nice knowing ya for 10 yrs

Well....out of all the Michoacan family of restaurants, I would rank this my #3 choice, with Viva being #1 and Lindo being #2.  There's a couple of reasons for this -  1.) Viva gives you complimentary fideo soup when requested. If it doesn't come with an entree, Bonito charges you $2.50 for it. It's good soup but not worth paying $2.50 when it costs probably $.25/cup to make.  2.) The customer service is off par from the rest. I experienced a rude, short tempered server today at lunch. When I advised my meal came out wrong, he refuted "well this is the way you told me you wanted it!". Well, actually that's not the way I told you and I wouldn't be telling you it was wrong if you just listened the first time. My last visit, when I asked the question "what is fundido dip?" I was treated like I was stupid for not knowing. It was off putting. 3.) The busser was kind but she was bad at refilling drinks. My one pet peeve is drink refills. Don't keep me hanging.... 4.) The chips and bean dip that come out are bland. Do they use different chips & dip than the other Michoacan resturants? I'm not certain but they don't taste as good here.   There are good things about the resturant as well -   1.) They have an extensive Mexican themed menu with many options for even the pickest of eaters. My favorites are the beef chimichangas and the beef flour flautas. Their spanish rice is decent and their refried beans are good & consistent. I tried my friends carne asada steak today and it was juicy and yummy. Their homemade flour tortillas are delish! 2.) They run resonably priced lunch specials. For two of us, we escaped at around $20.00...not bad for a sit down lunch.  3.) It seemed as though before our tushs hit the seats that there were chips and dip on the table. We were immediately asked what we would like to drink. Very speedy in this regard. 4.) Pleasant hostess staff, large restaurant seating areas and a full service bar.

Carne asada tacos- 3/5 stars. Just average.  Lengua tacos- 4/5 stars. It was tender and delicious.  Fresh churros- 5/5 stars. I'd like to come back just for the desert and that's it.   I think overall it's not a bad place, but there wasn't too much of a standout item for me besides the desert and lengua tacos.

Omg where should I begin ? This by far one of the best Mexican restaurants I been too ! Unfortunately It isn't located in Cali!! The service is amazing and out server JULIO !!! Amazing!!! Best customer service ever !!! We absolutely enjoyed the experience!! Don't miss out on this gem!!
Great environment and service . The ribeye and lobster plate is amazingly good, chips And salsa are also bomb ..

This place is delicious!!!  The atmosphere is very traditional and expected. The food was amazing. Had the tamal and enchilada and it was amazing!!  The wait staff was pretty quick. Our waiter was a bit inattentive but I won't hold it against the restaurant.  Definitely worth checking out!!  Next time trying the mangoneada and tamarind ma
Great customer service and amazing food. I come here every week for happy hour. Best prices in town.

I think you'll notice in many of the reviews you see comments on how exceptional the service is at this location and I completely agree! Our server, Richard, was totally awesome and boosted this from a 4 star to a 5 star review. He was super friendly, helpful, attentive and made some bad-ass guacamole! The food was delicious and very authentic according to my latin boyfriend. The homemade tortillas were sooo good, the steak & chicken fajitas very tasty also. We had a great time and will definitely be back for more.

Saw this as the best Mexican restaurant in Nevada, and now is by far my favorite in Las Vegas. Managed to get there for Happy Hour and my girlfriend had the large Cadillac Margarita, and even I liked it, and did not take much to get my girl friend drunk. Also had the  Steak al Cognac (New York steak cooked to taste, sautéed in cognac, mixed with mushrooms, onions, secret spices, a little sour cream and a touch of cognac) 19.99. It was a really great deal, and the sauce was superb. Would definitely recommend this place for their steaks. Forget the steak houses which will charge you a lot more for a steak which is not as good. If you have kids they should love the ambience, and great for adults also. The Sopaipillas were only $3.49 and the Churros were only $3.24 and they were both great.
Carne Asada plate was excellent. The meat was cooked well. Nice and tender. If and when you are in town check this spot out. Service was excellent and Jenny at the bar was very conversational.

My experience here with my family was outstanding. Our waiter was hilarious and he really took care of us. All of our food was SO flavorful and obviously cooked with care. I'm writing this review two years after the fact, so I know that I am leaving out some parts of our experience here, but all I can remember is how delicious and wonderful everything was. Go here, please.

I had my dad's birthday here. The staff was above and beyond accommodating. They allowed all 20 of us to sit and drink a while before ordering. They let us bring balloons and decorations. They split our check into small parties. I cannot say enough how much I appreciate their customer service. To top it all off, they sang happy birthday and gave my dad a 60th birthday shot! Great food, great service, great atmosphere...GREAT, GREAT, GREAT!

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. I'm never really disappointed here and I felt the need to bump them up a star for being my favorite. It's still not the best Mexican restaurant in the world, but it's definitely one of the best in Las Vegas!  Every dish I've tried is delicious and the portions are extremely generous for the price. The menu is ridiculously extensive. There is just too much to choose from sometimes. I try to get someone to share dishes with me so I can get a taste of multiple things.   I enjoy the decor and as a fan of clowns (rare, I know) I actually quite enjoy the back room that is decorated solely with clown figurines and pictures.   Great place for large groups as well. I highly recommend it.
Great authentic mex place! It's impossible to find food like this in NY. Well worth the visit if you're in Vegas!!
Free margaritas food was good but took a bit longer than expected to receive our food

We decided to visit this restaurant based on previous reviews. Living in Southern California, we have visited many great Mexican restaurants and this one is on par! The decor, food, service and bar are awesome! The bar has a great selection of Tequilas from blancos to extra añejos. Their chips and salsa are fresh and the bean dip is an added plus.  The menu has something for everyone from basic Mexican plates to specialty seafood. Great place away from the strip.

Very cute little restaurant. Music isn't overly loud. We sat the bar, very clean. 2 female bartenders were very attentive. Checked in on Yelp and got the free 12 oz margarita. The Steak Cilantro was very yummy and the steak was cooked just the way I asked. Guacamole was tasty. Mangoneada we both loved. Chicken fajita    was delicious according to my bf and they weren't greedy with the chicken like some places. Restroom was clean.
I called all over Las Vegas and this is the only place I found so far that makes homemade flour and corn tortillas so it's definitely worth a stop.
